Label: Education and training - sharing of information
Description: Any person authorised by the relevant legislation may provide information to a person or organisation identified in the legislation for the purpose of enabling or facilitating any relevant function related to education and training.

Label: Education and children's social work - expenditure
Description: A local authority must comply with a request of Secretary of State for information about planned and actual expenditure on education or children's social services functions

Label: Education and training - co-operation with another local authority in delivering section 68 duty
Description: A local authority may co-operate with another local authority in delivering its section 68 duty under the same act.

Label: Education and training - young people and young adults
Description: A local authority must make available to young persons and relevant young adults such services as it considers appropriate to encourage, enable or assist the effective participation of those persons in education or training.

Label: Young person - learning and support agreement
Description: A local authority may enter into a conditional learning and support agreement with a young person.

Label: Education - pupil or student information
Description: The responsible person must provide relevant information about a pupil or student who is attending an educational institution to an English local authority with an education function where that information is required for the provision of services under section 68 and 70 of the same act..

Label: Young person or young adult - information provision
Description: A person or body as defined in the legislation may supply information about a young person or relevant young adult to an English local authority with an education function where that information is required for the provision of services under section 68 and 70 of the same act.

Label: Education and training - provision for 14 - 19 year olds
Description: A local authority must incorporate arrangements as to education and training suitable to the requirements of persons during the period beginning with the start of the academic year in which they attain the age of 15 and ending when they attain the age of 19 into co-operation arrangements under section 10 of the Children Act 2004.

Label: Schools - financial or other assistance to academy
Description: A local authority may provide financial or other assistance in respect of the Academy, including by (a) making payments in respect of some (but not all) of the expenses of maintaining the Academy,  (b) providing premises, goods or services for the Academy, or  (c) by making premises, goods or services available to be used for the purposes of the Academy.

Label: Schools - ceasing maintenance on conversion to academy status
Description: A local authority must cease to maintain a school on the date upon which it converts to Academy status.

Label: Schools - academy property transfer scheme
Description: A local authority must comply with a transfer scheme made by the Secretary of State in respect of property, rights and liabilities of a former maintained school which is becoming an Academy.

Label: Schools - academy board and lodging
Description: A local authority must pay an Academy for the full cost of board and lodging at a child registered there if suitable education cannot be provided elsewhere and the whole or a suitable proportion of those charges where the payment of the charges would involve financial hardship to the child's parent.

Label: Schools - transfer of land to academy
Description: A local authority must comply with a scheme made by the Secretary of State to transfer land from the local authority to an Academy.

Label: Schools - consent of Secretary of State to transfer
Description: A local authority must not dispose of land held for a school or Academy without the consent of the Secretary of State.

Label: Schools - transfer of former academy land
Description: A local authority must not make an appropriation in respect of land held for a school or Academy without the consent of the Secretary of State.

Label: Schools - change of land use
Description: A local authority must inform the Secretary of State in respect of a proposed change of use with regard to land held for school or Academy purposes.

Label: Schools - transfer of land to be legally effective
Description: A local authority must to take steps required by property to law to make the transfer of land legally effective.

Label: Schools - formation of company for academy
Description: The Governing Body of a maintained school may form a company to enter into Academy arrangements or do anything incidental.

Label: Policy - pay policy statement
Description: Local authority must prepare a pay policy statement, annually and have regard to Guidance when doing so.

Label: Policy - Chief Officer remuneration
Description: The authority must comply with its pay policy statement for the financial year in making the determination of  the remuneration of or other terms and conditions applying to a chief officer of the authority

Label: Land of community value - maintenance of list
Description: The local authority must maintain a list of land in its area which has community value.

Label: Land of community value - unsuccessful nominations
Description: The local authority must maintain a list of land that has been unsuccessfully nominated for inclusion in its list.

Label: Land of community value - publication of lists
Description: The local authority must maintain a list of land which is considered an asset of community value and a list of land in its area that has been nominated by an unsuccessful community nomination (as a community asset).      Both lists must be published and made available for free inspection by any person.  A free copy of either list must be provided to any person who asks for a copy.

Label: Land of community value - publication of intended sale
Description: The local authority must edit list of assets of community value to show notification of intended sale and publicise that intended sale and to notify owner of community interest group bidder and to pay compensation in certain circumstances.

Label: Land of community value - disposal moratorium
Description: The local authority has power to enforce the moratorium on the disposal by the owner of land included in a local authority's list of assets of community value.

Label: Land of community value - co-operation between authorities
Description: Where land on the register of community assets spans local authority areas all of those local authorities must co-operate in ensuring compliance with the Act.

Label: Services - expressions of interest in providing
Description: The local authority must publish a list of its services and consider expressions of interest from a relevant body and accept or reject them. Where required by the statute it must also enter into a public tendering process for those services.

Label: Business rates - supplement (BRS)
Description: A local authority may impose a business supplemental rate non-domestic ratepayers to raise money for expenditure on a project that the authority is satisfied will promote economic development in its area.

Label: Business rates - procedures for imposing a BRS
Description: A local authority must draw up and publish an initial prospectus, consult relevant persons, hold a ballot, where relevant,  which approves the imposition and publish a final prospectus which sets out the arrangements for the imposition before imposing a business rate supplement.

Label: Business rates - BRS relief
Description: A levying authority that imposes a BRS may apply such reliefs in relation to the BRS as it thinks appropriate

Label: Business rates - interaction with BID levy where BRS imposed
Description: A levying authority must set rules for the purposes of cases where a person is, by reference to a hereditament, liable for BID levy for the whole or part of a financial year in respect of which the person is, in relation to that hereditament, subject to a BRS imposed by the authority.

Label: Business rates - notice of BRS to billing authority
Description: A levying authority which is not a billing authority must, for each financial year for which it intends to impose a BRS, give a written notice relating to the BRS to each billing authority which is a lower-tier authority in relation to it.

Label: Business rates - calculation of chargeable amount where BRS imposed
Description: The authority must calculate the chargeable amount which each person who is to be subject to a BRS imposed for a financial year is to be liable to pay in respect of that year.

Label: Business rates - BRS collection and enforcement and administrative expenses
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations regarding collection and enforcement and administrative expenses in connection with business rate supplements.

Label: Business rates - accounting provisions for BRS
Description: A local authority must comply with accounting provisions in connection with business rate supplement.

Label: Business rates - directions on cancellation of BRS
Description: A levying authority, a billing authority or a functional body must comply with a direction given to it, or a requirement imposed on it by the Secretary of State in relation to the cancellation of a BRS.

Label: Business rates - request for information in respect of BRS
Description: The levying authority may request information from the billing authority in respect of the business rate supplement and the billing authority has a duty to comply with that request.

Label: Business rates - compliance with guidance for BRS
Description: Local authority must comply with guidance issued by the Secretary of State when carrying out its functions under the Act.

Label: Services - charging for provision
Description: A local authority may charge for services carried out pursuant to its power under section 1 of the Localism Act in certain circumstances.

Label: Child poverty - co-operation to reduce child poverty
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for promoting co-operation between various bodies for the purposes of reducing of mitigating child poverty in its area and to have regard to the guidance of the Secretary of State in so doing.

Label: Child poverty - resources and pooled fund
Description: A local authority may provide staff, goods, services, accommodation, other resources and to establish a pooled fund for the purposes of reducing of mitigating child poverty in its area.

Label: Child poverty - local needs assessment
Description: A local authority must produce and publish a local child poverty needs assessment including a joint child poverty strategy for its area and have regard to guidance from the Secretary of State in so doing.

Label: Children's social care - arrangements for discharge of care functions
Description: A local authority may enter into an agreement with a body corporate to enable that body to exercise some of the Authority's care functions.

Label: Children's social care - designated school staff member for looked after children
Description: A Governing Body of a maintained school must designate a member of the staff at the school as having responsibility for promoting the educational achievement of registered pupils at the school who are being looked after by a local authority

Label: Climate change report in England
Description: An authority is required to prepare a report on the current and predicted impact of climate change in relation to the authority's functions when and how directed by the Secretary of State.  The report may include proposals and policies for adapting to climate change, time-scales for introducing those proposals and policies and an assessment of the progress made by the authority towards implementing the policies and proposals set out in previous reports.

Label: Climate change report in Wales
Description: A local authority must prepare report on climate change in relation to the delegated functions of Welsh ministers when and in the manner directed by the Welsh Ministers.

Label: Climate change - single use carrier bags
Description: A local authority must administer the Single Use of Carrier Bags Regulations.

Label: Services - timimg for submission of expressions of interest
Description: A relevant authority may specify periods during which expressions of interest, or expressions of interest in respect of a particular relevant service, may be submitted to the authority.

Label: Services - consideration of wellbeing of area during service procurement
Description: The authority must take the economic, social and environmental well-being of area into account before entering into certain procurement exercises and entering into certain service provision contracts

Label: Local economy - assessment of economic conditions
Description: A local authority must prepare an assessment of the economic conditions in its area, consult/co-operate with consultation as required by section 69 and have regard to guidance issued by the Secretary of State.

Label: Local economy - funding for Economic Prosperity Board
Description: A local authority must comply with secretary of state's funding order with regard to an Economic Prosperity Board operating within its area where the authority is a constituent council of the Board.

Label: Local economy - review of arrangements
Description: Any two or more authorities may undertake a review of the effectiveness and efficiency of arrangements to promote economic development and regeneration in their area.

Label: Local economy - new Economic Prosperity Board
Description: Any two or more authorities may prepare and publish a scheme for a new economic prosperity board for their area.

Label: Local economy - review of Economic Prosperity Board matters
Description: In accordance with the framework laid down by section 100 an authority may undertake a review of economic prosperity board matters for their area.

Label: Local economy - preparation and publication of scheme
Description: An authority who has undertaken in review in accordance with section 100 may prepare and publish a scheme to exercise powers to improve economic prosperity for its area.

Label: Policy - joint review of transport or economic development
Description: Any two or more authorities may undertake a review of the effectiveness and efficiency of transport or arrangements to promote economic development within their area.

Label: Policy - creation of combined authority
Description: Any two or more authorities who have undertaken a review under section 108 may prepare and publish a scheme for the creation of a combined authority.

Label: Policy - combined authority review
Description: Any one or more authorities may undertake a review of one or more combined matters in a combined authority's area.

Label: Policy - preparation and publication of scheme for a combined authority
Description: Any one or more authorities who have undertaken a review of one or more combined matters in a combined authority's area may prepare and publish a scheme to improve the functioning of a combined matter in a combined authority's area.

Label: Policy - regard to guidance by Secretary of State for combined authority
Description: A local authority must have regard to guidance prepared by the Secretary of State with regard to anything done under Part VI of the Act.

Label: Policy - proposal for multi-area agreement
Description: The local authorities for an area proposed to be covered by a multi-area agreement (the proposed area) may request the Secretary of State to give a direction under section 125 for the preparation and submission of a draft multi-area agreement for the proposed area.

Label: Policy - direction to prepare and submit draft multi-area agreement
Description: Local Authorities must prepare a multi-area agreement when directed to do so by the Secretary of State and must consult before so doing.

Label: Policy - submission of existing multi-area agreement
Description: Local Authorities must when preparing a multi-area agreement other than in accordance with section 125 comply with the requirements of section 128 and consult when so doing.

Label: Policy - multi-area agreement improvement targets
Description: Local Authorities must have regard to every improvement target contained within a multi area agreement when carrying out its functions.

Label: Policy - transfer of responsibility in multi-area agreement
Description: The local authorities to which the targets specified in a multi-area agreement relate may request the Secretary of State to agree to another one of those authorities becoming the responsible authority in relation to the agreement.

Label: Policy - revision proposals for multi-area agreement
Description: A Local Authority may or must if directed to do so by the Secretary of State prepare a proposal for a revised multi-area agreement and consult as required.

Label: Policy - publication of information about multi-area agreement
Description: A Local Authority must publish information about multi-area agreements or revised multi-area agreements.

Label: Electoral areas - provision of information to Boundary Commission
Description: A local authority must comply with a request for information from the Local Government Boundary Commission for England in connection with its functions under the Act.

Label: Electoral areas - request for Boundary Commission review.
Description: A local authority may request the Local Government Boundary Commission for England to conduct a review of the Council's area and make recommendations as to single member electoral areas.

Label: Equality - public sector duty regarding socio-economic inequalities
Description: An authority to which this duty applies must, when making decisions of a strategic nature about how to exercise its functions, have due regard to the desirability of exercising them in a way that is designed to reduce the inequalities of outcome which result from socio-economic disadvantage.

Label: Equality - duty to eliminate discrimination, enhance equality and foster good relations
Description: A local authority must in the exercise of its functions have due regard to the need to eliminate discrimination, enhance equality of opportunity and to enhance good relations.

Label: Equality - publication of information to demonstrate compliance
Description: A local authority must publish equality information as required by secondary legislation.

Label: Equality - prepare and publish an equality objective
Description: A local authority must prepare and publish equality information as required by secondary legislation

Label: Flooding - flood risk management strategy
Description: A local authority must develop, consult upon, maintain, apply and monitor a strategy for local flood risk management in its area (a local flood risk management strategy) and have regard to Guidance from the Secretary of State in doing so.

Label: Flooding - guidance on flood risk management strategy
Description: A local authority may issue guidance in respect of its local flood risk management strategy.

Label: Flooding and coastal erosion - co-operation and arrangements
Description: A local authority must cooperate with other relevant authorities in the exercise of their flood and coastal erosion risk management functions

Label: Flooding and coastal erosion - sharing of information
Description: A relevant authority may share information with another relevant authority for the purpose of discharging its duty in the exercise of their flood and coastal erosion risk management functions.

Label: Flooding - delegation of flood risk management function
Description: A risk management authority may delegate its flood risk management function to another relevant authority.

Label: Coastal defence - delegation of coastal erosion risk management function
Description: A coast protection authority may, with the appropriate consent, arrange for a person to exercise a coastal erosion risk management function on its behalf.

Label: Coastal erosion - risk management function exercised on behalf of Environment Agency
Description: A local authority may undertake coastal erosion risk management function on behalf of the Environment Agency if delegation is agreed.

Label: Flooding and coastal erosion - request for information
Description: A local authority may request any person to provide information in respect of flood or coastal erosion risk management functions.

Label: Flooding and coastal erosion - enforcement notice for failure to provide information
Description: A local authority may issue enforcement notice in respect of failure to provide information requested under section 14.

Label: Flooding - investigation of flooding incident
Description: A local authority must to the extent it considers necessary or appropriate in case of flooding in its area, carry out an investigation, publish its results and issue notifications.

Label: Flooding - register of structures or features with significant effect on flood risk
Description: A lead local flood authority must establish and maintain (a)a register of structures or features which, in the opinion of the authority, are likely to have a significant effect on a flood risk in its area, and  (b)a record of information about each of those structures or features, including information about ownership and state of repair.    The authority must comply with guidance from the Secretary of State about the content of the register.    The register must be available for inspection at all reasonable times.

Label: Flooding and coastal erosion - sustainable development
Description: A local authority must have regard to achieving sustainable development when having regard to flood risk or coastal erosion functions..  The local authority must also comply with any guidance from the Minister.

Label: Flooding and coastal erosion - designation of features which may affect the flood or coastal erosion risk
Description: A local authority may designate a structure or a natural or man-made feature of the environment  where the designating authority thinks the existence or location of the structure or feature affects a flood risk or a coastal erosion risk.

Label: Child protection - duty of care
Description: A local authority must comply with the statutory duty of care in respect of relevant duty of in respect of the care, supervision or protection of children.

Label: Policy - power of general competence
Description: A local authority may do anything that an individual can do providing it is not otherwise prevented from doing so by statute.

Label: Disability - National Autism Strategy
Description: A local authority must comply with National Autism Strategy guidance issued by Secretary of State.

Label: Housing - settlement payments
Description: An authority which is a  local housing authority that keeps a Housing Revenue Account must comply with provisions regarding settlement payments and further payments to be made to the Secretary of State.

Label: Housing - limits on indebtedness
Description: A local housing authority may not hold housing debt in contravention of  any determination by the Secretary of State

Label: Housing - provision of housing finance information
Description: A local housing authority must provide Secretary of State with information which is requested regarding housing finance

Label: Housing - tenancy strategy
Description: A local housing authority must consult upon, prepare, publish, review and have regard to a tenancy strategy.

Label: Marine planning - delegation of functions relating to marine plans
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from a Marine Planning Authority.

Label: Marine policy - decisions in accordance with marine policy documents
Description: A public authority must take any authorisation or enforcement decision in accordance with the appropriate marine policy documents, unless relevant considerations indicate otherwise.

Label: Marine licensing - delegation of functions
Description: A local authority must comply with any delegation of functions order in respect of marine licensing.

Label: Marine Conservation Zones - furthering conservation objectives
Description: A local authority must exercise its functions in a way which the authority considers best furthers the conservation objectives stated for the Marine Conservation Zone or where it is not possible to exercise its functions in a manner which furthers those objectives, exercise them in the manner which the authority considers least hinders the achievement of those objectives.      If an authority considers that any of its functions is such that the exercise of the function would or might significantly hinder the achievement of the conservation objectives for an MCZ, it must inform the appropriate statutory conservation body of that fact.

Label: Marine Conservation Zones - applications which may hinder MCZ objectives
Description: Where the authority receives an application for authorisation of the doing of an act where there is or may be a significant risk of the act hindering the achievement of the conservation objectives stated for the MCZ, the authority must notify the appropriate statutory conservation body of that fact.

Label: Marine Conservation Zones - failure to comply
Description: A local authority must provide the appropriate statutory conservation body with an explanation for alleged failure to comply with duties.

Label: Members - promote and maintain high standards of conduct
Description: A relevant authority must promote and maintain high standards of conduct by members and co-opted members of the authority.    In discharging its duty as above a relevant authority must, in particular, adopt a code dealing with the conduct that is expected of members and co-opted members of the authority when they are acting in that capacity.

Label: Members - register of interests
Description: The monitoring officer of a relevant authority must establish and maintain a register of interests of members and co-opted members of the authority.

Label: Members - dispensation where pecuniary interest
Description: An authority may in certain circumstances issue a dispensation allowing a member to take part in a debate or to vote where he or she has a pecuniary interest as per section 31(4) of the Localism Act 2011.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - responsibility of primary authority
Description: A local authority must if nominated as a Primary Authority by the Secretary of State give advice and guidance to regulated persons and to other local authorities regarding that function.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - notification to primary authority
Description: A local authority must notify the Primary Authority as to its intention to take enforcement action against a regulated person and follow the Primary Authority's directions.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - inspection plan
Description: A local authority which is a Primary Authority may draw up inspection plan in respect of a regulated activity.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - compliance with inspection plan
Description: A local authority must comply with an inspection plan in respect of a regulated activity which is drawn up by a Primary Authority.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - charging of fees and costs
Description: The primary authority may charge the regulated person such fees as it considers to represent the costs reasonably incurred by it in the exercise of its functions.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - LBRO guidance
Description: A local authority must have regard to any guidance given to it by LBRO regarding regulatory enforcement, notification of inspection plans and charging of fees.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - fixed monetary penalty
Description: A local authority may, where deemed to be the Regulator and where authorised by an SI to do so issue a fixed monetary penalty in relation to an offence.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - discretionary requirements in relation to an offence
Description: A local authority may, where deemed to be the Regulator and where authorised by an SI to do so impose discretionary requirements in relation to an offence.    Discretionary requirements may be a monetary penalty, a requirement to take such steps as a regulator may specify, within such period as it may specify, to secure that the offence does not continue or recur or a requirement to take such steps as a regulator may specify, within such period as it may specify, to secure that the position is, so far as possible, restored to what it would have been if the offence had not been committed.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - stop notice
Description: A local authority may, where deemed to be the Regulator and where authorised by an SI to do so issue a stop notice.  A stop notice is a notice prohibiting a person from carrying on an activity specified in the notice until the person has taken the steps specified in the notice.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - enforcement undertaking
Description: A local authority may, where deemed to be the Regulator and where authorised by an SI to do so may accept an enforcement undertaking from a person in a case where the regulator has reasonable grounds to suspect that the person has committed a relevant offence.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - guidance as to use of civil sanctions
Description: A local authority must, where deemed to be the Regulator publish guidance in respect of its use of civil sanctions and enforcement as part of the regulatory regime.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - publication of enforcement action
Description: A local authority must, where deemed to be the Regulator publish reports in respect of its use of civil sanctions and enforcement as part of the regulatory regime.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - payment of penalties into consolidated fund
Description: A local authority must, where deemed to be the Regulator pay income from fines etc. into the relevant consolidation fund.

Label: Regulatory enforcement - disclosure of information
Description: A local authority may, where deemed to be the Regulator share information relating to its function

Label: Regulatory enforcement - duty not to impose or maintain unnecessary burdens
Description: Any person exercising a regulatory function to which this section applies must keep that function under review and secure that in exercising the function the person does not

Label: Transport - new integrated transport authority
Description: Any two or more local authorities for an area with no integrated transport authority may undertake review of transport effectiveness in area.  With an incidental duty to prepare and publish a scheme.

Label: Transport -  review of the effectiveness and efficiency of transport
Description: The Secretary of State may direct any two or more local authorities for an area with no integrated transport authority may undertake review of transport effectiveness in area and to prepare and publish a scheme for the establishment of an ITA for any area.

Label: Transport - authorities review of arrangements
Description: Any one or more local authorities for an area with an integrated transport authority may undertake review related to one or more integrated transport areas or proposed integrated transport areas.  With an incidental duty to prepare and publish a scheme.

Label: Transport - review directed by Secretary of State
Description: The Secretary of State may direct any one or more local authorities for an area with an integrated transport authority may undertake review of transport effectiveness in area and to prepare and publish a scheme.

Label: Transport - delegation of functions
Description: Duty to comply with the delegation of functions by the Secretary of State in respect of an Integrated Transport Area including the conferral of a power to direct.

Label: Transport - regard to guidance issued by Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must have regard to the Secretary of State's guidance in respect of Integrated Transport Area.

Label: Animal welfare - prosecutions
Description: A local authority may prosecute proceedings for an offence under the Act or Regulations made under the Act.

Label: Animal welfare - appointment of inspectors
Description: A local authority may appoint animal welfare inspectors and shall have regard to the Secretary of State's guidance in so doing.

Label: Policy - proposals for single tier of local government
Description: A local authority may respond to an invitation from the Secretary of State to bring forward a proposal regarding the establishment of a single tier of local government for the area

Label: Policy - provision of information to Boundary Committee
Description: A local authority must if requested by the Boundary Committee to do so provide the Boundary Committee, by such date as the Boundary Committee may specify, with any information that the Boundary Committee may reasonably require in connection with any of their functions.

Label: Staff - establishment of staff commission
Description: A local authority must comply with Secretary of State's directions regarding co-operation with and the payment of expenses to a staff commission.

Label: Elections - resolution for whole-council elections
Description: A district council that is subject to a scheme for elections by halves or by thirds may resolve that it is to be subject instead to the scheme for whole-council elections.  A council must comply with requirements in passing a resolution for whole-council elections.

Label: Elections - publicity of explanatory document for whole council elections
Description: A district council adopting a scheme for whole council elections must, produce and publicise an explanatory document.

Label: Elections - notice to Electoral Commission on passing resolution for whole council elections
Description: A district council passing a resolution for whole council elections must give notice of that resolution to the Local Government Boundary Commission for England.

Label: Elections - resolution for elections by halves
Description: A non-metropolitan district council that was formerly subject to a scheme for elections by halves, but is for the time being subject to a scheme for whole-council elections, may resolve that it is to revert to being subject to a scheme for elections by halves.    The council must comply with requirements when passing a resolution for elections by halves.

Label: Elections - resolution for elections by thirds
Description: A district council that was formerly subject to a scheme for elections by thirds, but is for the time being subject to a scheme for whole-council elections,may resolve that it is to revert to being subject to a scheme for elections by thirds.  A council must comply with requirements in passing a resolution for elections by thirds.

Label: Elections - publicity of explanatory document for elections by halves or thirds
Description: A district council adopting a scheme for elections by halves or by thirds must, produce make available and publicise an explanatory document.

Label: Elections - notice to Electoral Commission on passing resolution for election by halves or thirds
Description: A district council adopting a scheme for elections by halves or by thirds must inform the Local Government Boundary Commission for England that it has passed that resolution.

Label: Elections - order by Electoral Commission for election by halves or thirds
Description: A council must produce an explanatory document and make the document available for inspection as soon as practicable after the Electoral Commission have made an order for elections by halves or for elections by thirds in relation to it.

Label: Elections -  alteration to years of ordinary elections of parish councillors
Description: A district council may pass a resolution to alter the years in which parish councillors are elected.

Label: Elections - change of name of electoral area
Description: A local authority may pass a resolution to change the name of an electoral area.

Label: Elections - notification of change of name of electoral area
Description: A local authority must obtain the approval of the Electoral Commission before changing the names of certain electoral areas and must inform the Electoral Commision, the Boundary Commission for England, Office of National Statistics and the Director General of the Ordnance Survey once the resolution has been passed.      In a two tier area a county must inform the district or a district inform the county within whose area the electoral area lies.

Label: Policy - structural and boundary changes
Description: A local authority may make agreements about incidental matters regarding the subject matter of orders issued under sections 7 and 10 of the Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007.

Label: Policy - review by Boundary Committee of local government areas
Description: A local authority may request the Boundary Committee to conduct a review of local government areas.

Label: Carers - co-operation between authorities
Description: Local authorities must co-operate in in planning service provision to carers.

Label: Child welfare - safeguarding targets
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding targets for safeguarding and promoting child welfare.

Label: Child welfare - co-operation to improve well-being
Description: Local authorities must co-operate with each other and prescribed others to improve the wellbeing of children in their area and have regard to guidance issued by the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Child welfare - arrangements to safeguard and promote welfare in England
Description: A local authority must when exercising its having regard to the need to safeguard and promote the welfare of children and have regard to guidance from the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Child welfare - information database
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations with regard to setting up and operating information databases containing required information about persons to whom arrangements under the Children Act 2004 relate.

Label: Child welfare - establishment of Children's Trust Board
Description: A local authority must establish a Children's Trust Board for its area.

Label: Child welfare - funding of Children's Trust Board
Description: The establishing authority and any of their relevant partners represented on a Children's Trust Board may make payments towards expenditure incurred by, or for purposes connected with, the Board and may provide staff, goods, services, accommodation or other resources for purposes connected with the functions of the Board.

Label: Child welfare - establishment of Local Safeguarding Children Board
Description: A local authority must establish a Local Safeguarding Children Board for its area in accordance with regulations.

Label: Child welfare - funding of Local Safeguarding Children Board
Description: A local authority may make payments towards expenditure incurred by, or for purposes connected with, a Local Safeguarding Children Board and may provide staff, goods, services, accommodation or other resources for purposes connected with a Local Safeguarding Children Board.

Label: Child welfare - guidance with regard to  Local Safeguarding Children Board
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations and have regard to guidance from the Secretary of State when exercising its functions with regard to a Local Safeguarding Children Board.

Label: Child welfare - appointment of Director of Children's Services
Description: A local authority must appoint a Director of Children's Services and have regard to the guidance of the Secretary of State.

Label: Child welfare - designation of lead member for children's services in England
Description: A local authority must designate one of their Members as a Lead Member for Children's Services and have regard to the guidance of the Secretary of State.

Label: Child welfare - co-operation in assessments of children's services
Description: Each person or body with functions under any enactment of conducting assessments of children's services must for the purposes of those assessments co-operate with other persons or bodies with such functions.

Label: Child welfare - delegation in assessments of children's services
Description: A person or body with functions under any enactment of conducting assessments of children's services may delegate any of those functions to any other person or body with such functions.

Label: Child welfare - co-operation for wellbeing
Description: Local authorities must co-operate with each other and prescribed others to improve the wellbeing of children in their area and have regard to guidance issued by the Assembly when so doing.

Label: Child welfare - children and young people's plans
Description: A children's services authority in Wales must, in accordance with regulations made by the Welsh Ministers, prepare and publish a plan setting out the authority's strategy for discharging their functions in relation to children and relevant young persons.

Label: Child welfare - designation of lead member for children's services in Wales
Description: A local authority must designate one of their members as a lead member for children's services and have regard to the guidance of the Assembly.

Label: Child welfare - lead director for children and young people's services
Description: A local authority must appoint appoint an officer, to be known as the lead director for children and young people's services and have regard to the guidance of the Assembly.

Label: Child welfare - arrangements to safeguard and promote welfare in Wales
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for ensuring that their functions are discharged having regard to the need to safeguard and promote the welfare of children and have regard to any guidance given to them for the purpose by the Assembly.

Label: Child welfare -  Local Safeguarding Children Board establishment
Description: Each local authority in Wales must establish a Local Safeguarding Children Board for their area. The authority must take reasonable steps to ensure that the Local Safeguarding Children Board established by them includes representatives of relevant persons and bodies of such descriptions as may be prescribed by the Assembly in regulations.

Label: Child welfare - Local Safeguarding Children Board funding
Description: An authority may make payments towards expenditure incurred by, or for purposes connected with, a Local Safeguarding Children Board and may provide staff, goods, services, accommodation or other resources for purposes connected with a Local Safeguarding Children Board

Label: Child welfare - Local Safeguarding Children Board functions
Description: A local authority when exercising its functions with regard to a Local Safeguarding Children Board for its area must comply with Regulations and have regard to guidance from the Assembly.

Label: Fostering - registration of private fosterers
Description: Local authorities must comply with regulations regarding the registration and inspection of private fosterers.

Label: Fostering - private fosterers registration
Description: Local authorities must comply with Regulations regarding the registration and inspection of private fosterers.

Label: Christmas Day trading - enforcement of prohibition
Description: A local authority shall be under a duty to enforce the prohibition of opening by large stores on Christmas Day and to appoint inspectors for this purpose.

Label: Child welfare - general duties in relation to well-being of young children
Description: A local authority must improve the well-being of and reduce inequalities between children in its area. In doing it must take action to meet the Secretary of State's targets and follow the Secretary of State's guidance.

Label: Childcare - early childcare services
Description: A local authority must facilitate early childcare services and maximise the benefits to parents, prospective parents and young children and should have regard to the guidance of the Secretary of State in doing so.

Label: Childcare - local authority and relevant partners working together
Description: An English local authority must make arrangements to work with each of the authority's relevant partners in the performance by the authority of their duties in relation to early childhood services.  An English local authority and each of their relevant partners  must, in exercising their functions under this section, have regard to any guidance given from time to time by the Secretary of State.

Label: Childcare - provision of children's centres
Description: A local authority must provide sufficient children's centres to meet local need.

Label: Childcare - ensure children's centres are within the remit of advisory boards
Description: A local authority must ensure its children's centres are within the remit of an advisory board and must have regard to guidance issued by the Secretary of State.

Label: Children's centres - consultation on provision, changes or closure
Description: A local authority must consult as it thinks appropriate having regard to guidance from the Secretary of State before making arrangements for children's centres.

Label: Children's centres - provision of services
Description: A local authority must consider whether each of the early childhood services to be provided by them should be provided through  children's centres.

Label: Childcare - sufficient childcare for working parents
Description: An English local authority must secure, so far as is reasonably practicable, that the provision of childcare (whether or not by them) is sufficient to meet the requirements of parents in their area who require childcare in order to enable them to take up, or remain in, work, or to undertake education or training which could reasonably be expected to assist them to obtain work.    In discharging this duty an authority must have regard to guidance given by the Secretary of State.

Label: Childcare - free of charge early years provision
Description: A local authority must secure early year provision in its area free of charge and in accordance with the regulations and must have regard to the guidance from the Secretary of State in so doing.

Label: Childcare provision in England
Description: A local authority may make arrangements to secure or may provide childcare in its area and must have regard to the guidance of the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Childcare - arrangements between local authority and childcare providers in England
Description: A local authority must ensure that any child care provider with whom they make arrangements and who receives financial assistance from them complies with the terms upon which that assistance is given.

Label: Childcare - charges where local authority provide childcare
Description: An English local authority may enter into an agreement under which payments are made to the authority for the provision by the authority of childcare for a child.

Label: Childcare - assessment of childcare provision
Description: A local authority must prepare childcare assessments every three years and comply with the guidance of the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Childcare - information, advice and assistance to parents in England
Description: A local authority must provide information, advice and assistance regarding childcare facilities and services and have regard to guidance of the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Childcare - information, advice and training to childcare providers in England
Description: A local authority must provide information, advice and training to childcare providers and have regard to guidance of the Secretary of State when so doing

Label: Childcare for working parents in Wales
Description: A Welsh local authority must secure, so far as is reasonably practicable, that the provision of childcare (whether or not by them) is sufficient to meet the requirements of parents in their area who require childcare in order to enable them to take up, or remain in, work, or to undertake education or training which could reasonably be expected to assist them to obtain work.    In discharging their duty a local authority must have regard to any guidance given from time to time by the Assembly.

Label: Childcare provision in Wales
Description: A Welsh local authority may assist any person who provides or proposes to provide childcare, make arrangements with any other person for the provision of childcare or provide childcare.  In exercising their functions a Welsh local authority must have regard to any guidance given from time to time by the Assembly.

Label: Childcare - arrangements between local authority and childcare providers in Wales
Description: A local authority must ensure that any child care provider with whom they make arrangements and who receives financial assistance from them complies with the terms upon which that assistance is given.

Label: Childcare - charges where local authority provide childcare in Wales
Description: A Welsh local authority may enter into an agreement under which payments are made to the authority for the provision by the authority of childcare for a child.

Label: Childcare - information, advice and assistance to parents in Wales
Description: A local authority must provide information, advice and assistance regarding childcare services in its area and have regard to guidance from the Welsh Assembly in so doing.

Label: Children's centres - publication of Chief Inspector's report
Description: A local authority may distribute or publish a report which it receives from the Chief Inspector regarding children's centres.

Label: Children's centres - written statement on Chief Inspector's report
Description: A local authority may prepare and publish a written statement when a Chief Inspector's Report is received and have regard to the guidance of the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Emergencies -  assess, plan and advise
Description: A local authority must assess risk in respect of emergencies, prepare and maintain plans as prescribed and in so doing comply with Regulations and have regard to guidance.

Label: Emergencies - advice and assistance to the public
Description: A local authority shall provide advice and assistance to the public in connection with the making of arrangements for the continuance of commercial activities by the public, or the continuance of the activities of bodies other than public or local authorities whose activities are not carried on for profit, in the event of an emergency. and must comply with regulations and have regard to guidance when so doing.

Label: Emergencies - charging for advice and assistance
Description: A local authority may charge for advice and assistance in relation to the giving of information to the public regarding the continuation of certain activities during an emergency as allowed for by regulations.

Label: Emergencies - consultation, co-operation and delegation
Description: A Minister of the Crown may by order require an authority to perform a function in connection with an emergency.  The order may require the authority to consult, collaborate, delegate, co-operate or provide information to another person or body.

Label: Emergencies - disclosure of information
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding disclosure of information in connection with a function of the provider or of the recipient which relates to emergencies.

Label: Emergencies - provision of information to Government
Description: A local authority must comply with a request from a Minister of the Crown for information about action taken in relation to any emergency.

Label: Emergencies - enforcement action
Description: A local authority may take enforcement action in respect of the failure by another responsible authority to comply with the Act.

Label: Civil partnership - publication of notice
Description: A local authority must record the prescribed information from the notice  of partnership on to the register.

Label: Civil partnership - requirement for specified evidence
Description: A local authority may require specified evidence before issuing a civil partnership schedule.

Label: Civil partnership - public display of information
Description: A local authority must place the relevant information on public display for the prescribed period.

Label: Civil partnership - power to shorten waiting period
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to the Registrar General's power to shorten the waiting period.

Label: Civil partnership - issue of schedule
Description: As soon as the waiting period in relation to each notice of proposed civil partnership has expired, the registration authority in whose area it is proposed that the registration take place is under a duty, at the request of one or both of the proposed civil partners, to issue a document to be known as a civil partnership schedule.  The authority may refuse where it has reasonable grounds for suspecting that a relevant decision was made incorrectly because of the provision of false information or evidence.

Label: Civil partnership - civil partnership registrars
Description: A civil partnership registrar is an individual who is designated by a registration authority as a civil partnership registrar for its area.  It is the duty of each registration authority to ensure that there is a sufficient number of civil partnership registrars for its area to carry out in that area the functions of civil partnership registrars.

Label: Vehicles for repair or sale on road - fixed penalty notice
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may give a fixed penalty notice for a suspected breach of sections 3 or 4 of the Act (repairing or exposing vehicles for sale on the road).

Label: Vehicles for repair or sale on road - request for personal details
Description: An authorised officer may require the name and address of a person to whom he proposes to give a fixed penalty notice under section 6 of the Act.

Label: Vehicles for repair or sale on road - use of receipts
Description: Power to use receipts from fixed penalty notices for various purposes.

Label: Vehicles for repair or sale on road - information about receipts
Description: A local authority must provide information about its use of receipts from fixed penalty notices to the appropriate person and comply with regulations..

Label: Dog control orders - designation
Description: A local authority may make an order providing for an offence or offences relating to the control of dogs in respect of any land in its area.  an offence relates to the control of dogs if it relates to one of the following matters:  (a)fouling of land by dogs and the removal of dog faeces;  (b)the keeping of dogs on leads;  (c)the exclusion of dogs from land;  (d)the number of dogs which a person may take on to any land.

Label: Dog control orders - fixed penalty notice
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may issue a Fixed Penalty Notice in the prescribed form relating to the breach of a dog control order.

Label: Dog control orders - request for personal details
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may require an individual to whom he wishes to issue a Fixed Penalty Notice to provide him with his name and address.

Label: Alarm notification areas - designation
Description: A local authority may designate the whole or any part of its area as an alarm notification area but must comply with the prescribed procedure when so doing.

Label: Alarm notification areas - withdrawal of designation
Description: A local authority may withdraw the designation of the whole or any part of its area as an alarm notification area but must comply with the prescribed procedure when so doing.

Label: Alarm notification areas- fixed penalty notice
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may issue a fixed penalty notice in the prescribed form if it appears that an individual has committed an offence in connection with an alarm notification area.

Label: Alarm notification areas- use of receipts
Description: A local authority may use the receipts from fixed penalty notices issued under section 73 for certain purposes.

Label: Alarm notification areas - information about receipts
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations and  must supply the appropriate person with information about its use of fixed penalty receipts.

Label: Alarm notification areas- request for personal details
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may require an individual who he suspects of an offence in connection with an alarm notification area may require that individual to give him his name and address.

Label: Alarm notification areas - power of entry
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may enter premises to turn off an alarm subject to certain conditions.

Label: Alarm notification areas - warrant of entry
Description: A local authority may having complied with the specified conditions make an application to a magistrate's court for a warrant to allow an authorised officer to enter premises by force to turn off an alarm.

Label: Alarm notification areas- powers on entry to premises
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority has additional powers when entering premises.

Label: Litter, graffiti and fly-posting - use of receipts
Description: A local authority may use specified fixed penalty receipts for certain purposes of qualifying functions of the authority.

Label: Litter, graffiti and fly-posting - providing information about receipts
Description: A local authority must provide information about their use of fixed penalty receipts to the appropriate person.

Label: Energy measures report - regard when exercising functions
Description: A local authority must have regard to energy measures reports published by the Secretary of State when exercising their functions.

Label: Common land - register
Description: A commons registration authority must keep a register of common land and a register of town or village greens in accordance with the regulations.

Label: Common land - amendments to register
Description: A commons registration authority may amend the register of common land in certain circumstances.

Label: Common land - deregistration and exchange
Description: A commons registration authority must amend the register of common land when ordered to do so by the national authority or by the High Court.

Label: Common land - charge for inspection of register
Description: A commons registration authority may charge for supplying a copy of the document forming part of the commons register.

Label: Common land - inspection and copies of register
Description: A Commons Registration Authority must make the commons register available for inspection and to allow copies of documents to be taken

Label: Common land - unclaimed land
Description: A local authority may take any steps to protect the land against unlawful interference that could be taken by an owner in possession of the land; and institute proceedings against any person for any offence committed in respect of the land.

Label: Crime and disorder - committee
Description: A local authority must have a crime and disorder committee with powers of scrutiny and to make reports and recommendations.

Label: Schools - establishment of an academy
Description: A local authority must, if they believe a new school is required for their area, seek proposals for the establishment of an Academy and notify the Secretary of State.

Label: Schools - invitation for proposal for establishment of new school
Description: A local authority may, with the consent of the Secretary of State, invite proposals for the establishment of a new foundation or voluntary school or an Academy having regard to guidance from the Secretary of State in the process.

Label: Schools - withdrawal of notice for establishment of new school
Description: A local authority may, with the consent of the Secretary of State, withdraw its notice for the establishment of a new foundation or voluntary school or an Academy.

Label: Schools - withdrawal of notice on direction of Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must, when directed to do so by the Secretary of State, withdraw its notice for the establishment of a new foundation or voluntary school or an Academy.

Label: Schools - publication of proposals for new school
Description: A local authority may publish proposals to establish a new community or foundation school to replace existing provision, having regard to guidance published by the Secretary of State in so doing.

Label: Schools - Publication of proposals where new school other than to replace existing
Description: A local authority may publish proposals to establish a new community or foundation school other than to replace existing provision, in certain circumstances, having regard to guidance published by the Secretary of State in so doing.

Label: Schools - closure of a maintained school
Description: A local authority may publish proposals to close a maintained school and must follow guidance published by the Secretary of State in so doing.

Label: Schools - closure of a community or a foundation special school
Description: A local authority must close a community or a foundation special school when directed to do so by the Secretary of State on the grounds of health, safety or pupil welfare.

Label: Schools - publication of proposals for alteration of school
Description: A local authority may publish proposals to make certain alterations to maintained schools.

Label: Schools - proposals for foundation status
Description: A governing body of a non-foundation school may determine its own foundation proposals.

Label: Schools - removal of foundation or reduction in foundation governors
Description: A governing body of a foundation school or foundation special school may determine proposals to remove foundation status or to foundation governors at foundation schools.

Label: Schools - teachers pay and conditions warning notice
Description: An authority may issue a notice to the governing body of a maintained school where the authority are satisfied that the governing body has failed to comply, or failed to secure compliance by the head teacher, with the provisions of an order under section 122 of the 2002 Act relating to teachers' pay and conditions.

Label: Schools - performance standards or safety warning notice
Description: A authority may give a warning notice to the governing body of a maintained school where the authority are satisfied that the standards of performance of pupils at the school are unacceptably low, and are likely to remain so unless the authority exercise their powers under this Part, or that there has been a serious breakdown in the way the school is managed or governed which is prejudicing, or likely to prejudice, such standards of performance, or that the safety of pupils or staff of the school is threatened (whether by a breakdown of discipline or otherwise).

Label: Schools - require governing body to enter into arrangements
Description: A local authority may require the governing body of a maintained school eligible for intervention to enter into arrangements with others in certain circumstances.

Label: Schools - appointment of additional governors
Description: A local authority may appoint additional governors to the governing body of a maintained school eligible for intervention.

Label: Schools - interim executive members on governing body
Description: A local authority may provide for a governing body of a maintained school eligible for intervention to consist of interim executive members.

Label: Schools - suspension of right to delegated budget
Description: A local authority may suspend the right of a governing body of a maintained school which is eligible for intervention to have a delegated budget.

Label: Schools - closure on direction of Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with the direction of the Secretary of State under section 68 to close a maintained school.

Label: Schools - issue of standards warning notice on direction of Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with the direction of the Secretary of State to issue a performance standards and safety warning notice.

Label: Schools - issue of teachers pay and consitions warning notice on direction of Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with the direction of the Secretary of State to issue a teachers' pay and conditions warning notice.

Label: Schools - piloting of school travel schemes
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the piloting of school travel schemes.

Label: Schools - guidance of the Secretary of State regarding schools causing concern
Description: A local authority must have regard to the guidance of the Secretary of State when exercising their functions in relation to schools causing concern.

Label: Schools - responsibility of governing body for discipline
Description: The governing body of a maintained school or pupil referral unit must ensure that policies designed to promote good behaviour and discipline are pursued at a school.

Label: Schools - education for excluded pupil
Description: The governing body of a maintained school must make arrangements for the provision of education to pupils excluded on disciplinary grounds.

Label: Schools - reports of inspections
Description: A local authority must publish the Chief Inspectors report within such period, and in such manner, as may be prescribed by regulations made by the Secretary of State.  Such regulations may provide for the authority to charge a reasonable fee for providing a person with a copy of a document published.

Label: Schools - payment of annual fee to Chief Inspector
Description: A local authority must pay an annual fee to the Chief Inspector as specified by regulations.

Label: Schools - co-operation with Chief Inspector for investigation of a complaint
Description: The governing body of a school and/or the local authority must provide the Chief Inspector with such information as he requires and co-operate as required where a qualifying complaint is made to the Chief Inspector by a person who is a registered parent of a registered pupil at the school to which the complaint relates.

Label: Schools - reports of investigations
Description: The governing body of a school and/or the local authority must distribute the Chief Inspector's report as required by the Chief Inspector.

Label: Schools - distribution and charges for maintained school inspection reports in England
Description: The governing body of a school and/or the local authority must make available and distribute the Chief Inspector's report in accordance with regulations.  In prescribed cases a charge may be made which should not exceed the cost of supply.

Label: Schools - special measures/requiring significant improvement in England
Description: Where a school for which it is responsible is in special measures/ requiring significant improvement, a local authority must prepare a written statement and comply with the directions and guidance of the Secretary of State.

Label: Schools - inspections in Wales
Description: The Governing Body of a maintained school in Wales and the authority responsible for maintaining that school must comply with the requirements laid down with regard to inspections in Wales.

Label: Schools - distribution and charges for maintained school inspection reports in Wales
Description: The governing body of a school in Wales and/or the local authority must make available and distribute the Chief Inspector's report with a supplementary power to charge in some cases.

Label: Schools - special measures/requiring significant improvement in Wales
Description: Where a school for which it is responsible is in special measures/requiring significant improvement, a local authority must prepare a written statement and comply with the directions and guidance of the Assembly.

Label: Schools - inspection of religious education in England
Description: The governing body of schools with religious character to comply with prescribed procedure for denominational inspection.  Inspection reports must be made available in accordance with regulations.

Label: Schools - inspection of religious education in Wales
Description: The governing body of schools in Wales with religious character to comply with prescribed procedure for denominational inspection.

Label: Schools - LEA inspection of maintained schools in England
Description: Where for the purpose of enabling them to exercise any function of theirs, a local education authority require information about any matter in connection with a school which is maintained by them, and  it is not reasonably practicable for them to obtain the information in any other manner,they may cause an inspection of the school to be made by one or more of their officers for the purpose of obtaining the information.

Label: Schools - LEA inspection of schools in Wales
Description: Any local education authority in Wales may provide a school inspection service for schools within their area.  Any school inspection service provided by a local education authority in Wales may, in addition to providing for the inspection of schools which are maintained by them, provide for the inspection of schools which are not maintained by them.  The authority must comply with the directions of the Assembly when so doing.

Label: Schools - training for the school workforce
Description: The governing body of any maintained school and Wales may provide training to the school workforce.

Label: Schools - educational performance targets
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations published by the Secretary of State relating to annual targets in schools.

Label: Schools - supply of information about school workforce
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations published by the Secretary of State or the Assembly relating to the supply of information relating to the school workforce to the relevant person.

Label: Fire and rescue - general powers of authorities
Description: Subject to the boundaries defined in section 5B a fire and rescue authority may do:  - anything it considers appropriate for the purposes of the carrying-out of any of its functions  - anything it considers appropriate for purposes incidental to its functional purposes  - anything it considers appropriate for purposes indirectly incidental to its functional purposes through any number of removes  - anything it considers to be connected with any of its functions, or  anything it may do under the above  - for a commercial purpose anything which it may do under any of the above paragraphs otherwise than for a commercial purpose.

Label: Fire and rescue - fire safety
Description: A fire and rescue authority must make provision for the purpose of promoting fire safety in its area.

Label: Fire and rescue - fire fighting
Description: A fire and rescue authority must make provision for the purposes of  extinguishing fires in its area, and protecting life and property in the event of fires in its area.

Label: Fire and rescue - road traffic accidents
Description: A fire and rescue authority must make provision for the purpose of  rescuing people in the event of road traffic accidents in its area and  protecting people from serious harm, to the extent that it considers it reasonable to do so, in the event of road traffic accidents in its area.

Label: Fire and rescue - emergencies
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with regulations made by the Secretary of State relating to emergencies.

Label: Fire and rescue - directions relating to particular fires and emergencies
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with direction from the Secretary of State to take, or not to take, action specified in the direction in relation to a fire specified in the direction, or an emergency of another kind specified in the direction.

Label: Fire and rescue - response to other eventualities
Description: A fire and rescue authority may take any action in response to an event or situation that causes or is likely to cause one or more individuals to die, be injured or become ill or harm to the environment (including the life and health of plants and animals).

Label: Fire and rescue - other services
Description: A fire and rescue authority may provide the services of any persons employed by it or any equipment maintained by it to any person for any purpose that appears to the authority to be appropriate.  A fire and rescue authority may provide services under this section outside as well as within the authority's area.

Label: Fire and rescue - reinforcement schemes
Description: A fire and rescue authority must enter into reinforcement schemes with other fire and rescue authorities and notify the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Fire and rescue - arrangements with other employers of fire-fighters
Description: A fire and rescue authority may enter into arrangements with other (non-fire and rescue service) employers of fire-fighters to enable it to carry out its duties.

Label: Fire and rescue - arrangements for discharge of functions by others
Description: A fire and rescue authority may enter into arrangements with another fire and rescue service or another person to enable it to carry out its duties.

Label: Fire and rescue - directions to make arrangements with another fire authority
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with a direction of the Secretary of State to enter into arrangements under Section 16.

Label: Fire and rescue - training centres
Description: A fire and rescue authority may establish and maintain one or more training centres for providing education and training in matters in relation to which fire and rescue authorities have functions.

Label: Fire and rescue - charging by authorities
Description: A fire and rescue authority may charge a person for any action taken by the authority in the United Kingdom or at sea or under the sea, and  otherwise than for a commercial purpose subject to provisions and limits defined in this section, sections 18B and 18C.

Label: Fire and rescue - exercise of powers at or under sea
Description: If a fire and rescue authority has power to act, or is required to act, outside the authority's area, the authority may exercise the power, or perform the duty, at sea or under the sea.

Label: Fire and rescue - National Framework
Description: A fire and rescue authority must have regard to the National Framework when carrying out its functions.

Label: Fire and rescue - intervention by Secretary of State
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with an order made by the Secretary of State under the intervention protocol.

Label: Fire and rescue - best value
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with the best value/measures regime.

Label: Fire and rescue - reports, returns and information to Secretary of State
Description: A fire and rescue authority must submit to the Secretary of State any reports and returns required by him give the Secretary of State any information with respect to its functions required by him.

Label: Fire and rescue - equipment, facilities, services and organisations
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with an order of the Secretary of State to utilise the Secretary of State's equipment or facilities etc.

Label: Fire and rescue - directions for public safety purposes
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with a direction of the Secretary of State given for public safety purposes.

Label: Fire and rescue - securing adequate water supply
Description: A fire and rescue authority must take all reasonable measures for securing that an adequate supply of water will be available for the authority's use in the event of fire.  An authority may use any suitable supply of water for the purposes of extinguishing a fire or protecting life or property in the event of a fire (but must pay reasonable compensation for the water).

Label: Fire and rescue - use of and payment for water supply
Description: A fire and rescue authority may use any suitable supply of water for the purposes of extinguishing a fire or protecting life or property in the event of a fire (but must pay reasonable compensation for the water).

Label: Fire and rescue - supply of water by water undertakers
Description: A fire and rescue authority may enter into agreements with water undertakers for the purpose of securing a water supply.

Label: Fire and rescue - supply of water by other persons
Description: a fire and rescue authority may enter into an agreement to secure the use of water under the control of a person other than a water undertaker, to improve access to any such water or to lay and maintain pipes and to carry out other works in connection with the use of such water.

Label: Fire and rescue - fire hydrants
Description: The expenses incurred by a water authority in relation to a fire hydrant are to be borne by the fire and rescue authority in whose area the hydrant is located.

Label: Fire and rescue - powers of fire-fighters etc in an emergency
Description: A fire and rescue authority may authorise its fire fighters, in writing, to undertake certain actions in an emergency.

Label: Fire and rescue - obtaining information and investigating fires
Description: A fire and rescue authority may authorise officers to enter premises at a reasonable time for the purposes of obtaining information or investigating fires.

Label: Gambling - guidance from Gambling Commission
Description: A local authority must comply with guidance published from time to time by the Gambling Commission in relation to the exercise of its functions.

Label: Gambling - licensing authority information
Description: A local authority must provide the Gambling Commission with information in relation to the exercise of its functions.

Label: Gambling - premises licence
Description: A local authority must aim to permit the use of premises for gambling in so far as the authority think in accordance with any relevant code of practice, any relevant guidance issued by the Commission and in a manner which is reasonably consistent with the licensing objectives and in accordance with the statement published by the authority under section 349.

Label: Gambling - delegation of licensing authority functions
Description: A local authority must delegate certain functions to the licensing committee of the authority established under section 6 of the Licensing Act 2003.

Label: Gambling - register of premises licences
Description: A local authority must maintain a register of premises licences in the manner prescribed and make information available to members of the public.

Label: Gambling - charge for register entry copy
Description: A local authority may charge a reasonable fee for providing a copy of entry or information from the register of gambling premises licences.

Label: Gambling - representations in relation to licence application
