Description: Where an application is made to a licensing authority for a premises licence, an interested party or responsible authority in relation to the premises may make representations in writing to the licensing authority.

Label: Gambling - determination of application
Description: On considering an application for a premises licence (whether at a hearing or not) a licensing authority shall grant it, or reject it..  A local authority must hold a hearing to determine a gambling premises licence application in certain circumstances.

Label: Gambling - notice of grant or rejection of gambling premises licence
Description: A local authority must give notice of the grant or rejection of a gambling premises licence in the prescribed form to the applicant,  the Commission, any person who made representations about the application under section 161, the chief officer of police for any area in which the premises are wholly or partly situated and Her Majesty's Commissioners of Customs and Excise.

Label: Gambling - resolution not to issue casino licences
Description: A licensing authority may resolve not to issue casino premises licences.

Label: Gambling - premises licence conditions
Description: A local authority must attach mandatory conditions to a gambling premises licences and default conditions in certain circumstances as prescribed by regulations.

Label: Gambling - exclusion of licence conditions
Description: A premises licence may not be subject to a condition (whether imposed by virtue of section 167, 168 or 169) requiring all or part of the premises, or any activity taking place on the premises, to be operated or carried on as a club or other body with membership, or  restricting use of any part of the premises wholly or partly by reference to membership of a club or other body.    A premises licence may not be subject to a condition (whether imposed by virtue of section 167, 168 or 169) imposing limits on stakes, fees, winnings, or prizes.

Label: Gambling - gaming machines
Description: A local authority must incorporate certain conditions into certain premises licences regarding gaming machines.

Label: Gambling - credit on licensed premises
Description: A premises licence shall be subject to the condition that the licensee does not give credit in connection with gambling authorised by the licence, or  participate in, arrange, permit or knowingly facilitate the giving of credit in connection with gambling authorised by the licence.

Label: Gambling - access by children to casino premises
Description: A local authority must incorporate certain conditions, determined by the Commission, into certain premises licences regarding access by children.

Label: Gambling - betting machines
Description: A local authority may incorporate certain conditions into betting or casino premises licences regarding betting machines.

Label: Gambling - exclusion of children from track areas
Description: A premises licence in respect of a track shall by virtue of this section be subject to the condition that the licensee shall ensure that children and young persons are excluded from any area where facilities for betting are provided, and any area where a gaming machine, other than a Category D machine, is situated.

Label: Gambling - Christmas Day closure
Description: A local authority must ensure that certain premises licences exclude gambling premises from operating on Christmas Day.

Label: Gambling - premises licence annual fee
Description: A local authority must charge a premises licence holder a first annual fee within such period after the issue of the licence as may be prescribed, and an annual fee before each anniversary of the issue of the licence.  The amount of the fee should be as prescribed by regulations made by the Secretary of State.

Label: Gambling - variation to licence
Description: A local authority may vary a premises licence having been notified of a change of circumstances or a request for variation from the licence holder.

Label: Gambling - transfer of premises licence
Description: A licensing authority shall grant an application for transfer unless they think it would be wrong to do so having regard to representations made.

Label: Gambling - copy of premises licence
Description: A licensing authority shall consider an application under this section as soon as is reasonably practicable and shall grant, and issue a copy licence, it if satisfied that the licence or summary to which the application relates has been lost, stolen or damaged, and where the licence or summary has been lost or stolen, that the loss or theft has been reported to the police.

Label: Gambling - surrender of premises licence
Description: As soon as is reasonably practicable after receipt of notification from the licensee that they wish to surrender a licence the licensing authority shall notify the Commission, the chief officer of police for any area in which the premises are wholly or partly situated and Her Majesty's Commissioners of Customs and Excise.

Label: Gambling - revocation of premises licence for failure to pay fee
Description: A local authority must, revoke a premises licence where the holder has failed to pay the prescribed fee, unless non-payment was as a result of administrative error.

Label: Gambling - lapse of premises licence
Description: If a licensing authority become aware that a premises licence issued by them has lapsed, they shall as soon as is reasonably practicable notify the Commission, the chief officer of police for any area in which the premises are wholly or partly situated and Her Majesty's Commissioners of Customs and Excise.

Label: Gambling - re-instatement of premises licence
Description: A licensing authority shall grant an application for reinstatement unless they think it would be wrong to do so having regard to representations made.

Label: Gambling - review of premises licence
Description: A local authority must carry out a review of a premises licence in certain circumstances and determine that review.

Label: Gambling - provisional statement for premises licence
Description: A local authority must issue a provisional statement in respect of a premises licence where the applicant expects the premises to be constructed, expects the premises to be altered or expects to acquire a right to occupy the premises.

Label: Gambling - stay pending appeal for premises licence
Description: A local authority may direct that the stay on a determination pending an appeal be lifted.

Label: Gambling - planning permission and premises licence
Description: In making a decision in respect of an application under this part a licensing authority shall not have regard to whether or not a proposal by the applicant is likely to be permitted in accordance with the law relating to planning or building.  A decision by a licensing authority under this Part shall not constrain any later decision by the authority under the law relating to planning or building.

Label: Gambling - premises licence fees
Description: A local authority has must comply with regulations regarding fees to be charged.

Label: Gambling - temporary use notice
Description: A local authority must comply with the temporary use of premises notice procedure.

Label: Gambling - delegation of temporary use of premises functions
Description: A local authority must delegate certain functions in respect of the temporary use of premises notice procedure to the licensing committee of the authority.

Label: Gambling - temporary use register
Description: A local authority must maintain, update and make available a register of temporary use notices and follow any regulations made by the Secretary of State.

Label: Gambling - charge for temporary use register copy
Description: A local authority may make a reasonable charge for copies of information contained upon the register of temporary use notices.

Label: Gambling - family entertainment centre gaming machine permit
Description: A local authority must comply with the regime for family entertainment gaming machine permits.

Label: Gambling - club gaming and club machine permits
Description: A local authority must comply with the regime for Club gaming permits and club machine permits.

Label: Gambling - removal of exemption
Description: A local authority may remove certain statutory exemptions to the need to have certain gaming licences if certain conditions are met.

Label: Gambling - prize gaming permit
Description: A local authority must comply with the regime for prize gaming permits.

Label: Gambling - inspection of family entertainment centre
Description: A constable, enforcement officer or authorised local authority officer may enter premises in respect of which an application has been made for a family entertainment centre gaming machine permit for a purpose connected with the consideration of the application or in respect of which a family entertainment centre gaming machine permit has effect for the purpose of determining whether the gaming machines used on the premises, and the arrangements for their use, comply with the requirements of this Act and regulations under it.

Label: Gambling - inspection of premises licensed for alcohol
Description: A local authority may authorise an officer to enter a premises licensed for alcohol for certain purposes.

Label: Gambling - licensed premises gaming machine permits
Description: A local authority must comply with the regime for gaming machine permits.

Label: Gambling - inspection of premises for prize gaming permit
Description: A constable, enforcement officer or authorised local authority officer may enter premises in respect of which an application has been made for a prize gaming permit for a purpose connected with the consideration of the application.  A constable, enforcement officer or authorised local authority officer may enter premises in respect of which a prize gaming permit has effect for the purposes of determining whether prize gaming on the premises complies with the requirements of this Act and regulations under it.

Label: Gambling - inspection of premises of society registered for lotteries
Description: A local authority may authorise an officer to enter premises of registered lottery societies in certain circumstances for certain purposes.

Label: Gambling - prosecution by licensing authority
Description: A local authority may institute criminal proceedings in respect of an offence under stipulated provisions of the Gambling Act 2005.

Label: Gambling - three year licensing policy
Description: A local authority must prepare and publish a three year licensing policy statement, review the same and comply with regulations published by the Secretary of State.

Label: Gambling - exchange of information with regard to licensing functions
Description: A local authority may exchange information to another authorised body or person or to Her Majesty's Commissioners of Customs and Excise for use in the exercise of any function related to gambling licensing functions.

Label: Policy - local area agreement
Description: A local authority when directed to do so by the Secretary of State must prepare a draft local area agreement and should consult with partner authorities and such other persons as appear to it to be appropriate in so doing.

Label: Policy - regard to local improvement targets in local area agreement
Description: A local authority must have regard to local improvement targets in its local area agreement when exercising its functions.

Label: Policy - revision and amendment of targets in local area agreement
Description: Any local improvement target other than a designated target for the time being specified in a local area agreement may be amended, or  removed from the local area agreement,by the responsible local authority with the agreement of any partner authority to which the target relates and after consulting each other person to whom it relates.    The responsible local authority may, with the consent of each person to whom the target in question is to relate, specify a new local improvement target in a local area agreement.  Designated targets may only be amended following consultation with the Secretary of State.

Label: Publication of information - local area agreement
Description: A local authority must publish information regarding its Local Area Agreement.

Label: Health and social care - joint strategic needs assessments
Description: A local authority must prepare a health and social care joint strategic needs assessment and well-being strategy, co-operate with its partners and publish the same when required to do so by the Secretary of State and must have regard to those strategies when exercising its functions.

Label: Members - exercise of any function of a local authority
Description: A local authority may authorise a councillor for a ward or division to discharge its functions (to the extent allowed) in respect of that ward or division.

Label: Health and social care - local involvement networks
Description: A local authority must make prescribed arrangements for its area relating to the commissioning, promoting, provision and scrutiny of local care services.

Label: Health and social care - independent advocacy services
Description: A local authority must make arrangements it considers appropriate for independent advocacy services in its area.

Label: Health and social care - appointment of mental capacity advocate
Description: A local authority must in certain prescribed circumstances appoint an independent mental capacity advocate when dealing with certain issues relating to residential accommodation.

Label: Public health - improving health of people in local area
Description: A local authority must take steps it considers appropriate to improve the health of people living within its area.

Label: Public health - appointment of directors
Description: A local authority must, acting jointly with the Secretary of State, appoint a director of public health.  A local authority must have regard to any guidance given by the Secretary of State in relation to its director of public health, including guidance as to appointment and termination of appointment, terms and conditions and management.

Label: Public health - guidance from Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must have regard to any document published by the Secretary of State when exercising health functions.

Label: Public health - complaints about exercise of public health functions
Description: A local authority must have regard to regulations made in relation to complaints concerning exercise of its health functions.

Label: Public health - arrangements between NHS bodies and local authorities
Description: A local authority must have regard to regulations regarding joint arrangements between the NHS and the local authority for carrying out prescribed arrangements for the discharge of prescribed functions concerning exercise of its health function.

Label: Public health - payments to boards and commissioning groups in England
Description: A local authority may make payments to various boards and commissioning groups in connection with the exercise of its health function and must have regard to directions prescribed by the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Public health - establishment of a care trust
Description: A local authority must publish proposals, inform and consult in the prescribed manner before establishing a care trust.

Label: Public health - directed partnership arrangements in England
Description: A local authority must comply with any directions made by the Secretary of State in respect of directed partnership arrangements for a failing body.

Label: Public health - co-operation between NHS bodies and local authorities
Description: In exercising their respective functions NHS bodies (on the one hand) and local authorities (on the other) must co-operate with one another in order to secure and advance the health and welfare of the people of England and Wales.

Label: Public health - dental public health
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding its dental public health function.

Label: Public health - exercise by local authorities of certain public health functions
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding its public health function.

Label: Public health - joint working with prison service
Description: A local authority must in carrying out its public health function co-operate with the prison service in making arrangements to improve the health of prisoners.

Label: Public health - overview and scrutiny committees
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the review and scrutiny of health services within its area.

Label: Public health - joint overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority may set up a joint overview and scrutiny committee with other local authorities in relation to health services in accordance with Regulations.

Label: Public health - equipment and facilities
Description: A local authority may make equipment and facilities available to other authorities and accommodation available to certain local authority officers.

Label: Public health - provision for the care of mothers
Description: A local authority may make provision for the care of mothers, prevention, care and after-care, home help and laundry facilities,

Label: Social care - home help facilities
Description: A local authority must make provision adequate for its area to provide home help facilities for households with certain characteristics.

Label: Social care - laundry facilities
Description: A local authority may make provision adequate for its area to provide laundry facilities for households with certain characteristics.

Label: Social services - research
Description: A local authority may carry out or may assist another to carry out a research in relation to the powers and duties under the Act.

Label: Schools - medical inspection of pupils at maintained schools
Description: A local authority must carry out the medical inspection of pupils at maintained schools or receiving education otherwise than at school in its area.

Label: Schools - medical inspection of pupils at other schools
Description: A local authority may make arrangements to carry out the medical inspection of pupils at educational establishments not maintained by it in its area with a limited power to charge.

Label: Schools - weighing and measuring of children
Description: A local authority may make arrangements to weigh and measure children in its area.  An authority may be required by the Secretary of State (Minister in Wales) to weigh and measure children and should comply with directions when doing so.

Label: Public health - arrangements between local authorities and NHS bodies
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations made by the Welsh ministers regarding co-operation between them and NHS bodies in Wales.

Label: Public health - payments to board or commissioning group in Wales
Description: A local authority may make payments to a Strategic Health Authority, a Primary Care Trust or a Local Health Board towards expenditure incurred or to be incurred by the body in connection with the performance by it of prescribed functions. in accordance with directions made by the Welsh ministers.

Label: Public health - directed partnership arrangements in Wales
Description: A local authority must enter into directed partnership arrangements when directed by the Welsh ministers.

Label: Public health - health and wellbeing strategies
Description: A local authority must formulate and implement a health and wellbeing strategy in accordance with regulations from the Welsh ministers.

Label: Public health - provision of premises, equipment or accommodation
Description: A local authority may provide premises, equipment or accommodation for certain purposes.

Label: Schools - medical inspection of children in Wales
Description: A local authority must co-operate with Welsh ministers in carrying out the Welsh minister's functions of making arrangements for the medical inspection of children in Wales.

Label: Natural environment - agreement to carry out a DEFRA function
Description: A local authority may enter into an agreement with the Secretary of State to carry out a DEFRA function under the Act.

Label: Natural environment - agreement with another body to carry out designated DEFRA function
Description: A local authority may enter into an agreement with another designated body to carry out a function under the Act.

Label: Safeguarding vulnerable people - referral to the Disclosure and Barring Service
Description: A local authority may refer information to the Disclosure and Barring Service if they have reason to think that the person has engaged in conduct which may result in the risk of harm or actual harm to a child or vulnerable adult.

Label: Safeguarding vulnerable people - provide information to the Disclosure and Barring Service
Description: A local authority must provide information to the Disclosure and Barring Service if requested to do so.

Label: Local community - proposals for sustainability
Description: A local authority may respond to an invitation from the Secretary of State to produce a proposal for sustainable local communities.

Label: Crime reduction - drinking banning order in magistrates court
Description: A local authority may make an application in the magistrates' court for a drinking banning order or to vary or discharge that order if certain conditions are met.

Label: Crime reduction - drinking banning order in county court
Description: A local authority may make an application in the county court for a drinking banning order or to vary or discharge that order if certain conditions are met.

Label: Crime reduction - breach of drinking banning order
Description: A local authority may bring proceedings in respect of the breach of a drinking banning order.

Label: Adoption -  general considerations
Description: A local authority must have regard to the general considerations when exercising its functions under the Act.

Label: Adoption -   maintenance of adoption service
Description: Each local authority must continue to maintain within their area a service designed to meet the needs, in relation to adoption, of children who may be adopted, their parents and guardians, persons wishing to adopt a child, and adopted persons, their parents, natural parents and former guardians and for that purpose must provide the requisite facilities.

Label: Adoption -  assessments for adoption support
Description: A local authority must, in prescribed circumstances, carry out an assessment as to whether an individual requires adoption support services.

Label: Adoption -  inactive or defunct adoption societies
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the appropriate Minister with regard to an inactive or defunct adoption societies.

Label: Adoption -  fees
Description: A local authority may charge fees, as prescribed, in connection with the provision of an overseas adoption service and for other facilities.

Label: Adoption -  information concerning adoption
Description: A local authority must provide the appropriate Minister with the information required regarding its performance of all or any of its functions relating to adoption and the children and other persons in relation to whom it has exercised those functions.

Label: Adoption -  default order
Description: A local authority must comply with instructions contained in any default order issued by the Minister.

Label: Adoption -  inspection of premises
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may inspect the premises where a child is or may be placed for adoption.

Label: Adoption -  placement for adoption by agencies
Description: A local authority may place a child for adoption in certain circumstances.  The authority should comply with regulations for placing a child with prospective adopters when doing so.

Label: Adoption -  applications for placement order
Description: A local authority must apply for a placement order in respect of a child in certain circumstances as detailed in regulations.

Label: Adoption -  varying placement orders
Description: A local authority may apply to vary a placement order in certain circumstances.

Label: Adoption -  revoking placement orders
Description: A local authority may apply to revoke a placement order in certain circumstances.

Label: Adoption -  restriction of parental responsibility
Description: An authority may determine that the parental responsibility of any parent or guardian, or of prospective adopters, is to be restricted to the extent specified in the determination.

Label: Adoption -  contact order
Description: A local authority may apply for a contact order in certain circumstances.

Label: Adoption -  refusal of contact
Description: A local authority may refuse to allow the contact that would otherwise be required by virtue of an order if it is satisfied that it is necessary to do so in order to safeguard or promote the child's welfare, and  the refusal is decided upon as a matter of urgency and does not last for more than seven days.  The authority must comply with regulations when refusing contact.

Label: Adoption -  recovery of child by parent or guardian
Description: A local authority must recover a child when requested to do so by the parent in certain circumstances.

Label: Adoption -  return of child in other cases
Description: A local authority must recover a child when requested to do so by the prospective adopters or where they consider the placement to be unsuitable.

Label: Adoption -  court reports for proposed adoption
Description: A local authority prepare a report for the court and assist the court in any other way regarding the suitability of the proposed adoption in certain circumstances.

Label: Adoption -  disclosing information during adoption process
Description: A local authority must disclose information to prospective adopters in prescribed circumstances.

Label: Adoption -  keeping of information
Description: A local authority must keep prescribed information regarding an adoption in a form and manner which complies with regulations.

Label: Adoption -  restrictions on disclosure of information
Description: A local authority may only disclose information regarding an adoption in prescribed circumstances.

Label: Adoption -  disclosure of information to an adopted adult
Description: A local authority must disclose certain information to an adult adopted person.

Label: Adoption -  counselling services
Description: A local authority must offer counselling services as required by regulations.

Label: Adoption -  information for pre-commencement adoptions
Description: A local authority comply with regulations concerning the provision of information to persons adopted before the appointed day who have attained the age of 18.

Label: Unlawful use of drugs on premises - discharge of closure order
Description: A local authority may make an application that a closure order is discharged in relation to premises where drugs are used unlawfully or may appeal against the refusal to make such an order.

Label: Unlawful use of drugs on premises - reimbursement of costs
Description: A local authority may apply to have the cost of cleaning, securing or maintaining premises where drugs are used unlawfully reimbursed.

Label: Premises associated with persistent disorder or nuisance - closure notice
Description: A local authority may apply for a closure notice with regard to premises associated with persistent disorder or nuisance and enforce that notice or apply for its extension or discharge (with rights to appeal).

Label: Premises associated with persistent disorder or nuisance - reimbursement of costs
Description: A local authority may apply to have the cost of cleaning, securing or maintaining premises associated with persistent disorder or nuisance.

Label: Schools - parenting contracts
Description: A local authority or a school governing body may enter into parenting contract with the parent of a child who has misbehaved at school or is involved in truancy.

Label: Schools - parenting orders
Description: A local authority or a school governing body may apply for a parenting order in respect of the parents of a child who has been excluded from school.

Label: Anti-social behaviour - parenting contracts
Description: A local authority may enter into a parenting contract with parents of a child involved in anti-social behaviour and must have regard to guidance in so doing.

Label: Anti-social behaviour - parenting orders
Description: A local authority may enter into a parenting order with parents of a child involved in anti-social behaviour and must have regard to guidance in so doing.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  contracting out
Description: A local authority may contract out of some of its functions in certain circumstances.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  closure of noisy premises
Description: A chief executive officer of a local authority may in certain circumstances make a closure of noisy premises order or cancel the same.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  penalty notices for graffiti and fly posting
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may issue a penalty notice for graffiti or fly posting.  The amount of the penalty should be as determined by regulations.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  notice to remove graffiti and fly posting
Description: A local authority may serve a notice requiring the removal of graffiti or fly posting and recover its expenditure in so doing and must have regard to guidance from the Secretary of State or National Assembly.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  sale of aerosol paints to children enforcement
Description: It is the duty of every local weights and measures authority to consider, at least once in every period of twelve months, the extent to which it is appropriate for the authority to carry out in their area a programme of enforcement action in relation to section 54 and to the extent that they consider it appropriate to do so, carry out such a programme.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  high hedge complaints
Description: A local authority must consider complaints regarding high hedges according to the procedures under these regulations.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  remedial notices for high hedges
Description: A local authority may issue, withdraw or relax a remedial notice in relation to a complaint regarding high hedges.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  high hedges power of entry
Description: A person authorised by a local authority may enter premises for the purposes of the exercise of the local authority's powers and duties relating to high hedges.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  charging for work on high hedges
Description: A person authorised by a local authority may enter premises to carry out works for which a charge may be made in certain circumstances relating to high hedges.

Label: Fostering - regulation of the exercise of relevant fostering functions
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations in relation to its exercise of its fostering functions.

Label: Care standards - national minimum standards
Description: A local authority must comply with national minimum standards for care agencies and establishments as set out in sub-section 23(1)-(3) of the Act.

Label: Care standards - annual returns
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations requiring them to make an annual return to the regulator.

Label: Care assessments - right of carers to assessment
Description: A local authority must carry out a care assessment if requested to do so by the carer of a disabled adult.

Label: Care - vouchers for temporary care
Description: A local authority must comply with any regulations concerning the provision of vouchers for temporary care whislt a carer has a break from caring.

Label: Care assessments - persons with parental responsibility for disabled children
Description: A local authority must carry out a care assessment if requested to do so by a person with parental responsibility who is a carer of a disabled child.

Label: Care - informing carers of disabled children of right to assessment
Description: A local authority must inform a person with parental responsibility who is a carer of a disabled child of their right to an assessment.

Label: Community care - needs assessment
Description: A local authority must carry out the determination of a patients need for community care services in certain circumstance.

Label: Community care - liability to make delayed discharge payments
Description: A local authority must make prescribed payments to the NHS for a delayed discharge because arrangements are not in place for agreed community care services.

Label: Access land -  byelaws
Description: A local authority may prepare byelaws for any land in relation to which it is the access authority.

Label: Access land -  wardens
Description: An access authority or a district council may appoint such number of persons as may appear to the authority making the appointment to be necessary or expedient, to act as wardens as respects access land in their area.    As respects access land in an area for which there is a local access forum, an access authority shall, before they appoint wardens and thereafter from time to time, consult the local access forum about the exercise of that power.

Label: Access land -  notices
Description: A local authority may erect and maintain notices for specified purposes associated with access land.

Label: Rights of way  - improvement plans
Description: A local authority must prepare rights of way improvement plans in accordance with the requirements of the Act.

Label: Areas of outstanding natural beauty - general duties
Description: A local authority must in carrying out its functions have regard to preserving and enhancing the beauty of areas of outstanding natural beauty.

Label: Areas of outstanding natural beauty - management plans
Description: A local authority must produce and publish management plans in relation to areas of outstanding natural beauty as required by the Act.

Label: Countryside - local access forums
Description: The appointing authority for any area shall in accordance with regulations establish for that area, or for each part of it, an advisory body to be known as a local access forum.

Label: Alcohol -  designated public place
Description: A local authority may designate a place as a designated public place in certain circumstances associated with alcohol related disorder

Label: Alcohol -  effect of designated public place on byelaws
Description: A local authority must have regard to the effect of section 15 relating to byelaws.

Label: Alcohol -  unlicensed premises closure notice
Description: Where a local authority is satisfied that any premises in the area of the authority are being, or within the last 24 hours have been, used for the unauthorised sale of alcohol for consumption on, or in the vicinity of, the premises, the authority may serve a closure notice in respect of the premises.

Label: Alcohol -  unlicensed premises closure order
Description: A local authority may, where a closure notice has been served,  apply for a closure order in relation to unlicensed premises involved in the sale of alcohol.

Label: Alcohol -  termination of unlicensed premises closure orders
Description: A local authority must terminate a closure order when they are satisfied that the need for it has ceased.

Label: Alcohol -  enforcement of unlicensed premises closure orders
Description: An officer authorised by the local authority may enter a premises and take reasonable steps to enforce a closure order.

Label: Education -  suspension of statutory requirements
Description: A local authority may apply to the Secretary of State or National Assembly to have certain statutory requirements suspended or altered.  The application must be in the prescribed form and the application process is subject to prescribed steps.

Label: Education -  formation of or investment in companies to provide services
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may form a governing body company to deliver certain prescribed functions and services.

Label: Education -  incorporation of governing body
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must be corporate and must be incorporated in accordance with regulations and having regard to guidance.

Label: Education -  instruments of government
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must have an instrument of government which determines the constitution of the governing body and other matters relating to the school and which must accord with regulations.

Label: Education -  general responsibility for conduct of schools
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must conduct its school with a view to promoting high standards of educational achievement and in accordance with regulations.

Label: Education -  training and support of governors
Description: The local education authority shall (to the extent that they are not otherwise required to secure the provision of such information) secure that every governor is provided, free of charge, with such information as they consider appropriate in connection with the discharge of his functions as governor, and secure that there is made available to every governor, free of charge, such training as they consider necessary for the effective discharge of those functions.

Label: Education -  clerk to the governing body
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must appoint a clerk in accordance with the regulations.

Label: Education - parent council for foundation school
Description: A governing body of certain foundation schools maintained by a local authority must establish a parent council in accordance with regulations.

Label: Education -  federations of schools
Description: Where prescribed by regulations the governing bodies of two or more schools maintained by a local authority may establish a federation.

Label: Education -  collaboration between schools
Description: Where prescribed by regulations the governing bodies of two or more schools maintained by a local authority may collaborate.

Label: Education -  provision of community facilities
Description: The governing body of a maintained school shall have power to provide any facilities or services whose provision furthers any charitable purpose for the benefit of pupils at the school or their families, or people who live or work in the locality in which the school is situated.

Label: Education -  provision and funding of higher education in maintained schools
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may arrange the provision to pupils at the school courses in preparation for professional examinations at a higher level or providing education at a higher level.      A governing body may exercise the power in relation to a particular pupil only if they are satisfied that the provision to that pupil of the course in question will not to any significant extent interfere with the other education with which he is being provided at the school.

Label: Education -  complaints procedure in maintained schools
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must establish and publicise a complaints procedure.

Label: Education -  attendance outside school premises
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may require pupils to attend anywhere outside of the school premises for the purposes of education or training.

Label: Education -  health and safety on school premises or for activities elsewhere
Description: A governing body of certain maintained schools must comply with a direction given by the local authority concerning the health and safety of persons on the school's premises or taking part in any school activities elsewhere.

Label: Education - provision for improving behaviour
Description: The governing body of a maintained school may require any registered pupil to attend at any place outside the school premises for the purpose of receiving educational provision which is intended to improve the behaviour of the pupil.  Any such provision must comply with regulations.

Label: Education - governers' report in Wales
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by the local authority in Wales shall, once in every school year, prepare a governing body report as required by regulations.

Label: Education -  governing body reports
Description: A local authority may require any school maintained by it to provide such reports as it requires relating to the discharge of the governing body's functions.

Label: Education -  term and holiday dates
Description: A local authority or the governing body, depending on the type of maintained school, must set the start and end dates of school terms and comply with regulations when so doing.

Label: Education -  arrangements for government of new schools
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for the constitution of a temporary governing body for a new maintained school.

Label: Education -  staffing of community, voluntary controlled, community special, maintained nursery schools
Description: A local authority must be the employer in community, voluntary controlled, community special and maintained nursery schools and has certain powers and duties accordingly.

Label: Education -  staffing of foundation, voluntary aided and foundation special schools
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must be the employer in voluntary aided and foundation and foundation special schools and has certain powers and duties accordingly.

Label: Education -  payments in respect of dismissal
Description: A local authority must meet the cost of the dismissal, resignation or retirement of staff employed by the governing body in schools maintained by the same in certain circumstances.

Label: Education -  accounts of maintained schools
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must prepare, keep and distribute accounts as required by regulations.

Label: Education - exclusion of pupils from school
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with prescribed requirements when excluding a pupil.

Label: Education - advisory services
Description: A local authority must comply with a direction to obtain advisory services.

Label: Education -  National Curriculum minimum requirements in England
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must ensure that school meets the minimum requirements on the National Curriculum as set out in section 78 of the Act.

Label: Education -  implementation of National Curriculum in England
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must ensure that school implements the National Curriculum.

Label: Education -  National Curriculum exceptions by direction and regulations in England
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must modify or not apply the National Curriculum where directed to do so by the Secretary of State

Label: Education -  pupils with EHC plan in England
Description:
The special educational provision for any pupil specified in an EHC plan maintained for the pupil may include provision— 

 excluding the application of the National Curriculum for England, or
applying the National Curriculum for England with such modifications as may be specified in the plan.

Label: Education -  temporary exceptions to National Curriculum for individual pupils in England
Description: A head teacher of a school maintained by a local authority may, where prescribed, not apply or may modify the national curriculum in relation to an individual pupil.

Label: Education -  National Curriculum minimum requirements in Wales
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must ensure that school meets the minimum requirements on the national curriculum as set out in section 99 of the Act.

Label: Education -  implementation of National Curriculum in Wales
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must ensure that school implement the national curriculum.

Label: Education -  National Curriculum exceptions by direction and regulations in Wales
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must modify or not apply the national curriculum where directed to do so by the Assembly.

Label: Education -  pupils with statements of special educational needs in Wales
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may not apply or may modify the national curriculum in statements of special educational need.

Label: Education -  temporary exceptions to National Curriculum for individual pupils in Wales
Description: A head teacher of a school maintained by a local authority may, where prescribed, not apply or may modify the National Curriculum in statements of special educational need in relation to an individual pupil.

Label: Education - local curriculum key stage 4 in Wales
Description: A local authority must form, plan and deliver one or more local curricula for key stage 4 pupils in the prescribed manner.

Label: Education -  teachers pay and conditions
Description: A local authority and governing body of a maintained school must ensure that maintained schools comply with an Order and any guidance made regarding teachers pay and conditions.

Label: Education -  teachers pay and conditions in education action zones
Description: A governing body of a maintained school may where there is an education action zone in force apply to the Secretary of State for an order giving it control over teachers pay and conditions.  The local education authority shall do anything necessary to give effect to the governing body's determination.

Label: Education -  teacher appraisal
Description: The local authority of a maintained school and its governing body must comply with regulations regarding teacher appraisals.

Label: Education -  teacher health and fitness
Description: The local authority of a maintained school and its governing body must comply with regulations regarding teacher health and fitness for certain activities.

Label: Education -  supply of information following teacher dismissal
Description: The local authority of a maintained school must where appropriate supply the Secretary State with prescribed information in a situation where a teacher's employment terminates in circumstances where there is (alleged) gross misconduct.

Label: Education -  funded nursery education
Description: The local authority in Wales must have regard to guidance from the Assembly when making arrangements under section 118 of the School Standards and Frameworks Act 1998.

Label: Education -  duties in relation to welfare of children
Description: The local authority of a maintained school and its governing body must exercise its education function with a view to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, having regard to guidance when so doing.

Label: Education -  consultation with pupils
Description: The local authority of a maintained school and its governing body in relation to the exercise of their school related functions must have regard to guidance about consultation with pupils.

Label: Education -  academic and vocational qualifications
Description: A local authority may award or authenticate academic or vocational qualifications.

Label: Education - consideration of regional SEN provision
Description: A local authority in Wales, must when directed to do so by the National Assembly, consider whether their SEN duties could be carried out more efficiently or effectively if regional provision was made.

Label: Education -  directed regional SEN provision
Description: A local authority in Wales, must comply with directions from the National Assembly regarding regional provision for SEN.

Label: Education - publication and provision of materials
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school in Wales, must publish and provide certain materials when directed to do so by the National Assembly.

Label: Education -  partnership agreements and statements
Description: A local authority must enter into a partnership agreement with the governing body of each school maintained by that authority, or each such school of a prescribed class when required to do so by Regulations.

Label: Education -  transition plans
Description: A governing body of a maintained school must co-operate with other governing bodies to draw up transition plans from primary to secondary school and comply with guidance.

Label: Fire and rescue - conditions of service of fire brigade members
Description: A fire and rescue authority must comply with a Direction made by the Secretary of State regarding the conditions of service of fire brigade members.

Label: Licensing -  fireworks suppliers
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the licensing of fireworks.

Label: Social services - review and inspections by Assembly
Description: A local authority must comply with an investigation and make prescribed payments to the Assembly in relation to an investigation into its social services function.

Label: Social services - investigation of complaints
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the investigation of complaints relating to its social services function.

Label: Homelessness strategy
Description: A local authority must exercise its power to review provision for homelessness in its district and must formulate and publish a strategy for dealing with the same.

Label: Homelessness strategy - co-operation with housing authority
Description: A local authority with a social services function must co-operate with any separate housing authority for its area in assisting it to draw up a homelessness strategy and must take that strategy into account when exercising its functions.

Label: Housing - review of housing conditions
Description: A local authority must keep the housing conditions in their area under review with a view to identifying any action that may need to be taken by them under various enactments/provisions.

Label: Housing - inspection of residential premises for category 1 or 2 hazard
Description: A local authority must, if they think it appropriate to do so or if an official complaint is made, inspect any residential premises in their district with a view to determining whether any category 1 or 2 hazard exists on those premises.

Label: Housing - enforcement action category 1 hazard
Description: A local authority must take the appropriate enforcement action, as definedin legislation, where a Category 1 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - enforcement action category 2 hazard
Description: A local authority may take enforcement action, as specified in the legislation,where a category 2 hazard is identified on residential premises.

Label: Housing - reasons for decision to take enforcement action on category 1 or 2 hazard
Description: A local authority must prepare and serve a statement of reasons when taking enforcement action on residential premises with category 1 or 2 hazards pursuant to section 5 or section 7.

Label: Housing - guidance about inspection and enforcement action
Description: A local authority must have regard to guidance given by the appropriate national authority regarding in relation to the inspection of premises and the assessment of hazards, improvement notices, prohibition orders or hazard awareness notices, emergency remedial action and emergency prohibition orders or demolition orders and slum clearance.

Label: Housing consultation with fire and rescue authority on enforcement action
Description: A local authority must consult with the fire and rescue authority before taking enforcement action where certain risks are identified.

Label: Housing - improvement notice where category 1 hazard
Description: A local authority must in certain circumstances serve an improvement notice where a category 1 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - improvement notice where category 2 hazard
Description: A local authority may serve an improvement notice where a category 2 hazard is identified on any residential premises.

Label: Housing - suspension of improvement notice
Description: A local authority may incorporate provisions for suspension into an improvement notice served under sections 11 or 12.

Label: Housing - mandatory revocation of improvement notice
Description: A local authority must revoke an improvement notice if they are satisfied it been complied with.

Label: Housing - discretionary revocation of an improvement notice
Description: A local authority may revoke an improvement notice if, in the case of a notice served under section 11, they consider that there are any special circumstances making it appropriate to revoke the notice or in the case of a notice served under section 12, they consider that it is appropriate to revoke the notice.

Label: Housing - discretionary review of suspended improvement notice
Description: A local authority may at any time review an improvement notice whose operation is suspended.    Copies of the authority's decision on a review under this section must be served on the person on whom the improvement notice was served, and on every other person on whom a copy of the notice was required to be served.

Label: Housing - mandatory review of suspended improvement notice
Description: The local housing authority must review an improvement notice whose operation is suspended not later than one year after the date of service of the notice and at subsequent intervals of not more than one year.    Copies of the authority's decision on a review under this section must be served on the person on whom the improvement notice was served, and on every other person on whom a copy of the notice was required to be served.

Label: Housing - improvement notices appeals procedure
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure and appeals procedure relating to improvement notices.

Label: Housing - prohibition order where category 1 hazard
Description: A local authority must in certain circumstances serve a prohibition order where a Category 1 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - prohibition order where category 2 hazard
Description: A local authority may serve a prohibition order where a Category 2 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - suspension of prohibition order
Description: A local authority may incorporate provisions for suspension into a prohibition order served under  sections 20 or 21.

Label: Housing - mandatory revocation of prohibition order
Description: A local authority must revoke a prohibition order notices once the hazard to which it relates no longer exists.

Label: Housing - discretionary revocation of prohibition order
Description: A local authority may revoke a prohibition in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing - discretionary review of suspended prohibition order
Description: A local authority may review a prohibition order in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing - mandatory review of suspended prohibition order
Description: A local authority must review a prohibition order in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing - prohibition order appeals procedure
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure and appeals procedure relating to prohibition orders.

Label: Housing - hazard awareness notice where category 1 hazard
Description: A local authority must in certain circumstances serve a hazard awareness notice where a category 1 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - hazard awareness notice where category 2 hazard
Description: A local authority may serve a hazard awareness notice where a category 2 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - improvement notices enforcement action
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure and appeals procedure relating to enforcement action for improvement notices if the same is used.

Label: Housing - emergency remedial action where category 1 hazard
Description: A local authority must in certain circumstances take emergency remedial action where a Category 1 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - emergency prohibition order where category 1 hazard
Description: A local authority must in certain circumstances issue an emergency prohibition order where a category 1 hazard is identified.

Label: Housing - charging for certain enforcement action
Description: A local housing authority may make such reasonable charge as they consider appropriate as a means of recovering certain administrative and other expenses incurred by them in serving an improvement notice under section 11 or 12, making a prohibition order under section 20 or 21, serving a hazard awareness notice under section 28 or 29, taking emergency remedial action under section 40, making an emergency prohibition order under section 43 or making a demolition order under section 265 of the Housing Act 1985 (c. 68).

Label: Houses in multiple occupation - general duties
Description: A local authority must -  (i) make such arrangements as are necessary to secure the effective implementation in their district of the licensing regime;  (ii) ensure that all applications for licences and other issues falling to be determined by them are determined within a reasonable time; and  (iii) satisfy itself, as soon as is reasonably practicable, that there are no Part 1 functions that ought to be exercised by them in relation to the premises.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  additional licensing
Description: A local authority may in certain circumstances designate their area or part of their area as subject to additional licensing in relation to HMOs.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  publication of additional licensing designation
Description: A local authority must publish a notice regarding the designation of an area as a special licensing area for HMOs in the manner prescribed.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  review of additional licensing designation
Description: A local authority must review the designation of an area as a special licensing area for HMOs and if a decision to revoke is made they must publish a notice in the manner prescribed.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  licensing applications
Description: A local authority must take reasonable steps to ensure licensing applications are received from all HMOs.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  temporary exemption from licensing requirements
Description: A local authority may issue a temporary exemption notice from licensing requirements in respect of HMOs.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  licence fees
Description: A local authority may set requirements for and charge a fee in respect of applications for HMO licences.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  grant or refusal of licence
Description: A local authority must grant or refuse an application for a HMO licence subject to such conditions as may be prescribed or determined by the authority.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  variation of licence
Description: The local housing authority may vary a licence if they do so with the agreement of the licence holder, or if they consider that there has been a change of circumstances since the time when the licence was granted.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  revocation of licence
Description: A local authority may revoke a licence relating to a HMO.

Label: Houses in multiple occupation -  rent repayment order
Description: A local authority may apply for a rent repayment order where an HMO is being operated without the appropriate licence in the prescribed manner.

Label: Housing - selective licensing of other residential accommodation
Description: A local authority mustof the  (i) make such arrangements as are necessary to secure the effective implementation in their district of the licensing regime; and  (ii) ensure that all applications for licences and other issues falling to be determined by them are determined within a reasonable time.

Label: Housing - designation of selective licensing areas
Description: A local authority may subject to certain conditions being met designate the whole or part of their area as a selective licensing area.

Label: Housing -  publication of notice of selective licensing area
Description: A local authority must publish a notice in the prescribed form relating to selective licensing areas.

Label: Housing -  review and revocation of selective licensing areas
Description: A local authority must review and in certain circumstances revoke a designation relating to selective licensing areas.

Label: Housing -  requirement for Part 3 houses to be licensed
Description: A local authority must take all reasonable steps to secure that applications for licences are made to them in respect of houses in their area which are required to be licensed.

Label: Housing - temporary exemption from selective licensing
Description: A local authority in certain circumstances may issue a notice allowing for a temporary exemption from licensing.

Label: Housing - application and fee for selective licence
Description: A local authority may set requirements for and charge a fee in respect of applications for selective licensing areas.

Label: Housing -  grant or refusal of licence in selective licensing area
Description: A local authority must grant or refuse an application for a residential accommodation licence subject to such conditions as may be prescribed or determined by the authority

Label: Housing - variation of licence in selective licensing area
Description: The local housing authority may vary a licence if they do so with the agreement of the licence holder, or if they consider that there has been a change of circumstances since the time when the licence was granted.  For this purpose change of circumstances includes any discovery of new information.

Label: Housing -  revocation of licence in selective licensing area
Description: A local authority may revoke a residential accommodation licence where conditions specified in the regulations apply.

Label: Housing -  rent repayment orders for unlicensed houses
Description: A local authority may apply for a rent repayment order in the prescribed manner where a house which requires a licence is unlicensed.

Label: Housing - mandatory interim management orders
Description: A local authority must make an interim management order in certain circumstances as detailed in regulations.

Label: Housing - discretionary interim management orders
Description: A local authority may make an interim management order in certain circumstances and must take certain steps once it is in force.

Label: Housing - mandatory final management orders
Description: A local authority must make a final management order in certain circumstances and must take certain steps once it is in force.

Label: Housing - discretionary final management orders
Description: A local authority may make a final management order in certain circumstances and must take certain steps once it is in force.

Label: Housing - management scheme for final management orders
Description: A local authority must prepare a management scheme when a final management order is in force.

Label: Housing - variation to final management orders
Description: A local authority may may vary a final management order if they consider it appropriate to do so.

Label: Housing - revocation of final management orders
Description: A local authority may revoke a final management order where conditions for revocation, as defined in the legislation, are met.

Label: Housing - furniture in housing subject to a management order
Description: A local authority may renounce its ownership of or supply furniture for a house to which an interim or final management order relates in certain circumstances as defined in the legislation.

Label: Housing - compensation where housing subject to management orders
Description: A local authority may pay compensation in respect of any interference with the rights of a third party in consequence of an interim or final management order.

Label: Housing - financial arrangements on termination of management order
Description: A local authority must pay the financial balance in certain circumstances on the termination of a final management order.

Label: Housing - right of entry to carry out work where management order
Description: A local authority may enter a house and carry out work in certain circumstances whilst a management order is in place.

Label: Housing -  interim empty dwelling management order
Description: A local authority may make an interim empty dwelling management order in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing -  management where interim EDMO in force
Description: A local authority must take certain steps when an interim empty dwelling management order is in place or revoke the order.

Label: Housing -  final empty dwelling management order
Description: A local authority may make a final empty dwelling management order in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing -  management where final EDMO in force
Description: A local authority must take certain steps when a final empty dwelling management order is in place and must from time to time review the operation of the order.

Label: Housing -  compensation for interim EDMO
Description: A local authority must pay compensation to third parties while an interim EDMO is in force in respect of a dwelling in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing -  compensation for final EDMO
Description: A local authority may pay compensation to a third party in respect of any interference in consequence of a final EDMO with his rights.

Label: Housing -  overcrowding notice for HMO
Description: The local housing authority may serve an overcrowding notice on one or more relevant persons if, having regard to the rooms available, it considers that an excessive number of persons is being, or is likely to be, accommodated in the HMO concerned.  When serving the notice the authority must comply with relevant regulations.

Label: Housing -  variation or revocation of overcrowding notices
Description: A local authority may vary or revoke an overcrowding notice.

Label: Gypsies and travellers - review of accommodation needs
Description: A local authority must incorporate a review of the housing needs of gypsies and travellers into their review carried out under section 8 of the Housing Act 1985.

Label: Gypsies and travellers - preparation of strategy for accommodation needs
Description: A local authority must where it is required under section 87 of the Local Government Act 2003 to prepare a strategy in respect of the meeting of such accommodation needs, take that strategy into account when exercising its functions.

Label: Housing - register of licences and management orders
Description: A local authority must establish, maintain and allow inspection of a register of licences and management orders and must provide copies of documents for which they may charge a fee.

Label: Housing - acquisition and use of information
Description: A local authority may obtain and utilise information in certain circumstances as defined in regulations.

Label: Housing - power of entry to premises
Description: A local authority may enter premises in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing - additional notice requirements for protection of owners
Description: A local authority must provide the owner of premises with notice of any action taken by them in relation to the premises in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing - service of documents
Description: A local authority must  take all actions specified in regulations before serving certain notices under the Act.

Label: Housing - licences and other documents in electronic form
Description: A local authority may serve certain licences and notices in electronic form.

Label: Housing - house in multiple occupation declaration
Description: A local authority may serve a notice in the prescribed form declaring a building to be a house in multiple occupation.

Label: Housing -  revocation of HMO declaration
Description: A local authority may revoke a declaration that a building is a house in multiple occupation.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing - general duties of licensing authorities
Description: A local authority must in carrying out its functions have regard to the licensing objectives the licensing statement and the Guidance of the Secretary of State.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing - policy statement
Description: A local authority must for each 5 year period consult upon, formulate and publish a licensing policy statement.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  licensing committee
Description: A local authority must establish a licensing committee.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  exercise and delegation of functions
Description: A local authority must delegate certain licensing functions to its licensing committee and the committee must discharge those functions on behalf of the authority.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licencing -  register
Description: A local authority must prepare, maintain, make available for inspection a register of licensed premises and other licences and provide copies of documents for which a fee may be charged.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  sub-committees
Description: A local authority may create licensing sub-committees to discharge certain licensing functions.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  premises licence determination
Description: A local authority must grant a premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  premises licence provisional statement
Description: A local authority must issue a provisional statement for a premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  variation to premises licence
Description: A local authority must vary a premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  minor variation to premises licence
Description: A local authority must consider applications for minor variations to a premises licence and grant or reject the variations as relevant according to conditions specified in the regulations.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  transfer of premises licence interim effect
Description: A local authority must give an application for transfer of a premises licence interim effect if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  transfer of premises licence
Description: A local authority must grant an application for transfer of a premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  premises licence interim authority notice
Description: Where a premises licence lapses as a result of death, incapacity or insolvency of the holder but no application for the transfer of the licence has been made the local authority must grant an application for an interim authority notice if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  re-instatement of premises licence
Description: A local authority must re-instate a premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  review of premises licence
Description: A local authority must review a premises licence subject to certain conditions and prescribed requirements and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  suspension of premises licence
Description: A local authority must suspend a premises licence where the annual pay has not been paid subject to certain conditions and prescribed requirements and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  update of premises licence
Description: Where the relevant licensing authority, in relation to a premises licence, makes a determination or receives a notice under this Part, a premises licence lapses under this Part, or an appeal against a decision under this Part is disposed of,the relevant licensing authority must make the appropriate amendments (if any) to the licence and, if necessary, issue a new summary of the licence.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  inspection of premises for grant of premises licence
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may inspect a premises before the grant of a licence and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  club premises certificate applications
Description: A local authority must grant a club premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  name or rule change for club premises certificate
Description: A local authority must amend a club premises certificate when notified in the proper form of a change of name or a change of club rules.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  change of registered address for club premises certificate
Description: A local authority must amend a club premises certificate when notified in the proper form of a change of address.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  variation to club premises certificate
Description: A local authority must vary a club premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or reject if they are not.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  club premises certificate review
Description: A local authority must review a club premises licence if certain conditions and prescribed requirements are met or may reject the application if they are not.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  withdrawal of club premises certificate
Description: Where a club holds a club premises certificate, and it appears to the relevant licensing authority that the club does not satisfy the conditions for being a qualifying club in relation to a qualifying club activity to which the certificate relates, the authority must give a notice to the club withdrawing the certificate, so far as relating to that activity.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  suspension of club premises certificate
Description: A local authority must suspend a club premises certificate if the annual fee is not pad.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  club premises certificate update
Description: Where the relevant licensing authority, in relation to a club premises certificate, makes a determination or receives a notice under this Part, or an appeal against a decision under this Part is disposed of,the relevant licensing authority must make the appropriate amendments (if any) to the certificate and, if necessary, issue a new summary of the certificate.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  request to produce club premises certificate
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may require production of the club premises certificate in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  inspection prior to grant of club premises certificate
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may inspect premises before the grant of a certificate.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  acknowledgement of temporary event notice
Description: A local authority must acknowledge a properly formulated temporary event notice in the required timescale.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing - counter notice to temporary event notice
Description: A local authority must serve a counter notice to a temporary event notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  modification of temporary event notice
Description: A local authority may modify a temporary event notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing - conditions on temporary event notice
Description: A local authority may impose conditions upon a temporary event notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  counter notice where temporary event notice limit exceeded
Description: A local authority must issue a counter notice to a temporary events notice in certain circumstances where permitted limits on the number of temporary event notices have been exceeded.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  right of entry where temporary event notice given
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may enter a premises which is subject to a temporary events notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  request for production of temporary event notice
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may request the production of the temporary events notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  issue of copy temporary event notice
Description: A local authority must issue a replacement temporary event notice in certain circumstances where an acknowledged temporary event notice is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed and that the premises user has reported that loss or theft to the police.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  personal licence applications and renewals
Description: A local authority must grant or renew a personal licence or reject the application in certain circumstances and take certain prescribed steps

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  convictions after grant or renewal of personal licence
Description: A local authority must notify the Chief officer of police and consider revocation of licence in relation to certain convictions.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  form of personal licence
Description: A local authority must issue a personal licence in the prescribed form.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  copy personal licence
Description: Where the relevant licensing authority receives an application for a copy personal licence it must issue the licence holder with a copy of the licence (certified by the authority to be a true copy) if it is satisfied that the licence has been lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, and where it has been lost or stolen, the holder of the licence has reported the loss or theft to the police.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  update of personal licence document
