Description: A local authority must update a personal licence in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  request to inspect personal licence
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may inspect a personal licence in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  enforcement of prohibition on sale of alcohol to children
Description: A local authority must enforce sections 146 and 147 of the Act prohibiting sales of alcohol to children.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  review of premises licence following closure order
Description: A local authority must review a premises licence when a closure order has been made and take certain prescribed steps when so doing.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  closure notice for persistently selling alcohol to children
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may issue a closure notice in the prescribed form in certain circumstances in respect of a premises that persistently sells alcohol to children.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  early morning alcohol restriction order
Description: A local authority may make, vary or revoke an early morning alcohol restriction order in certain circumstances.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  rights of entry to investigate licensable activities
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may enter premises, subject to certain circumstances, to investigate licensable activities.

Label: Alcohol and entertainment licensing -  proceedings for offences
Description: A local authority may bring proceedings for certain offences under the Act.

Label: Finance - borrowing money
Description: A local authority may borrow money for any purpose relevant to its functions under any enactment, or for the purposes of the prudent management of its financial affairs.  Any borrowing is subject to conditions as specified in regulations.

Label: Finance - affordable borrowing limit
Description: A local authority must determine its affordable borrowing limit.

Label: Finance - transfer of headroom
Description: A local authority may transfer any headroom that it has in relation to a borrowing limit to another local authority in certain circumstances.

Label: Finance - control of credit arrangements
Description: A local authority must comply with restrictions imposed in relation to it entering into credit arrangements.

Label: Finance - use of capital receipts
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding capital receipts

Label: Finance - power to invest
Description: A local authority may invest for any purpose relevant to its functions under any enactment, or for the purposes of the prudent management of its financial affairs.

Label: Finance - providing information to the Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must provide the Secretary of State with such information relating to borrowing and investment as he shall request.

Label: Finance - regard to guidance from Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with guidance and statutory instruments issued by the Secretary of State with regard to its borrowing and investment powers and duties.

Label: Finance - accounting practices
Description: A local authority must comply with statutory instruments regarding the accounting practices that it should follow.

Label: Finance - budget calculations
Description: A chief finance officer of a local authority must report on the robustness of estimates and the adequacy of financial reserves.

Label: Finance - report on inadequacy of controlled reserve
Description: A chief finance officer of a local authority must report upon any inadequacy of any controlled reserve.

Label: Finance - budget monitoring
Description: A local authority must review its budget calculations during the year from time to time.

Label: Finance - compliance with terms of grants
Description: A local authority must comply with the terms of any grant made by the Secretary of State.

Label: Finance - compliance with terms of grant for service excellence/best value
Description: A local authority must comply with the terms of any grant made for service excellence/best value.

Label: Finance - payments towards local authority indebtedness
Description: A local authority must comply with the terms of any payment made to deal with its indebtedness.

Label: Business improvement district - arrangements
Description: A local authority may make business improvement district arrangements for all or part of its area.

Label: Business improvement district - additional contributions and action
Description: A local authority may make contributions or take action towards BID arrangements for its area.

Label: Business improvement district - compliance
Description: A local authority must comply with any BID arrangements  in force for its area.

Label: Business improvement district -  BID levy
Description: A local authority must calculate the BID Levy in accordance with any BID arrangements in force for its area.

Label: Business improvement district -  BID revenue account
Description: A local authority must when BID arrangements are in force for its area keep and maintain a BID revenue account.

Label: Business improvement district -  administration of BID levy
Description: A local authority comply with statutory instruments regarding administration of the BID Levy.

Label: Business improvement district -  BID proposals
Description: A local authority comply with statutory instruments regarding the drawing up, content and approval of BID proposals.

Label: Business improvement district -  approval in ballot
Description: A local authority must carry out a ballot regarding BID proposals in the required manner.

Label: Business improvement district -  veto
Description: A local authority may veto BID proposals in certain prescribed circumstances taking certain prescribed steps.

Label: Business improvement district -  appeal against veto
Description: A local authority must comply with the outcome of any appeal against its veto of BID proposals.

Label: Business improvement district -  commencement and duration of BID arrangements
Description: The billing authority concerned must ensure that BID arrangements which give effect to the proposals are made by the time the arrangements are to come into force and are to have effect for such period as may be specified in the arrangements in accordance with regulations.

Label: Policy - housing finance strategies and statements
Description: A local authority must prepare such housing strategies and statements as may be required.

Label: Policy -  charging for discretionary services
Description: A local authority may charge the service recipient for certain discretionary services.

Label: Policy -  trading in function-related activities through a company
Description: A local authority may as authorised by regulations trade in function related activities through a company.

Label: Consultation -  local polls
Description: A local authority may conduct a local poll in relation to its functions or services.

Label: Licensing/registration - register of motor salvage operators
Description: A local authority must establish and maintain a register of motor salvage operators.

Label: Licensing/registration -  cancellation of motor salvage operator registration
Description: A local authority may cancel a person's registration in the register for their area if they are satisfied that he is not a fit and proper person to carry on business as a motor salvage operator.

Label: Licensing/registration - proceedings for offences related to motor salvage operators
Description: A local authority may institute proceedings for an offence under Part I of the Act.

Label: Licensing/registration - entry to property of registration plate supplier
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may enter a and inspect the premises of a registered registration plate supplier for the purposes of enforcing the Act.

Label: Licensing/registration - proceedings for offences related to registration plate suppliers
Description: A local authority may institute proceedings under Part II of the Act.

Label: Immigration and asylum - accommodation centres
Description: A local authority may assist in the provision of an accommodation centre including the provision of services and reasonable expenditure.

Label: Immigration and asylum -  disclosure of information
Description: A local authority must supply the Secretary of State with information for the purpose of establishing where a person is when requested to do so.

Label: Planning and development - survey of area in England
Description: A local authority must keep under review the matters which may be expected to affect the development of their area or the planning of its development.

Label: Planning and development - survey of area related to county matters
Description: A county council in respect of so much of their area for which there is a district council must keep under review the matters which may be expected to affect development of that area or the planning of its development in so far as the development relates to a county matter.

Label: Planning and development - local development schemes
Description: A local authority must prepare, maintain and revise a scheme to be known as their local development scheme as directed.

Label: Planning and development - minerals and waste development scheme
Description: A county council in respect of so much of their area for which there is a district council must prepare and maintain a scheme to be known as their minerals and waste development scheme

Label: Planning and development - statement of community involvement
Description: A local authority must prepare a statement of community involvement.

Label: Planning and development - preparation of local development documents
Description: A local authority must prepare and submit development plan documents as directed.

Label: Planning and development - withdrawal of local development documents
Description: A local authority may withdraw local development documents at any time before adoption.

Label: Planning and development - adoption of local development documents
Description: The local planning authority may adopt a local development document (other than a development plan document) either as originally prepared or as modified to take account of any representations made in relation to the document  or any other matter they think is relevant.

Label: Planning and development - discretionary revision of local development documents
Description: The local planning authority may at any time prepare a revision of a local development document.

Label: Planning and development - mandatory revision of local development documents
Description: The authority must prepare a revision of a local development document if the Secretary of State directs them to do so, and in accordance with such timetable as he directs.

Label: Planning and development - reimbursement of costs to Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must pay the costs of the Secretary of State where he utilises his default power  if he thinks that a local planning authority are failing or omitting to do anything it is necessary for them to do in connection with the preparation, revision or adoption of a development plan document.

Label: Planning and development - joint local development documents
Description: Two or more local authority may prepare local development documents and may request the Secretary of State's involvement in the dissolution of the arrangement.

Label: Planning and development - discretionary joint committees
Description: One or more local authorities may agree with one or more county councils in relation to any area of such a council for which there is also a district council to establish a joint committee to be the local planning authority

Label: Planning and development - mandatory joint committees
Description: Local authorities must comply with the Secretary of State's direction to establish or to revoke a joint committee.

Label: Planning and development - co-operation in relation to sustainable development
Description: Local authorities must co-operate in relation to the planning of sustainable development.

Label: Planning and development - regard to Secretary of State's guidance
Description: Local authorities must have regard to the Secretary of State's guidance when exercising their functions with relation to local development.

Label: Planning and development - local development monitoring reports
Description: Local authorities must prepare and make available monitoring reports on local development as directed.

Label: Planning and development - neighbourhood development plans
Description: Local authorities must prepare a neighbourhood development plan in certain circumstances

Label: Planning and development - sustainable development
Description: A local authority must exercise various functions under the Act with a view to achieving sustainable development.

Label: Development control -  response to consultation
Description: A local authority must respond to consultation in accordance with regulations.

Label: Planning and development Wales - survey of area in Wales
Description: A local authority must keep under review the matters which may be expected to affect the development of their area or the planning of its development.

Label: Planning and development Wales - local development plan
Description: A local authority must prepare and appraise a local development plan as directed.

Label: Planning and development Wales - intervention by Assembly
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the Assembly.

Label: Planning and development Wales - withdrawal of local development plan
Description: A local authority may withdraw a local development plan at any time before it is adopted.

Label: Planning and development Wales - adoption of local development plan
Description: A local authority may adopt a local development plan in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning and development Wales - revocation of local development plan
Description: A local authority may request the Assembly to revoke a local development plan.

Label: Planning and development Wales - review of local development plan
Description: A local authority must review a local development plan as directed.

Label: Planning and development Wales - revision of local development plan
Description: A local authority must revise a local development plan in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning and development -  expenditure of Assembly
Description: A local authority must pay the expenditure of the Assembly in relation to the exercise of their default power in connection with the preparation, revision or adoption of a local development plan.

Label: Planning and development Wales -  regard to guidance from Assembly
Description: A local authority must in exercising any function under Part 6 of the Act have regard to Guidance from the Assembly.

Label: Planning and development Wales -  annual monitoring report
Description: A local authority must prepare an annual monitoring report to the Assembly in the manner directed.

Label: Licensing and registration - private security industry licence
Description: A local authority must comply with any Regulations issued regarding private security industry licensing.

Label: Social care - charge on land for part 3 accommodation
Description: A local authority may take a charge on land in relation to the provision of Part 3 accommodation.

Label: Social care - deferred payments for part 3 accommodation
Description: A local authority must comply with any directions issued with regard to deferred payment agreements relating to the provision of Part 3 accommodation.

Label: Social care - direct payments regulations
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to the making of direct payments.

Label: Trading standards - tobacco advertising and promotion enforcement
Description: A local authority must enforce the Act and the provisions made therein.

Label: Trading standards - entry to premises for tobacco advertising and promotion enforcement
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may enter premises and make purchases (subject to certain conditions and obligations) in order to enforce the Act.

Label: Waste disposal - landfills
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding performance of their functions with regard to disposal of waste in landfills.

Label: Waste disposal -  municipal waste management strategy
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with regulations regarding its municipal waste management strategy.

Label: Waste disposal -  provision of information about waste
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with regulations requiring it to provide information about waste.

Label: Waste disposal -  joint municipal waste management strategies
Description: Local authorities in a two tier area must produce and publish a joint municipal waste management strategy and make the same available.

Label: Water conservation by public authorities
Description: Local authorities must take water conservation into account when exercising their functions.

Label: Carers - assessment of ability of carers to provide care
Description: A local authority must carry out an assessment of a carer's ability to provide care in certain circumstances when requested to do so by the carer and must inform the carer of his right to make this request.

Label: Clean air -  exemption from requirements regarding grit and dust emissions from a furnace
Description: A local authority may relax the application of section 6(1) relating to the emission of grit and dust from furnaces in certain circumstances.

Label: Clean air -  requirement to fit arrestment plant for burning solid fuel
Description: A local authority must consider requests for approval of an arrestment plant where a domestic furnace is used in a building to burn pulverised fuel or to burn, at a rate of 1.02 tonnes an hour or more, solid fuel in any other form or solid waste,

Label: Clean air -  notification of decision on application for arrestment plant
Description: A local authority must, when determining an application under sections 6 or 8 of the Act, give a reasoned, written decision.

Label: Clean air -  measurement of grit, dust and fumes by local authorities
Description: A local authority must, in certain circumstances, take measurements of grit, dust and fumes emanating from a furnace.

Label: Clean air -  information about furnaces and fuel consumed
Description: A local authority may request information about the furnace and the type of fuel burned for certain purposes.

Label: Clean air -  height of chimneys
Description: A local authority must consider granting approval to the height of chimneys in certain circumstances and must give written reasons where that approval is denied.

Label: Clean air -  discretionary smoke control areas
Description: A local authority may by order declare the whole or part of its area to be a smoke control area.

Label: Clean air -  smoke control orders
Description: A local authority may issue smoke control orders in a smoke control area.

Label: Clean air -  directed smoke control areas
Description: A local authority must comply with any direction from the secretary of state to make an area a smoke control area.

Label: Clean air -  exemptions relating to prohibition of smoke emission in particular areas
Description: A local authority must comply with any direction from the secretary of state that the prohibition under section 20 with regard to smoke control areas should be suspended or relaxed.

Label: Clean air -  adaptation of fireplaces in private dwellings
Description: A local authority may, in relation to a smoke control area, serve a notice requiring the adaption of a fireplace in a private dwelling and may give grants in certain circumstances.

Label: Clean air -  grants for adaptation of fireplaces
Description: A local authority may, give a grant towards adaptations to fireplaces in churches, chapels and buildings used by charities.

Label: Air pollution -  research and publicity
Description: A local authority may incur expenditure for the purposes of research of or publicity into air pollution.

Label: Air pollution -  obtaining information
Description: A local authority may take various steps to obtain information about the emission of pollutants.

Label: Air pollution -  notices requiring information
Description: A local authority may serve a notice requiring an occupier of certain premises to give them certain information regarding the emission of pollutants or other substances into the air from the premises.

Label: Air pollution -  information for the Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with directions regarding the provision of air pollution information for use by the Secretary of State.

Label: Air pollution -  exemption for purposes of investigations and research
Description: A local authority may issue a notice in writing exempting or limiting the extent of certain sections of the Act for the purposes of investigations or research

Label: Air pollution -  Crown premises
Description: A local authority must report certain emissions from Crown premises or vessels to the appropriate Minister

Label: Clean air -  notification of offences
Description: A local authority must notify occupiers of certain premises of offences relating to emissions of smoke in certain circumstances.

Label: Clean air -  general provisions as to enforcement
Description: A local authority must enforce certain provisions of the Act.

Label: Clean air -  institution of proceedings
Description: A local authority may bring proceedings under certain provisions of the Act.

Label: Clean air -  rights of entry and inspection
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority has the powers of entry and inspection for certain purposes under the Act.

Label: Clean air -  notice to require information
Description: A local authority may serve a notice to require information in relation to certain of its functions under the Act.

Label: Clean air -  authority defaulting on functions
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the Secretary of State when exercising his default powers under the Act.

Label: Clean air -  joint exercise of local authority functions
Description: Two or more local authorities may act jointly for certain purposes under the Act.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  child safety orders
Description: A local authority must co-operate with a court in the court's dealings with a child safety order.

Label: Anti-social behaviour - parental compensation order
Description: A local authority may apply for a parental compensation order or a review of the order in certain circumstances.

Label: Crime and disorder - consideration of crime and disorder implications
Description: Without prejudice to any other obligation imposed on it, it shall be the duty of each authority to which this section applies to exercise its various functions with due regard to the likely effect of the exercise of those functions on, and the need to do all that it reasonably can to prevent, crime and disorder in its area.

Label: Crime and disorder - sharing of information
Description: A local authority must share prescribed information with other local authorities.

Label: Youth justice - local provision of services
Description: A local authority must, acting in co-operation with certain other bodies secure that, to such extent as is appropriate for their area, all youth justice services are available there.

Label: Youth justice - youth offending teams
Description: A local authority must, acting in co-operation with certain other bodies establish one or more youth offending teams for their area.

Label: Youth justice - notification of detention of child or young person
Description: A youth offending team of a local authority must notify certain bodies when a young person is convicted of an offence.

Label: Youth justice - youth justice plans
Description: A local authority must, after consultation with the relevant persons and bodies, formulate and implement for each year a youth justice plan.

Label: Crime and disorder -  anti-social behaviour orders
Description: A local authority may apply for an anti-social behaviour order if certain conditions are met.

Label: Crime and disorder - review of anti-social behaviour orders
Description: A local authority must take part in a review of an anti-social behaviour order in certain circumstances.

Label: Crime and disorder -  combination agreements
Description: Two or more local authorities may enter into a combination agreement for their area with regard to reducing crime and disorder and must comply with prescribed requirements in so doing.

Label: Crime and disorder - formulation and implementation of strategies
Description: The local authorities for an area are responsible for formulating and implementing crime and disorder strategies for that area.

Label: Anti-social behaviour -  parenting orders
Description: A local authority must co-operate with a court when the court wishes to make a parenting order.

Label: Data protection - compliance
Description: A local authority must comply with the Data Protection Act 1998.

Label: Education -  promotion of high standards in primary and secondary education
Description: A local authority must exercise its functions so as to promote high standards, ensure fair access to opportunity for education and training and fulfilment of potential.

Label: Education -  pupils to be educated in accordance with their parents' wishes
Description: A local authority must in performing its powers and duties must have regard to the general principle that children should be educated in accordance with their parents' wishes in so far as that is compatible with the provision of efficient instruction and training and the avoidance of unreasonable public expenditure.

Label: Education -  general responsibility for education
Description: A local authority must in so far as their powers enable them to do so contribute towards the spiritual, moral, mental and physical development of the community by securing that efficient primary education and secondary education and, in the case of a local authority in England, further education and to achieve high standards and fulfil potential.

Label: Education -  primary and secondary schooling
Description: A local authority must secure sufficient primary and secondary schooling in their area for the needs of all children of compulsory school age.

Label: Education -  consideration of parental representations
Description: A local authority must consider and respond to parental representations.

Label: Education - education provision for persons above compulsory school age
Description: A local authority must secure that sufficient education and training provision is provided for young people of 6th form age and for young people aged between 19 and 24 who are subject to a learning difficulty assessment and must co-operate with each other and have regard to guidance when doing so.

Label: Education - encouragement of education and training for persons over compulsory school age
Description: A local authority must encourage participation in education by young people of 6th form age and for young people aged between 19 and 24 who are subject to a learning difficulty assessment and by employers and have regard to guidance when so doing..

Label: Education -  full-time education for 16 to 18 year olds
Description: A local authority may secure education and training provision for young people aged 16 to 18.

Label: Education -   education for persons aged 19 and over
Description: A local authority may secure education and training provision for persons aged 19 or over.

Label: Education -  establishment, maintenance and assistance of primary and secondary schools
Description: A local authority may establish, maintain and assist primary and secondary schools for children of compulsory school age.

Label: Education -  establishment, maintenance and assistance of nursery schools
Description: A local authority may establish, maintain and assist nursery schools.

Label: Education -  provision of education at non-maintained schools
Description: A local authority may arrange for primary or secondary educational provision at schools not maintained by a local authority.

Label: Education - children in youth detention
Description: A local authority must arrange education for children (aged under 19) in youth detention.

Label: Education -  children not receiving education at a school
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for the provision of suitable education at school or otherwise than at school for those children of compulsory school age who, by reason of illness, exclusion from school or otherwise, may not for any period receive suitable education.

Label: Special educational needs - code of practice
Description: A local authority and the governing bodies of schools maintained by it must have regard to special educational needs code of practice when dealing with SEN issues.

Label: Special educational needs - review of arrangements
Description: A local authority must keep under review its SEN provision and consult with others as it thinks necessary or desirable.

Label: Special educational needs - education in mainstream school
Description: A local authority must educate a child with SEN in a mainstream school unless it is incompatible with the wishes of his parent, or the provision of efficient education for other children.

Label: Special educational needs - education in non-mainstream school
Description: A local authority may educate a child with SEN in a non-mainstream school in certain circumstances.

Label: Special educational needs - duties of governing body or local education authority
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with certain general duties regarding SEN provision

Label: Special educational needs - informing parent of SEN provision
Description: A local authority in the case of a pupil referral unit or the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must inform a parent when SEN provision is made.

Label: Special educational needs - provision of goods and services
Description: A local authority may provide goods and services to the governing body of a maintained school in connection with SEN provision.

Label: Special educational needs -  provision otherwise than in schools
Description: A local authority must consult the parent where it proposes to make SEN provision otherwise than at school.

Label: Special educational needs - provision outside England and Wales
Description: A local authority may make SEN provision outside England and Wales in certain circumstances.

Label: Special educational needs - identification and assessment of needs
Description: A local authority has a general duty to identify and assess SEN provision for the children for whom they are responsible.

Label: Special educational needs - parental notification of assessment
Description: Where an authority believes a child for whom they are responsible may have special educational needs they must notify the parents that they are considering an assessment and of the procedure for doing so.

Label: Special educational needs - statement
Description: If in the light of an assessment of any child's educational needs and of any representations made by the child's parent it is necessary for the local education authority to, determine the special educational provision which any learning difficulty he may have calls for, the authority shall make and maintain a statement of his special educational needs.

Label: Special educational needs - notice of no statement
Description: A local authority must where it decides not to make a statement of SEN give the parent a notice in writing explaining the right to appeal.

Label: Special educational needs - appeals
Description: A local authority must comply with the SEN appeals procedure and its outcome.

Label: Special educational needs - access to schools
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may access certain schools in connection with their SEN provision.

Label: Special educational needs - reviews of educational needs
Description: A local authority must comply with the prescribed process for reviewing SEN provision and the appeals procedure.

Label: Special educational needs - parental request for assessment
Description: A local authority must assess a child's SEN at its parent's request in certain circumstances and comply with the appeals procedure and the outcome of any appeal.

Label: Special educational needs - review and assessment on request of responsible body
Description: A local authority must review or assess a child's SEN at the request of the responsible body in certain circumstances and comply with the appeals procedure and the outcome of any appeal.

Label: Special educational needs - assessment of children under two
Description: A local authority may assess a child under two for SEN provision in certain circumstances.

Label: Special educational needs - giving notice to or serving documents upon child
Description: A local authority must give notice to or serve documents relating to a SEN appeal upon the child in certain circumstances.

Label: Special educational needs - case friends
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding case friends.  A case friend is the name given to a person who may make representations on behalf of a child with a view to avoiding or resolving disagreements about the exercise by local education authorities in Wales of SEN functions and may exercise the rights of a child on the child's behalf.

Label: Special educational needs - advice and information for parents in England
Description: A local authority must provide advice and information for parents with regard to SEN and must have regard to guidance from the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Special educational needs - advice and information for parents in Wales
Description: A local authority must provide advice and information for parents with regard to SEN and must have regard to guidance from the Welsh Minister when so doing.

Label: Special educational needs - dispute resolution procedure in England
Description: A local authority must prepare and publish a dispute resolution procedure relating to SEN matters and must have regard to guidance from the Secretary of State when so doing.

Label: Special educational needs - dispute resolution procedure in Wales
Description: A local authority must prepare and publish a dispute resolution procedure relating to SEN matters and must have regard to guidance from Welsh ministers when so doing.

Label: Special educational needs - independent advocacy services
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for the provision of independent advocacy services (relating to SEN) in their area, publicise the same and must have regard to guidance from Welsh Ministers when so doing.

Label: Special educational needs - compliance with tribunal order
Description: A local authority must comply with an order of the tribunal within the prescribed timescale.

Label: Religious education -  advisory councils
Description: A local authority must establish a standing advisory council to advise on religious education.

Label: Religious education -  Sunday schools
Description: A local authority or a school maintained by it may not make access to education, further education or training conditional upon a child attending or not attending Sunday School.

Label: Education -  entering pupils for public examinations
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must, in certain circumstances, enter pupils for public examinations.

Label: Education -  manner of provision of sex education
Description: The governing body and head teacher shall take such steps as are reasonably practicable to secure that where sex education is given to any registered pupils at a maintained school, it is given in such a manner as to encourage those pupils to have due regard to moral considerations and the value of family life. and must have due regard to guidance when so doing.

Label: Education -  sex education statements of policy
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must make, keep up to date and provide free of charge a statement of policy on sex education.

Label: Education -  exemption from sex education
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with a parental request that his or her child be excused from sex education.

Label: Education -  political indoctrination
Description: A local education authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must forbid political indoctrination and adopt a balanced approach to political issues.

Label: Education -  provision of information
Description: A local education authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulations regarding the provision of information.

Label: Education -  complaints management
Description: A local education authority must consult governing bodies and make arrangements for the consideration and disposal of complaints.    and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with Regulations regarding the provision of information.

Label: Education -  late school admissions
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must not refuse to admit a child to a school where the late application was due to circumstances beyond the child's control.

Label: Education -  registration of pupils
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must keep a school register in accordance with regulations.

Label: Education -  early transfer to secondary education
Description: A local authority must make arrangements to enable children to be withdrawn from primary education for the purpose of receiving secondary education in certain circumstances.

Label: Education -  identifying children not receiving education
Description: A local authority must make arrangements to identify children of compulsory school age who are not registered pupils at a school and who are not receiving suitable education otherwise than at school and have regard to guidance when so doing.

Label: Education -  school attendance orders
Description: A local authority must issue and serve a school attendance order in certain circumstances in accordance with the prescribed procedure including amendments to SEN statements where necessary.

Label: Education -  revocation of school attendance orders
Description: A local authority must revoke a school attendance order at the request of the parent in certain circumstances.

Label: Education -  failure to comply with school attendance order
Description: A local authority may issue proceedings for breach of a school attendance order.

Label: Education -  failure to secure regular attendance at school
Description: A local authority may issue proceedings for failing to secure regular attendance at school.

Label: Education -  penalty notice for failure to secure regular attendance at school
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may issue a penalty notice where it appears that a parent has committed an offence under section 444.

Label: Education -  education supervision orders
Description: Before instituting proceedings under sections 443 or 444 of the Act, a local authority must consider whether to apply to the court for an education supervision order.

Label: Education -  prohibition of charges for admission to a maintained school
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school must not charge for admission to the school in relation to the provision of education to pupils of compulsory school age or for full time education for those aged over 16, but under 19.

Label: Education -  prohibition of charges for provision of education at a maintained school
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school must not charge for education for registered pupils unless it is allowed for by the sections 451 or 452 or by Regulations.

Label: Education -  recovery of wasted examination fees
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school may only recover wasted examination fees in certain circumstances.

Label: Education -  prohibition on charging for examination fees
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school may not charge for entering registered pupil into a prescribed public examination.

Label: Education -  prohibition of incidental charges
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school may not charge for incidental charges save where allowed for by section 454 or by regulations.

Label: Education -  permitted charges for pupils at maintained schools
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school may charge for matters allowed for by section 455.

Label: Education -  charges and remissions policy
Description: A local authority or governing body of a maintained school must prepare, keep under review and publish a charges and remissions policy and may only charge in accordance with that policy, section 457 and regulations.

Label: Education -  board and lodging at boarding schools
Description: A local authority of a maintained school may charge for board and lodging provided at a boarding school in accordance with regulations.

Label: Education -  information on school hours
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a maintained school must comply with regulations regarding the making of information regarding school hours and other prescribed information available.

Label: Education -  voluntary contributions for the benefit of the school
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a maintained school may request or receive voluntary contributions  for the benefit of the school or any school activities that accord with section 460.

Label: Special educational needs - academies
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations requiring or authorising the local authority to make payments to an academy in respect of children with special educational needs.

Label: Education -  education standards grants
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations governing education standards grants.

Label: Education -  recoupment for cross border provision
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations governing payments for cross border provision of education.

Label: Education -  recoupment for excluded pupils
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations governing recoupment for excluded pupils.

Label: Education -  determination of disputes
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by them may refer a dispute with the other party to the Secretary of State.

Label: Education -  unreasonable exercise of functions
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by them must comply with directions from the Secretary of State in relation to an unreasonable exercise of their functions.

Label: Education -  general default powers
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by them must comply with directions from the Secretary of State in relation to a declaration that they are in default of their duties.

Label: Schools - improperly constituted governing body
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by them must comply with directions from the Secretary of State in relation to a situation where a governing body is improperly constituted.

Label: Education -  direction of appointment of members of education committees
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the Secretary of State in relation to the constitution of education committees.

Label: Education - facilities for recreation and training for children under 13
Description: A local authority must secure that the facilities for primary and secondary education provided for their area include adequate facilities for recreation and social and physical training for children who have not attained the age of thirteen.

Label: Education -  leisure time activities for certain under 25's
Description: A local authority must, so far as reasonably practicable, secure for qualifying young persons in the authority's area access to sufficient educational leisure-time activities which are for the improvement of their well-being, and sufficient facilities for such activities; and  sufficient recreation and leisure-time activities for the same purpose.

Label: Education -  facilities for recreation and social and physical training for school age children
Description: A local authority must secure that the facilities for primary and secondary education provided for their area include adequate facilities for recreation and social and physical training.

Label: Education -  facilities for recreation and social and physical training in further education
Description: A local authority may provide facilities for recreation and social and physical training as part of the facilities for further education provided (whether or not by them) for their area.

Label: School transport - sustainable modes of travel strategy
Description: A local authority must prepare for each academic year a document containing their strategy to promote the use of sustainable modes of travel to meet the school travel needs of their area (a sustainable modes of travel strategy), publish the strategy in such manner and by such time as may be prescribed, and promote the use of sustainable modes of travel to meet the school travel needs of their area.

Label: School transport -  home to school travel arrangements for eligible children
Description: A local authority must in the case of an eligible child in the authority's area make such travel arrangements as they consider necessary in order to secure that suitable home to school travel arrangements, for the purpose of facilitating the child's attendance at the relevant educational establishment in relation to him, are made and provided free of charge in relation to the child.

Label: School transport -  home to school travel arrangements for non-eligible children
Description: A local authority may make such school travel arrangements as they consider necessary, in relation to any child in the authority's area to whom this section applies, for the purpose of facilitating the child's attendance at any relevant educational establishment in relation to the child.

Label: School transport -  guidance on home to school travel arrangements
Description: A local authority must consider any guidance issued by the Secretary of State when exercising their duty/power under sections 508B and 508C.

Label: School transport- school travel schemes
Description: A local authority must give effect to a school travel scheme when one is in force.

Label: School transport -  transport for adult learners
Description: A local authority must make such arrangements for the provision of transport and otherwise as they consider necessary, or as the Secretary of State may direct to facilitate the attendance of adults receiving education at institutions maintained or assisted by the authority and providing further or higher education (or both), or  within the further education sector and to facilitate the attendance of relevant young adults receiving education or training at institutions outside both the further and higher education sectors, but only in cases where the have secured for the adults in question the provision of education or training at the institution in question, and  the provision of boarding accommodation under section514A. Any transport provided must be provided free of charge.

Label: School transport -  policy statements for young adults subject to learning difficulty assessment
Description: A local authority must when making arrangements, or proposing to pay travelling expenses, under section 508F in relation to relevant young adults, consult various parties and prepare a transport policy statement for young adults subject to learning difficulty assessment which must comply with various requirements.

Label: School transport -  guidance on policy statements for adults and young adults
Description: A local authority must when exercising its duties/powers under sections 508F and G have regard to guidance from the Secretary of State.

Label: School transport -  direction on complaints about young adult transport
Description: A local authority must change its statement prepared under 508G in certain circumstances when directed to do so by the Secretary of State as result of a young adult complaint.

Label: School transport -  discretionary changes resulting from a complaint on young adult transport
Description: A local authority may change its statement prepared under 508G in certain circumstances as result of a young adult complaint.

Label: School transport -  early years transport
Description: A local authority may provide a child with assistance if they are satisfied that, without such assistance, the child would be prevented from attending at any premises, which are not a school or part of a school, but at which relevant early years education is provided.

Label: School transport -  policy on arrangements for persons of sixth form age
Description: A local authority must prepare (and publish) for each academic year a transport policy statement specifying  the arrangements for the provision of transport or otherwise that the authority consider it necessary to make for facilitating the attendance of persons of sixth form age receiving education or training at various institutions. The statement must meet various requirements.

Label: School transport -  regard to religion or belief in exercise of travel functions
Description: A local authority must have regard to a parent's or a pupil's (where aged 16 or over) religion or belief when exercising its travel functions.

Label: School transport -  direction on complaint regarding sixth form transport
Description: A local authority must revise a statement prepared under section 509AA to change certain arrangements if, as a result of a sixth form transport complaint, the Secretary of State has directed them to do so.

Label: School transport -  discretionary changes resulting from a complaint about sixth form transport
Description: A local authority may revise a statement prepared under section 509AA to change certain arrangements as a result of a sixth form transport complaint.

Label: Schools - provision of clothing
Description: A local authority may provide clothing to any pupil in prescribed circumstances.

Label: Schools - provision of meals, milk and refreshments
Description: A local authority may provide meals, milk and refreshment to any pupil attending a maintained school in accordance with prescribed conditions.

Label: Schools - charging for provision of meals
Description: A local authority may charge for school meals provided.

Label: Schools - free school meals
Description: Where a local authority provides school lunches or milk they must be provided free of charge to those entitled to free school meals.

Label: Schools - transfer of provision of meals to governing body
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with an order transferring the functions of providing school meals from the local authority to the governing body

Label: Schools - provision of meals in non-maintained schools
Description: A local authority may provide meals at a school which it does not maintain, subject to certain conditions.

Label: Education - provision of board and lodging
Description: A local authority may provide board and lodging for certain children and young people subject to certain conditions.

Label: Education -  teaching services for day nurseries
Description: Subject to the concurrence of the governing body of the school, a local education authority may, in accordance with arrangements made by them for that purpose, make available to a day nursery the services of any teacher who is employed by them in a nursery school or in a primary school having one or more nursery classes, and has agreed to provide his services for the purposes of the arrangements.

Label: Education -  payment of fees for SEN pupils at non-maintained schools
Description: A local authority must pay fees for SEN pupils attending institutions not maintained by a local authority in certain circumstances.

Label: Education -  payment of school expenses and grants
Description: A local education authority, for the purpose of enabling persons to take advantage of any educational facilities available to them, may in such circumstances as may be specified in or determined in accordance with regulations pay such expenses of children attending community, foundation, voluntary or special schools as may be necessary to enable them to take part in any school activities and grant scholarships, exhibitions, bursaries and other allowances in respect of persons over compulsory school age.

Label: Schools - governors travel and subsistence allowances
Description: A local authority may pay in accordance with a scheme travelling and subsistence allowance to governors in certain circumstances.

Label: Schools - medical and dental inspections
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for encouraging and assisting pupils to take advantage of the provision for medical and dental inspection and treatment, unless a parent directs otherwise.

Label: Schools - examination of pupils for cleanliness
Description: A local authority may direct a medical officer that a pupil or his/her clothing must be examined for cleanliness.

Label: Schools - compulsory cleansing of pupil
Description: A local authority may issue a notice requiring a parent to cleanse a pupil and carry out that task itself if the parent is in default.

Label: Schools - arrangements for cleansing of pupils
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for any cleansing of a pupil or his or her clothing that may be required.

Label: Schools - suspension of pupil pending examination or cleansing
Description: A medical officer appointed by a local authority may direct that a pupil should be suspended from school until cleansing is carried out.

Label: Education -  educational research
Description: A local education authority may make such provision for conducting, or assisting the conduct of, research as appears to them to be desirable for the purpose of improving the educational facilities provided for their area.

Label: Education -  educational conferences
Description: A local education authority may organise, or participate in the organisation of, conferences for the discussion of questions relating to education, and expend such sums as may be reasonable in paying, or contributing towards, any expenditure incurred in connection with conferences for the discussion of such questions, including the expenses of any person authorised by them to attend such a conference.

Label: Education -  property on trust
Description: A local authority may hold and administer property upon trust for educational purposes.

Label: Education -  compulsory purchase of land
Description: A local authority may compulsorily purchase land for educational purposes where authorised to do so by the Secretary of State.

Label: Education -  Chief Education Officer
Description: A local authority must appoint a chief education officer.

Label: Education -  direct payments for person with SEN or learning disability assessment
Description: A local authority may make direct payments in prescribed circumstances to assist persons with SEN or a learning disability assessment.

Label: Education - pilot schemes for direct payments
Description: A local authority must comply with an order from the Secretary of State regarding pilot schemes for assisting persons with SEN or a learning disability assessment with direct payments.

Label: Schools - co-operation of governing body for provision of school meals
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by local authority must co-operate with a local authority in relation to the local authority's duty to provide school meals.

Label: Education -  provision of teaching services for day nurseries
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may provide teaching services to day nurseries in certain circumstances with the approval of the local authority.

Label: Education -  provision of information to the Secretary of State by governing body
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with a request from the Secretary of State for certain information.

Label: Education - participation in international surveys
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with a request from the Secretary of State that it participates in a survey.

Label: Education -  distribution of information about schools providing secondary education
Description: A governing body of a primary school maintained by a local authority must treat all requests from secondary schools regarding the distribution of information, equally.

Label: Education -  distribution of information about further education institutions
Description: A governing body of a secondary school maintained by a local authority must comply with directions from the Secretary of State requiring the distribution of information regarding further education.

Label: Schools - prescribed standards for school premises
Description: A local authority must comply with prescribed standards for school premises.

Label: Schools - approval etc. of school premises and boarding hostels
Description: A local authority must obtain the Secretary of State's approval for certain new or altered schools or boarding hostels.

Label: Schools - control of potentially harmful materials or apparatus
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to the use of potentially harmful materials or apparatus on school premises.

Label: Schools - nuisance or disturbance on school premises
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may, in certain circumstances, remove someone causing a nuisance or annoyance from a school premise and may in certain circumstances bring proceedings against such a person.

Label: Schools - no right to give corporal punishment
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may not administer corporal punishment.

Label: Schools - search of pupils for prohibited items
Description: An authorised member of staff of a maintained school may search a pupil where he has reasonable grounds for suspecting that pupil to have a prohibited item.

Label: Schools - seizure of prohibited items
Description: An authorised member of staff may seize a prohibited item following an authorised search.

Label: Schools - search of pupils for weapons
Description: An authorised member of staff of a maintained school may search a pupil where he has reasonable grounds for suspecting that pupil to have a weapon.

Label: Schools - duration of school day and school year
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulations regarding the duration of the school day and school year.

Label: Education -  employment of children
Description: A local authority may serve notice upon an employer requiring an employer to provide it with certain information and may serve a notice prohibiting or restricting the employer from employing children. A local authority may commence proceedings against a person who contravenes or fails to comply with such notices.

Label: Education -  provision of work experience for people over compulsory school age
Description: A local authority may secure the provision of work experience for people aged between 16 and 18. It may also secure work experience for people aged between 19 and 24 who are subject to a learning disability assessment.

Label: Education -  encouragement of employers and pupils to participate in work experience
Description: A local authority must encourage participation in work experience by employers and by those eligible under section 560A.

Label: Education - persons detained in youth accommodation
Description: A local authority has certain duties arising from and restricted to the purpose of regulations in respect of persons detained in youth accommodation.

Label: Education -  educational records
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulations regarding educational records.

Label: Education -  school performance targets
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulations regarding performance targets.

Label: Education -  inspections of local education authorities
Description: A local authority must provide the Chief Inspector with such information and such rights of entry as he requires in connection with an inspection.

Label: Education - provision of careers guidance in schools
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must ensure that pupils are provided with independent career guidance.

Label: Education -  co-operation with careers advisors
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must co-operate with providers of independent career guidance.

Label: Education -  provision of careers information at schools and other institutions
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must provide pupils with careers information.

Label: Education -  provision of curriculum information
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must provide a careers information provider with such curriculum information as it requests.

Label: Education -  continuous service for employment on change of employer
Description: There is a duty to recognise continuity of service for employment purposes as follows. If an employee of the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority is taken into the employment of the authority or an employee of a local authority is taken into the employment of the governing body of a school maintained by the authority his period of employment at the time of the change of employer counts as a period of employment with the second employer, and the change does not break the continuity of the period of employment.

Label: Housing -  energy conservation reports
Description: A local authority must produce, copy, distribute and modify a home energy conservation report  or reports and comply with guidance and directions of the secretary of state in so doing.

Label: Housing -  assistance for social landlords
Description: The local authority may promote the formation of bodies to act as social landlords or the extension of the objects or activities of registered social landlords.

Label: Housing -  introductory tenancies
Description: The local authority may elect to operate the introductory tenancy regime.

Label: Housing -  publicity of introductory tenancies
Description: The local authority must from time to time publish information about introductory tenancies.

Label: Housing -  consultation on matters of housing management for introductory tenancies
Description: The local authority must comply with its duties to inform and consult with regard to introductory tenancies.

Label: Housing - demoted tenancies
Description: The local authority must comply with statutory requirements in relation to demoted tenancies.

Label: Housing -  anti-social behaviour injunction
Description: The local authority may apply for a housing related anti-social behaviour injunction in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing -  unlawful use of premises injunction
Description: The local authority may apply for an unlawful use of premises injunction in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing -  breach of tenancy agreement injunction
Description: The local authority may apply for a breach of tenancy agreement injunction in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing -  allocation of housing
Description: A local authority must comply with certain provisions when allocating housing.

Label: Housing allocation - only to eligible and qualifying persons
Description: A local authority must only allocate housing to eligible and qualifying persons.

Label: Housing allocation -  information, advice and assistance
Description: A local authority must provide information, advice and assistance as prescribed in relation to the allocation of housing and to applications for housing.

Label: Housing allocation - allocation scheme
Description: Every local housing authority must have a scheme (their allocation scheme) for determining priorities, and as to the procedure to be followed, in allocating housing accommodation.

Label: Housing allocation -  publication of allocation scheme
Description: A local authority must publicise its allocation scheme, make it available for inspection and publicise alterations.

Label: Housing allocation -  regard to guidance
Description: A local authority must have regard to guidance when exercising its functions.

Label: Housing allocation -  co-operation from registered social landlords
Description: A local authority may request a registered social landlord to co-operate with them in relation to the allocation of housing.

Label: Homelessness advisory service
Description: A local authority must provide an advisory service in relation to homelessness.

Label: Homelessness - assistance for voluntary organisations
Description: A local housing authority may give assistance by way of grant or loan to voluntary organisations concerned with homelessness or matters relating to homelessness.    A local housing authority may also assist any such organisation by permitting them to use premises belonging to the authority, by making available furniture or other goods, whether by way of gift, loan or otherwise, and by making available the services of staff employed by the authority.

Label: Homelessness - regards to guidance
Description: A local authority must have regard to guidance when considering their functions in relation to homelessness.

Label: Homelessness - inquiry into homelessness or threatened homelessness
Description: A local authority must carry out an inquiry into homelessness or threatened homelessness in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing -  eligibility of migrants
Description: A local authority may request the Secretary of State for information regarding the eligibility of migrants for housing.

Label: Homelessness - interim duty to accommodate
Description: A local authority must accommodate a person who is homeless, eligible for assistance or with a priority need in certain circumstances.

Label: Homelessness - intentional homelessness
Description: A local authority has certain duties, as defined in this legislation, towards someone intentionally homeless.

Label: Homelessness - persons not in priority need who are not homeless intentionally
Description: A local authority has certain duties, as detailed in legislation, towards someone who is not in priority need but who is not intentionally homeless.

Label: Homelessness - threatened homelessness
Description: A local authority has certain duties, as detailed in legislation, towards someone who is in a position of threatened homelessness.

Label: Homelessness - referral to another housing authority
Description: A local authority may refer the case of someone who is homeless to another housing authority under conditions detailed in the legislation.

Label: Homelessness -  applicant whose case is considered for referral or referred
Description: A local authority has certain duties to the applicant where it exercises it power to refer the case of someone who is homeless to another housing authority.

Label: Homelessness - review of decisions on request
Description: A local authority must review certain decisions under the Act when requested to do so by the applicant and must comply with procedure when carrying out the review.

Label: Homelessness - discharge of functions by local housing authorities
Description: A local housing authority may discharge their housing functions in relation to a homeless person only by securing that suitable accommodation provided by them is available, by securing that he obtains suitable accommodation from some other person, or by giving him such advice and assistance as will secure that suitable accommodation is available from some other person.

Label: Homelessness - out of area placement
Description: A local authority must where proposing to house a person in another housing authority's district, give that authority written notice containing prescribed information.

Label: Homelessness - interim arrangements made with private landlord
Description: A local authority may discharge its duties regarding certain interim arrangements with a private landlord.

Label: Homelessness - suitability of accommodation
Description: A local authority must have regard to certain legislative provisions and regulations in determining the question of whether accommodation is suitable.

Label: Homelessness - protection of personal property
Description: A local authority must in certain circumstances take steps to prevent loss or damage to the personal property of a homeless person or someone threatened with homelessness.

Label: Homelessness - co-operation between relevant housing authorities and bodies
Description: A local authority must co-operate with other housing authorities and other bodies in circumstances detailed in the legislation.

Label: Housing -  anti-social behaviour policy
Description: A local authority must produce, publish and review anti-social behaviour policies and procedures.

Label: Housing -  directions as to certain charges by social landlords
Description: A local authority must comply with directions with regard to the making of certain charges.

Label: Disabled facilities grant -  tenant's certificate
Description: A local authority must only consider an application for a disabled facilities grant if by a tenant applicant if it is accompanied by a tenant's certificate.

Label: Disabled facilities grant -  occupier's certificate
Description: A local authority must only consider an application for a disabled facilities grant if by an occupier applicant if it is accompanied by an occupier's certificate.

Label: Disabled facilities grant -  approved purposes
Description: A local authority must only consider an application for a disabled facilities grant for approved purposes.

Label: Housing grants - restrictions where work already begun
Description: A local authority may approve a grant where work has already begun in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing grants - application in prescribed form
Description: A local authority must only consider an application for grant if it is in the prescribed form and is otherwise eligible.

Label: Disabled facilities grant -  owner's and tenant's applications
Description: A local authority must only consider an application for a disabled facilities grant if certain conditions, as detailed in the legislation, are met.

Label: Disabled facilities grant -  owner's certificate
Description: A local authority must only consider an application for a disabled facilities grant if by an owner applicant if it is accompanied by an owner's certificate.

Label: Housing grants - means testing in case of application by owner-occupier or tenant
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the means testing of grants.

Label: Housing grants - determination of amount of grant
Description: A local authority must determine a grant in the prescribed manner.

Label: Housing grants - maximum amount of grants
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the maximum amount of grant.

Label: Housing grants - decision and notification
Description: A local housing authority shall by notice in writing notify an applicant for a grant as soon as reasonably practicable, and, in any event, not later than six months after the date of the application concerned, whether the application is approved or refused.  The procedures for determination and notification should be as prescribed.

Label: Housing grants - payment of grant
Description: A local authority must pay an approved grant in accordance with sections 35 to 39 of the Act.

Label: Housing grants - repayment of grant
Description: A local authority may demand that an applicant must repay a grant or part of a grant plus interest in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing grant - change of circumstances of disabled occupant
Description: A local authority must determine what do with regard to a grant where there is a change of circumstances of the disabled occupant as prescribed by section 41.

Label: Housing grants - recalculation, withholding or repayment
Description: A local authority must recalculate, withhold or demand repayment of the grant in certain circumstances as detailed in the legislation.

Label: Housing - carrying out works which would attract grant
Description: A local authority may carry out works that attract a grant in certain circumstances

Label: Housing grants - contributions by the Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must apply to the Secretary of State for more funds if it believes the Secretary of State's determination to be inadequate.

Label: Housing grants - recovery of Secretary of State's contributions
Description: A local authority must repay funds to the Secretary of State in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing - financial assistance for regeneration or development
Description: A local authority must comply with any terms imposed on any financial assistance received from the Secretary of State for regeneration or development under section 127 of the Act.

Label: Human rights - acts of public authorities
Description: A local authority must comply with the Human Rights Act 1998.

Label: Immigration and asylum - support
Description: A local authority may provide support to asylum seekers in prescribed circumstances.

Label: Immigration and asylum - accommodation
Description: A local authority must assist the Secretary of State with regard to the provision of accommodation for asylum seekers.

Label: Immigration and asylum -  reception zones
Description: A local authority must comply with the Secretary of State's directions regarding accommodation for asylum seekers, if its area is designated as a reception zone.

Label: Immigration and asylum - housing
Description: A local authority must not supply housing to anyone subject to immigration control other than in accordance with the Act.

Label: Immigration and asylum - child welfare
Description: A local authority must not provide child welfare services to anyone to whom the Secretary of State is providing support pursuant to section 122.

Label: Education -  action plans in response to inspection
Description: A local authority and the governing bodies of the schools which it maintains must complete, publish and distribute an action plan in certain circumstances.

Label: Education -  approved qualifications for persons under 19
Description: A local authority and the governing bodies of the schools which it maintains must ensure only approved qualifications are utilised in schools.

Label: Youth support -  directed services for 11 to 25 year olds
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the National Assembly and take other steps with regard to the provision of certain services to 11 to 25 year olds in Wales.

Label: Youth support -  discretionary services for 11 to 25 year olds
Description: A local authority may exercise certain powers in connection with its duty to comply with Directions from the National Assembly and take other steps with regard to the provision of certain services to 11 to 25 year olds in Wales.

Label: Youth support -  conduct and effect of inspections
Description: A local authority must take certain steps with regard to inspections relating to the provision of certain services to 11 to 25 year olds in Wales.

Label: Youth support -   provision of information by public bodies
Description: A local authority may supply information about a young person to certain other bodies in connection with the provision of certain services to young people.

Label: Education - assessments relating to learning difficulties
Description: A local authority must carry out assessments for persons aged over 16, but under 25, who have learning difficulties and comply with guidance when so doing.

Label: Education - local curricula for students age 16 to 18
Description: A local authority and the governing bodies of the schools which it maintains must ensure delivery of local curricula entitlements.

Label: Education -  financial resources for school sixth forms
Description: A local authority and the governing bodies of the schools which it maintains must comply with any conditions laid down by Welsh Ministers relating to the allocation of financial resources.

Label: Best value authorities - general duties
Description: A local authority must make arrangements to secure continuous improvement in the way in which its functions are exercised, having regard to a combination of economy, efficiency and effectiveness and must take prescribed steps when doing so.

Label: Best value authorities - inspections
Description: A local authority must comply with the requirements of a best value inspection.

Label: Best value authorities - fees for inspections
Description: A local authority must pay the appropriate best value inspection fee.

Label: Best value authorities - failure to comply with best value duty
Description: A local authority must comply with any review, inquiry or directions required by or coming from the Secretary of State in circumstances where the Secretary of State believes that the authority is not complying with its best value duties.

Label: Best value authorities - conditions for new powers
Description: A local authority must comply with any conditions prescribed by the Secretary of State relating to any new best value authority powers arising from section 6.

Label: Best value authorities - non-commercial considerations in contracts
Description: A local authority must comply with any order relating to the exclusion of non-commercial considerations in contracts.

Label: Best value authorities - accounts
Description: A best value authority must comply with any regulations regarding the keeping of accounts.

Label: Best value authorities - regard to guidance
Description: A local authority must have regard to any guidance to or in respect of best value authorities issued by the Secretary of State.

Label: Procurement -  implied power to enter into contracts
