Description: Any statutory provision imposing a function upon a local authority confers a power for that authority to enter into a contract for the purpose of carrying out that function.

Label: Contracts - certified contracts requirements
Description: A local authority must meet certain requirements for a contract to be a certified contract.

Label: Overseas assistance - advice and assistance
Description: A local authority may provide non- financial advice and assistance as respects any matter in which they have skill and experience to a body engaged outside the United Kingdom in the carrying on of any of the activities of local government and must comply with any relevant Regulations and have regard to guidance when so doing.

Label: Councils in Wales - service agency agreements
Description: A local authority in Wales may enter into a service agency agreement with another.

Label: Councils in Wales - council funds
Description: A local authority in Wales must establish and maintain a council fund.

Label: Local government -  area committees
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with regulations relating to the discharge of their functions by area committees.

Label: Democracy -  elections of councillors
Description: A local authority must select one of the three statutory options for council elections.

Label: Democracy -  schemes and orders for elections
Description: A local authority must comply with any prescribed scheme for elections or other order.

Label: Members - provision about allowances
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding member's allowances.

Label: Local government - indemnification of members and officers of relevant authorities
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding member and officer indemnities.

Label: Wellbeing strategy in Wales
Description: A Welsh authority may do anything (subject to limits) to promote or improve the economic, social or environmental well being of their area.

Label: Wellbeing strategy in England
Description: A local authority must prepare and may modify a strategy for promoting economic, social and environmental well being in its area, in accordance with the prescribed procedure.

Label: Local government England -  permitted forms of government
Description: A local authority must adopt one of the permitted forms of government.

Label: Local government in England - executive arrangements
Description: A local authority when adopting executive arrangements must ensure that they are as prescribed.

Label: Local government - discharge of functions by others
Description: A local authority when adopting executive arrangements may allow others to discharge its functions in accordance with regulations.

Label: Local government - joint discharge of functions
Description: A local authority when adopting executive arrangements may jointly discharge its functions in accordance with regulations.

Label: Local government - overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority when adopting executive arrangements must include provision for an overview and scrutiny committee.

Label: Local government -  overview and scrutiny sub-committees
Description: The overview and scrutiny committee of a local authority may appoint sub-committees.

Label: Local government -  scrutiny officers
Description: A local authority when adopting executive arrangements must designate an officer to promote, support and guide the overview and scrutiny committee and other members of the authority.

Label: Local government - referral arrangements for overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority when adopting executive arrangements must adopt certain referral arrangements regarding its overview and scrutiny committee.

Label: Local government -  responding to overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority or its executive must respond to its overview and scrutiny committee in certain circumstances.

Label: Local government -  response by partner authority to overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority must respond to the overview and scrutiny committee of a partner authority in certain circumstances.

Label: Local government -  exclusion of exempt and confidential information from published reports
Description: A local authority must, when its overview and scrutiny committee publish certain reports, exclude confidential information and may exclude exempt information.

Label: Local government -  flood risk management by overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority which is a lead flood authority must refer such matters to its overview and scrutiny committee in certain circumstances.

Label: Local government - provision of information to another authority with executive arrangements
Description: A local authority must provide certain information to another authority with executive arrangements in certain circumstances.

Label: Local government in England - access to information and record keeping
Description: A local authority must comply with certain steps regarding access to information and record keeping.

Label: Local government in England - elected mayors
Description: A local authority wishing to have an elected mayor must comply with regulations regarding elected mayors.

Label: Local government in England - leader and cabinet executive
Description: A local authority operating executive arrangements that provide for a leader and cabinet executive must include certain provisions regarding the executive leader and may include other provisions.

Label: Local government - committee system
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the operation of the committee system.

Label: Local government - review of flood risk function in committee system
Description: A local authority with a committee system which is a lead local flood authority must review and scrutinise flood risk functions and may take certain steps.

Label: Local government - change of governance arrangements
Description: A local authority may change from one form of governance to another or make other variations.

Label: Local government - resolution for change of governance arrangements
Description: A local authority wishing to change its governance arrangements must comply with the prescribed procedure for passing resolution.

Label: Local government -  implementation of change of governance arrangements
Description: A local authority wishing to change its governance arrangements must implement the same in the prescribed manner.

Label: Local government - referendum regarding change of governance arrangements
Description: A local authority wishing to change its governance arrangements must in certain circumstances hold a referendum.

Label: Local government - general provisions for change of governance arrangements
Description: A local authority wishing to change its governance arrangements must comply with certain general provisions.

Label: Local government in England -  preparation and maintenance of constitution
Description: A local authority must prepare and keep up to date a constitution.

Label: Local government -  guidance for change of governance arrangements
Description: A local authority must in formulating or changing its governance arrangements comply with guidance from the Secretary of State.

Label: Local government -  local authority executives
Description: A local authority in Wales must adopt one of the permitted forms of government.

Label: Local government in Wales -  executive arrangements
Description: A local authority in Wales adopting executive arrangements must ensure that they are as prescribed.

Label: Local government -  mayor and cabinet executive
Description: A local authority in Wales adopting executive arrangements consisting of a mayor and cabinet executive must accord with section 14.

Label: Local government in Wales -  leader and cabinet executive
Description: A local authority in Wales adopting executive arrangements consisting of a leader and cabinet executive must accord with section 15.

Label: Local government -  mayor and council manager executive
Description: A local authority in Wales adopting executive arrangements consisting of a mayor and council manager must accord with section 16.

Label: Local government - area committees.
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with regulations relating to the discharge of their functions by area committees.

Label: Local government -  discharge of function of and by another local authority
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with regulations relating to the discharge of their functions by another local authority.

Label: Local government -  joint exercise of functions
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with Regulations relating to the joint exercise of their functions.

Label: Local government -  overview and scrutiny committees
Description: A local authority in Wales must ensure that executive arrangements provide for one or more overview and scrutiny committees.

Label: Local government reference of matter to overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority in Wales must refer certain matters to its overview and scrutiny committees.

Label: Local government -  response to overview and scrutiny committee
Description: A local authority in Wales or its executive must respond to certain matters reviewed by its overview and scrutiny committees.

Label: Local government -  exclusion of confidential and exempt information from reports
Description: A local authority in Wales must, when its overview and scrutiny committee publish certain reports, exclude confidential information and may exclude exempt information.

Label: Local government in Wales -  access to information and record keeping
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with certain steps regarding access to information and record keeping.

Label: Local government -  proposals for executive arrangements
Description: A local authority in Wales must draw up and publicise its proposals for executive arrangements in the prescribed manner.

Label: Local government -  implementation of proposals for executive arrangements
Description: A local authority in Wales must implement proposals where no referendum is required in accordance with the published timetable.

Label: Local government -  referendum on proposals for executive arrangements
Description: A local authority in Wales whose proposals include an elected mayor must hold a referendum and take other steps in accordance with section 27.

Label: Local government -  outline fall back proposals for executive arrangements
Description: A local authority in Wales may apply to Welsh ministers for the approval of outline fall back proposals.

Label: Local government -  resolution and publicity for executive arrangements
Description: A local authority in Wales must pass an appropriate resolution and comply with publicity requirements before executive arrangements can operate.

Label: Local government -  referendum following petition, direction or order
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with regulations requiring a referendum.

Label: Local government in Wales -  preparation and maintenance of constitution
Description: A local authority in Wales must prepare, keep up to date and make available a document regarding their constitution.

Label: Local government -  regard to guidance
Description: A local authority in Wales must have regard to guidance issued by the Welsh Ministers.

Label: Local government in Wales -  elected mayors
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with certain prescribed steps with regard to elected mayors and comply with regulations if made.

Label: Local government -  timing of elections
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with regulations regarding the timing of elections.

Label: Local government -  principles governing conduct of members
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with principals governing the conduct of members.

Label: Local government -  code of conduct for members
Description: A local authority must adopt a code of conduct for members and comply with the same.

Label: Local government -  standards committee
Description: A local authority must establish a standards committee.

Label: Local government -  monitoring officer
Description: A local authority must refer certain matters to its monitoring officer for investigation.

Label: Local government -  case tribunals
Description: A local authority must consider recommendations made by case tribunals and take other steps.

Label: Local government -  register of members interests
Description: A local authority must maintain and disclose a register of members' interests.

Label: Local government -  employee code of conduct
Description: A local authority must comply with prescribed requirements for a code of conduct for employees.

Label: Local government - delegation of monitoring officer functions
Description: A monitoring officer of a local authority must delegate certain functions in certain circumstances.

Label: Noise - investigation of complaints
Description: An officer of a local authority may investigate certain complaints relating to noise at night emanating from private dwellings and certain other premises and may issue a warning notice.

Label: Noise - warning notices
Description: Any warning notice issued must comply with regulations.

Label: Noise - evidence used in proceedings
Description: Any evidence used in proceedings brought for an offence must comply with the requirements of section 7 of the Act.

Label: Noise - fixed penalty notice
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may issue a fixed penalty notice in the prescribed form if he believes that an offence has been committed.

Label: Noise - entry and seizure
Description: Where a warning notice has been served and at any time in the period specified in the notice, noise emitted from the dwelling has exceeded the permitted level an officer of the local authority, or a person authorised by the authority for the purpose, may enter the dwelling from which the noise in question is being or has been emitted and may seize and remove any equipment which it appears to him is being or has been used in the emission of the noise.

Label: Noise - loudspeakers in streets or roads
Description: A local authority may resolve (which resolution must be published) that Schedule 2 (regulation the authorisation process for the operation of loud speakers in streets and roads) is to apply to its area and if it does so resolve, Schedule 2 shall come into force in its area on such date as may be specified for that purpose in the resolution.

Label: Road traffic - reports on levels of road traffic
Description: It shall be the duty of every principal council to prepare, at such time or times as the Secretary of State may direct, a report containing an assessment of the levels of local road traffic in their area, and a forecast of the growth in those levels.  Additional requirements for the report are as detailed in regulations.

Label: Education -  infant class size
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must comply with regulations regarding infant class sizes.

Label: Education -  education action zones or forums.
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must comply with regulations regarding education action zones or forums.

Label: Education -  intervention in schools causing concern
Description: A local authority may intervene in a school causing concern in certain circumstances and must take certain prescribed steps before so doing.

Label: Education -  additional governors in schools causing concern
Description: A local authority may appoint additional governors in a school causing concern in certain circumstances.

Label: Education - interim executive members for schools causing concern
Description: A local authority may order, having taken prescribed steps that the governing body of a maintained school will consist of interim executive members.

Label: Education - suspension of right to a delegated budget for schools causing concern
Description: A local authority may, having taken prescribed steps, suspend the right of the governing body of a maintained school to a delegated budget.

Label: Education -  closure of schools causing concern
Description: A local authority must comply with a direction from the National Assembly that a school should close.

Label: Education -  warning notice for schools causing concern
Description: A local authority must comply with a direction from the Welsh Ministers to issue a Teachers' pay and conditions warning notice.

Label: Education -  categories of maintained school
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by the local authority must ensure that a maintained school belongs to one of prescribed categories.

Label: Education -  maintenance and other funding of schools
Description: A local authority must maintain a maintained school and defray its expenditure.

Label: Education - information requested by school adjudicator
Description: A local authority or a governing body of a maintained school must comply with a request by the school adjudicator for certain information.

Label: Education -  proposals for establishment or alteration of a maintained school
Description: A local authority must publish its proposals for the establishment or alteration of a community, voluntary or foundation school in accordance with this section.

Label: Education -  proposals for discontinuance of a maintained school
Description: A local authority must publish its proposals for the discontinuance of a community, voluntary, foundation or maintained nursery school in accordance with this section.

Label: Education -  notice by governing body to discontinue foundation or voluntary school.
Description: A governing body of a foundation or voluntary school wishing to discontinue the same must give notice as required by this section.

Label: Education -  proposals regarding community or foundation special schools
Description: A local authority must publish its proposals for the establishment, alteration or discontinuance of community or foundation special schools in accordance with this section.

Label: Education -  direction requiring discontinuance of community or foundation special schools
Description: A local authority must comply with a direction from the National Assembly regarding the discontinuance of community or foundation special schools.

Label: Education - rationalisation of school places
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by it must comply with a direction from the National Assembly to bring forward proposals for the rationalisation of school places.

Label: Education -  change of school category
Description: A local authority or a governing body of a maintained school may change school categories.

Label: Education -  control and use of school premises
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may control and use the school premises.

Label: Education - determination of school budget share in England
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the determination of a school's budget share.

Label: Education - determination of school budget share in Wales
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations regarding the determination of a school's budget share or with a direct or order from the National Assembly.

Label: Education -  financial scheme
Description: A local authority must prepare and maintain a financial scheme relating to the financing of schools.

Label: Education -  delegated budget for maintained schools
Description: A local authority must provide the schools which it maintains with a delegated budget.

Label: Education -  suspension of delegated budget for financial mismanagement
Description: A local authority may suspend a delegated budget of a maintained school for financial mismanagement.

Label: Education -  financial statements
Description: A local authority must prepare financial statements as required by regulations. in respect of its educational expenditure.

Label: Education -  certification of statements by the Auditor General for Wales
Description: A local authority must comply with directions for certifying financial statements by the Auditor General for Wales.

Label: Education -  staff in schools with or without religious character
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by it, must comply with regulations with regard to the appointment and dismissal of teachers at schools with or without a religious character.

Label: Education -  reserve power to prevent a breakdown of discipline
Description: A local authority may exercise its reserve power to prevent a breakdown of discipline in certain circumstances.

Label: Education -  school attendance targets.
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulations regarding school attendance targets.

Label: Education -  religious education and worship
Description: A local authority and governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must secure due provision of religious education and collective worship.

Label: Education -  new schools
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to new schools.

Label: Education -  transfer of staff and land
Description: A local authority must comply with staff and land transfer provision in  respect of schools which become community, foundation, voluntary or community special schools.

Label: Education -  disposal of land on discontinuance of a school
Description: A local authority must comply with provisions relating to the disposal on land on discontinuance of a school.

Label: Education -  disposal or change of use of school playing fields
Description: A local authority must obtain the appropriate consent before disposing of or changing the use of a school playing field.

Label: Education -  provision of education for those aged over sixteen
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must decide whether or not to provide education to those aged 16+ but must only cease provision with the consent of the local authority.

Label: Education -  modifications to employment legislation
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with modifications made to employment legislation applying during financial delegation.

Label: Education -  modifications to trust deeds
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with modifications made by order to trust deeds.

Label: Education -  code for school admissions
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with the code for school admissions.

Label: Education -  admissions forums
Description: A local education authority shall in accordance with regulations establish for their area a body, to be known as an admission forum, for the purpose of advising the authority on such matters connected with the exercise of the authority's functions under this Chapter as may be prescribed, and advising the admission authorities for maintained schools in the area for which the forum is established onsuch matters connected with the determination of admission arrangements, and such other matters connected with the admission of pupils,as may be prescribed.

Label: Education -  parental preferences
Description: A local authority must make arrangements for enabling parents to express a parental preference and to provide advice or assistance in respect of the same.

Label: Education - admissions arrangements
Description: A local authority must comply with the statutory scheme for admissions arrangements.

Label: Education -  information regarding admissions
Description: A local authority and a governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must publicise information about school admissions.

Label: Education -  admissions appeal arrangements
Description: A local authority shall make arrangements for admissions appeals.

Label: Education -  direction to admit a child to a specified school
Description: A local authority may direct the admission of a child to a school in certain circumstances.

Label: Education - school admissions for looked after children
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the admission of looked after children to schools.

Label: Education - restriction on selection by ability or aptitude
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority may not make arrangements for admission based upon ability and aptitude other than those prescribed by legislation.

Label: Education -  designation of grammar schools
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with the legislative framework relating to the continuance and cessation of grammar schools.

Label: Education -  home school agreements
Description: A governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must adopt a home school agreement accompanied by a parental declaration.

Label: Education - requirements for food and drink on school premises
Description: A local authority or the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulations relating to food and drink provided on school premises.

Label: Education -  nursery education
Description: A local authority must secure provision for nursery education in accordance with regulations and guidance.

Label: Education -  early years development partnership
Description: A local authority must develop an early years development and childcare partnership.

Label: Education -  children with special educational needs in nursery education
Description: A local authority and any education provider must have regard to the code of practice on special educational needs when discharging its duties with regard to early years/nursery education.

Label: Education -  code of practice for local authorities and maintained schools
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must have regard to the code practice for local authorities and maintained schools when discharging its duties.

Label: Education -  deduction of General Teaching Council fees from salaries
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulation regarding the deduction of General Teaching Council fees from teacher's salaries.

Label: Education -  supply of information to General Teaching Council
Description: A local authority and the governing body of a school maintained by a local authority must comply with regulation requiring them to supply information to the GTC for Wales in circumstances relating to dismissals or resignations relating to misconduct or incompetence.

Label: Trading standards - trade marks
Description: A local authority must enforce the prohibition on unauthorised use of trade marks in section 92 of the Act.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - provision of facilities
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly must provide specified facilities for the duration of the scheme.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - regulations
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly, providing a bus partnership scheme must comply with regulations.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - variation or revocation of scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly, providing a bus partnership scheme may vary or revoke the scheme.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - guidance about schemes
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly, providing a bus partnership scheme must have regard to guidance.

Label: Bus services quality contract schemes - tendering for contracts
Description: The authority, or the authorities acting jointly, must invite tenders for the provision of services to which the scheme relates for such period and on such basis as may be specified in the invitation to tender.

Label: Bus services quality contract schemes - continuance of schemes
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly may continue a quality contract scheme for further periods in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services quality contract schemes - variation or revocation
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly may vary or revoke a quality contract scheme for further periods in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services quality contract schemes - regulations about schemes
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly must comply with regulations relating to quality contract schemes.

Label: Bus services quality contract schemes - guidance about schemes
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly must comply with guidance relating to quality contract schemes.

Label: Local transport plans
Description: A local authority must develop and carry out policies for the promotion and encouragement of safe, integrated, efficient and economic transport to, from and within their area.

Label: Local transport plans - review and alteration in England
Description: A local authority must keep their transport plan under review and alter the same where required and consult where required.

Label: Local transport plans - approval of plans
Description: A local authority in Wales must submit their transport plan to the National Assembly for approval and amend the same if required.

Label: Local transport plans - review and alteration in Wales
Description: A local authority in Wales must keep its transport plan under review and alter the same as required. It must also take such other steps as are required.

Label: Local transport plans - modification order and directions
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with a modification order or Directions made by the National assembly with regard to its transport plans.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - new scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly may make a quality partnership scheme as part of their local transport policy.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - notice and consultation
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly proposing to make a quality partnership scheme as part of their local transport policy must observe certain notice and consultation requirements.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - making of scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly proposing to make a quality partnership scheme as part of their local transport policy must comply with certain requirements when making the scheme.

Label: Bus services quality partnership scheme - postponement of scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly may postpone a quality partnership scheme in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services quality contract scheme - new scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly may make a quality contract scheme as part of their local transport policy.

Label: Bus services quality contract scheme - notice and consultation
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly proposing to make a quality contract scheme as part of their local transport policy must observe certain notice and consultation requirements.

Label: Bus services quality contract scheme - approval of proposed scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly proposing to make a quality contract scheme must apply to the appropriate national body for approval.

Label: Bus services quality contract scheme - making of scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly, when making a quality contract scheme must comply with certain requirements including the appeals procedure.

Label: Bus services quality contract scheme - postponement of scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly may postpone a quality contract scheme in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services - joint and through ticketing schemes
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly may make a joint and through ticketing scheme as part of their local transport policy.

Label: Bus services joint and through ticketing schemes - notice and consultation
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly proposing to make a joint and through ticketing scheme must comply with certain notice and consultation requirements.

Label: Bus services joint and through ticketing schemes - making of scheme
Description: A local authority or two or more authorities acting jointly when making a joint and through ticketing scheme must comply with certain conditions.

Label: Bus services - making information available
Description: A local authority must having considered certain matters make information about bus services available.

Label: Bus services - information from service operator
Description: A local authority may obtain information from service providers regarding local bus services.

Label: Bus services - civil penalties for bus lane contraventions
Description: A local authority may levy charges for bus lane contravention in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services - mandatory travel concessions
Description: A local authority must issue a permit for free travel to elderly and disabled persons in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services - enforcement of mandatory travel concessions
Description: A local authority may take proceedings to enforce mandatory travel concessions for free travel for elderly and disabled persons.

Label: Bus services - reimbursement of operator for mandatory travel concessions
Description: A local authority must reimburse the transport operator in respect of mandatory travel concessions for free travel for elderly and disabled persons.

Label: Transport  - grants to transport authorities
Description: A local authority must comply with the conditions of any transport grant.

Label: Roads - local charging schemes
Description: A local charging scheme or a joint local charging scheme may be put into operation by certain local authorities in certain circumstances.

Label: Roads - workplace parking levy
Description: A local work place levy licencing scheme or joint scheme may be put into operation by certain local authorities in certain circumstances.

Label: Roads - quiet lane or home zone
Description: A local authority may designate any road a quiet lane of home zone by order and must comply with regulations

Label: Breeding of dogs - inspection of premises not covered by licence
Description: A local authority may in certain circumstances inspect premises not covered by licence under the Breeding of Dogs Act 1973.

Label: Trading standards - sales of tobacco to children
Description: A local authority must consider, at least once in every period of twelve months, the extent to which it is appropriate for them to carry out in their area a programme of enforcement action and carry out that enforcement action.

Label: Dangerous dogs - seizure, entry of premises and inspection
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may, with a warrant, enter premises, inspect and seize a dangerous dog and other evidence.

Label: Integrated pollution control and air pollution - discharge of functions
Description: A local authority must have regard to directions from the Secretary of State and to the Act when exercising its functions.

Label: Environmental protection -  authorisation for prescribed process
Description: A local authority must consider applications to carry out prescribed processes.

Label: Environmental protection -  conditions of authorisations
Description: A local authority must place certain conditions in any authorisations.

Label: Environmental protection -  fees and charges for authorisations
Description: A local authority must charge fees for authorisations in accordance with the Secretary of State's scheme.

Label: Environmental protection -  variation of authorisations
Description: A local authority may vary an authorisation in certain circumstances.

Label: Environmental protection -  revocation of authorisation
Description: A local authority may revoke an authorisation in certain circumstances.

Label: Environmental protection - enforcement notices
Description: If the enforcing authority is of the opinion that the person carrying on a prescribed process under an authorisation is contravening any condition of the authorisation, or is likely to contravene any such condition, the authority may serve on him a notice (an enforcement notice).

Label: Environmental protection - prohibition notices
Description: If the enforcing authority is of the opinion, as respects the carrying on of a prescribed process under an authorisation, that the continuing to carry it on, or the continuing to carry it on in a particular manner, involves an imminent risk of serious pollution of the environment the authority shall serve a notice (a prohibition notice) on the person carrying on the process.

Label: Environmental protection -  appeals as respect authorisations
Description: A local authority must comply with the outcome of any appeal.

Label: Environmental protection -  obtaining of information from persons and authorities
Description: A local authority must provide with a Notice from the Secretary of State requesting the provision of information.

Label: Environmental protection -  public register of information
Description: A local authority must maintain a public register of prescribed information.

Label: Environmental protection -  enforcement action in the High Court
Description: A local authority may take enforcement action in the High Court in circumstances where criminal proceedings would provide insufficient sanction.

Label: Waste disposal -  fixed penalty notices for offences
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may issue fixed penalty notices for certain waste disposal offences.

Label: Waste disposal -  search and seizure of vehicles
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may in certain circumstances search and seize vehicles where it is believed  a vehicle was used in the commission of an offence.

Label: Controlled waste - household waste collection
Description: A local authority must collect domestic waste (subject to limited exceptions).

Label: Controlled waste - industrial waste collection
Description: A local authority may collect industrial waste in certain circumstances.

Label: Controlled waste - mandatory emptying of privies and cesspools
Description: A local authority must make such arrangements for the emptying, without charge, of privies serving one or more private dwellings in its area as the authority considers appropriate and if requested by the person who controls a cesspool serving only one or more private dwellings in its area to empty the cesspool, to remove such of the contents of the cesspool as the authority considers appropriate on payment, if the authority so requires, of a reasonable charge.

Label: Controlled waste - discretionary emptying of privies and cesspools
Description: An authority may, if requested by the person who controls any other privy or cesspool in its area to empty the privy or cesspool, empty the privy or, as the case may be, remove from the cesspool such of its contents as the authority consider appropriate on payment, if the authority so requires, of a reasonable charge.

Label: Controlled waste - household recycling collection
Description: A local authority must (save in exceptional circumstances) collect at least two types of recyclable waste together or individually separated from the rest of the household waste unless they have applied for and been granted a dispensation not to do so.

Label: Household waste - receptacles for collection
Description: A local authority may make provision by notice as to the type of receptacles to be used for the collection of household waste and how they are to be provided and funded. The local authority may issue a penalty notice for failure to comply.

Label: Commercial waste - receptacles for collection
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances, provide and charge for the provision of receptacles for commercial or industrial waste make provision by notice as to the type of receptacles to be used for the collection of that waste.

Label: Waste collection - fixed penalty notices for offences related to receptacles
Description: An officer duly authorised by a local authority may, in certain circumstances, issue a fixed penalty notice, in the manner prescribed, for offences under sections 46 and 47 of the Act.

Label: Controlled waste - disposal of non-recyclable waste
Description: A local authority must deliver (non-recyclable) collected waste to a waste disposal authority for disposal.

Label: Controlled waste - disposal of recyclable waste
Description: A local authority must inform a waste disposal authority of its plans to dispose of recyclable waste and may only do so to the extent agreed by the waste disposal authority.

Label: Controlled waste - disposal
Description: A local authority must arrange for the disposal of the controlled waste collected in its area by the waste collection authorities.

Label: Household waste - sites for deposit by residents
Description: A local authority must arrange for places to be provided at which persons resident in its area may deposit their household waste free of charge and for the disposal of waste so deposited.

Label: Controlled waste - directions to waste collection authorities regarding disposal
Description: A local authority must give directions to waste collection authorities in relation to the disposal of the controlled waste collected in its area.

Label: Controlled waste - financial assistance for disposal of commercial waste
Description: A local authority may give prescribed financial assistance directions to assist in the disposal of commercial of industrial waste

Label: Controlled waste - disposal of non-household waste
Description: A local authority may provide facilities for the disposal of non-household waste and may charge for the same.

Label: Controlled waste - payments for retained recyclable and pre-separated waste
Description: A local authority must make certain payments to waste collection authorities in respect of retained recyclable and pre-separated waste.

Label: Controlled waste - recycling of waste
Description: A local authority has powers to purchase, sell and utilise recycled waste.

Label: Controlled waste - compliance with directions
Description: A local authority must comply with direction from the Secretary of State regarding controlled waste.

Label: Unlawfully deposited waste - removal
Description: A local authority may give directions regarding waste unlawfully deposited upon land and in certain circumstances may remove the waste itself and recover costs.

Label: Unlawfully deposited waste - compliance with directions
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the Secretary of State with regard to waste unlawfully deposited upon land and must in certain circumstances publicise those directions.

Label: Controlled waste - minimising generation
Description: A local authority may take steps to minimise the generation of controlled waste.

Label: Controlled waste - information from waste authority
Description: A local authority must comply with a request from the Secretary of State for information.

Label: Controlled waste - requesting of information
Description: A local authority may request information regarding controlled waste.

Label: Controlled waste - use of fixed penalty receipts
Description: A local authority may use certain fixed penalty notice receipts for certain purposes.

Label: Contaminated land -  inspection and notice
Description: A local authority must inspect its area to identify contaminated land, to designate special sites and give notice of the same.

Label: Contaminated land -  remediation notice
Description: A local authority must serve a remediation notice, in the prescribed manner, in respect of contaminated land (non-special sites) in its area.

Label: Contaminated land -  remediation works
Description: A local authority may carry out remediation works on contaminated land in certain circumstances and to recover its costs.

Label: Contaminated land -  register of notices
Description: A local authority must maintain a register of remediation and other notices in the manner prescribed.

Label: Contaminated land -  provision of information
Description: A local authority must supply the appropriate agency with information, or with a report on the state of contaminated land in their area, when requested.

Label: Contaminated land -  compliance with guidance
Description: A local authority must comply with site specific guidance with regard to contaminated land.

Label: Statutory nuisances - inspection and investigation
Description: A local authority must inspect its area from time to time to identify statutory nuisances and must investigate the same.

Label: Statutory nuisances - criminal and civil proceedings for breach of abatement notice
Description: A local authority may bring criminal and criminal proceedings in the case of a breach of an abatement notice.

Label: Statutory nuisances - notice to recover expenses
Description: A local authority may serve a notice to recover expenses in certain circumstances which will become a charge on premises.

Label: Litter -  publicity of offence of leaving litter
Description: A local authority may publicise the fact that leaving litter is an offence and the consequences of committing that offence.

Label: Litter -  fixed penalty notice
Description: A person authorised by a local authority may issue a fixed penalty notice for the offence of littering.

Label: Litter -  keeping land and highway litter free
Description: A local authority must ensure that the land in their area is, so far as is practicable, kept clear of litter and refuse.

Label: Litter -  land of the Crown, educational establishments and statutory undertakers
Description: A local authority must where land of the Crown, educational establishments or statutory undertakers is defaced by litter or refuse or that defacement of it by litter or refuse is likely to recur, serve a litter abatement notice imposing either a prescribed requirement or prohibition.

Label: Litter -  litter clearing notices
Description: A local authority may serve a litter clearing notice in respect of any land in the open air.

Label: Litter -  street litter control notices
Description: A local authority may issue a street litter clearing notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Litter -  fixed penalty notices for street litter
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may issue a fixed penalty notice in the prescribed manner in relation to certain street litter offences.

Label: Litter -  free distribution of printed matter
Description: A local authority may make certain orders and grant licences about the distribution of printed matter.

Label: Litter -  public register
Description: A local authority must maintain a public register of litter control notices and orders and make the same a available for inspection and supply copy documents for a fee.

Label: Litter -  direction regarding collected litter
Description: A local authority must comply with directions in respect of certain collected litter.

Label: Abandoned shopping and luggage trolleys
Description: A local authority may adopt powers in relation to abandoned shopping and luggage trolleys in accordance with the required procedure.

Label: Stray dogs - appointment and actions by officer
Description: A local authority must appoint an officer to discharge the functions of seizing, serving notices regarding, disposing of or returning stray dogs and may charge for certain expenses for so doing.

Label: Food safety - enforcement
Description: Where a local authority is the enforcement authority as defined by the Act or by regulations it may enforce the provisions of the Act or regulations.

Label: Food safety -  inspection and seizure of suspected food
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may inspect, prevent the use of or seize suspected food intended, commercially, for human consumption.

Label: Food safety -  improvement notices
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may issue an improvement notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Food safety -  prohibitions orders
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority must take certain steps with regard to prohibition orders in certain circumstances.  Steps for an order issued by a court include serving a copy of the order on the proprietor of the business and affixing a copy of the order in a conspicuous place in the business  premises.

Label: Food safety -  emergency prohibition notices
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may in certain circumstances issue an emergency prohibition notice and must take certain steps regarding the notice and any order made by a court.

Label: Food safety -  registration and licensing of food premises
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to the registration and licensing of food premises.

Label: Food safety -  food hygiene training
Description: A local authority may provide food hygiene training  for persons who are or intend to become involved in food businesses, whether as proprietors or employees or otherwise or may contribute towards the expenses of another authority which provides such training.

Label: Food safety -  shellfish cleansing
Description: A local authority may provide facilities for cleansing shellfish or contribute towards the expenses of another authority which provides such facilities.

Label: Food safety -  public analyst
Description: A local authority must appoint a one or more persons to act as a public analyst with the authority's area in the manner prescribed.

Label: Food safety -  facilities for examination
Description: A local authority may provide facilities for microbiological examination of food.

Label: Food safety -  test purchases and the taking of samples
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may make test purchases and take samples of food and other substances.

Label: Food safety -  analysis of samples
Description: A local authority must take prescribed steps regarding the analysis of samples.

Label: Food safety -  powers of entry, inspection and seizure
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may in accordance with the Act enter premises and apply for a warrant if entry is refused and may carry out certain inspections and seize records.

Label: Food safety -  code of practice and directions
Description: A local authority must have regard to any code of practice issued and must comply with directions made pursuant to the code.

Label: Food safety -  provision of returns
Description: A local authority must provide reports or returns to the Secretary of state or to the Food Standards Agency as required.

Label: Food safety -  default powers
Description: A local authority where deemed to be in default by the Secretary of State must comply with the Secretary of State when exercising default powers and must pay various expenses.

Label: Food safety -  charging and expenses
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations as to charges which it may make in relation to it's food safety functions.  Expenses of authorised officers and county councils should be defrayed in accordance with regulations.

Label: Council tax -  levying and collection
Description: Each local authority must levy and collect a tax, to be called council tax, which is payable in respect of dwellings situated in its area.

Label: Council tax -  regulations on discounts in England
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to discounts.

Label: Council tax -  discretionary discounts in England
Description: A local authority may exercise its powers arising from regulations relating to discounts.

Label: Council tax - regulations on empty dwellings
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to empty dwellings.

Label: Council tax - discretionary charges for empty dwellings
Description: A local authority may exercise powers under regulations relating to empty dwellings.

Label: Council tax -  regulations on discounts in Wales
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to discounts.

Label: Council tax -  discretionary discounts in Wales
Description: A local authority may exercise powers relating to discounts contained in regulations.

Label: Council tax -  reduced amounts
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to reduced amounts.

Label: Council tax -  reduction schemes
Description: A local authority must make a council tax reduction scheme.

Label: Council tax - regulations
Description: A local authority must comply with certain regulations made under the Act regarding powers to require information, offences and penalties.

Label: Council tax -  administration, penalties and enforcement
Description: A local authority must comply with provisions regarding administration, penalties and enforcement.

Label: Council tax -  setting of council tax
Description: For each financial year and each category of dwellings in its area, a billing authority shall, in accordance with regulations, set an amount of council tax.

Label: Council tax -  information for purposes of setting council tax
Description: A local authority must provide certain information to a billing authority in the manner prescribed by regulations.

Label: Council tax -  issue of precepts by major precepting authorities
Description: For each financial year a major precepting authority shall issue a precept or precepts in accordance with section 40.

Label: Council tax -  issue of precepts by local precepting authorities
Description: A local authority must issue a precept in accordance with section 41.

Label: Council tax -  provision of information to any precepting authority
Description: A billing authority must supply prescribed information within a prescribed period to any precepting authority which has power to issue a precept to the billing authority.

Label: Council tax - excessive council tax
Description: A local authority must determine whether its relevant basic amount of council tax for a financial year is excessive.

Label: Council tax - referendum on excessive council tax
Description: A local authority must hold a referendum regarding its council tax in certain circumstances and take such other steps as are required.

Label: Council tax - substitute calculations by major precepting authority where excessive council tax
Description: A local authority must make substitute calculations in certain circumstances and take other prescribed steps.

Label: Council tax - substitute calculations by local precepting authority where excessive council tax
Description: A local authority must make substitute calculations in certain circumstances and to take other prescribed steps.

Label: Council tax - regulations and directions on excessive council tax
Description: A local authority must comply with various regulations and directions.

Label: Council tax - designation and nomination in relation to excessive council tax
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure relating to designation and nomination.

Label: Council tax -  consultation with ratepayers
Description: A local authority must consult ratepayers in certain circumstances.

Label: Council tax -  functions to be discharged only by authority
Description: A local authority may not delegate certain matters.

Label: Council tax -  provision of information to Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with a request for information from the Secretary of State.

Label: Council tax -  restrictions on voting by members
Description: A local authority must ensure that members do not vote in certain circumstances.

Label: Community care - plans for community care services
Description: A local authority must prepare, publish and keep under review plans for community care services.

Label: Community care - assessment and provision
Description: A local authority must, in the manner prescribed, carry out an assessment of needs, provide information and where necessary make provision for community care services.

Label: Community care - transfer of staff from health services
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the transfer of staff from NHS employment to employment by the local authority.

Label: Street works - directions as to timing
Description: If it appears to the authority that proposed street works are likely to cause serious disruption to traffic, and that the disruption would be avoided or reduced if the works were carried out only at certain times, the authority may give the undertaker such directions as may be appropriate as to the times when the works may or may not be carried out.

Label: Street works - directions as to placing of apparatus
Description: A local authority may give directions as to the placing of apparatus in connection with street works.

Label: Roads - concession agreements
Description: A local authority must comply with provisions relating to concession agreements.

Label: Roads - toll orders
Description: A local authority may issue toll orders in certain circumstances.

Label: Street works licence
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances, grant a street works licence permitting a person to place, or to retain, apparatus in the street and thereafter to inspect, maintain, adjust, repair, alter or renew the apparatus, change its position or remove it and to execute for those purposes any works required.

Label: Street works register
Description: A local authority must maintain and make available a street works register which must comply with prescribed conditions.

Label: Street works - advance notice
Description: A local authority may prescribe requirements when given an advance notice by an undertaker proposing to execute street works.

Label: Street works - notice restricting works following substantial road works
Description: A local authority may give notice restricting street works following substantial road works.

Label: Street works - co-ordination of street works
Description: A local authority must use its best endeavours to coordinate the execution of works of all kinds.

Label: Street works - protected streets
Description: A local authority may give its consent for the placing of apparatus in protected streets and may charge fees for so doing.

Label: Street works - streets with special engineering difficulties
Description: A local authority must consider designating street as a street with special engineering difficulties when requested to do so.

Label: Street works - traffic sensitive streets
Description: A local authority may make a limited designation order in relation to traffic sensitive streets in certain circumstances.

Label: Street works - safety measures
Description: A local authority may give directions as to safety measures to an undertaker of street works in their area.

Label: Street works - unreasonable delay or obstruction
Description: A local authority may issue a notice to prevent unreasonable delay and obstruction and may recover certain costs.

Label: Street works - reinstatement
Description: A local authority may investigate the reinstatement of a road, require the undertaker to repair and in certain circumstances carry out the repairs itself and charge the undertaker for so doing.

Label: Street works - unreasonably prolonged works
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to unreasonably prolonged works.

Label: Street works - temporary traffic regulation
Description: Where by reason of street works the traffic authority makes an order or issues a notice under section 14 of the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 (temporary prohibition or restriction of traffic), the authority may recover from the undertaker the whole of the costs incurred by them in connection with or in consequence of the order or notice.

Label: Street works - maintenance of apparatus
Description: A local authority must take certain steps relating to the maintenance of apparatus as regards the safety and convenience of persons using the street (having regard, in particular, to the needs of people with a disability), the structure of the street and the integrity of apparatus of the authority in the street.

Label: Street works - road works and apparatus.
Description: A local authority must provide the owners of apparatus with certain information regarding certain road works in certain circumstances.  This section applies to works for road purposes other than major highway works.

Label: Street works - major road works and apparatus
Description: A local authority must co-operate with others and the owners of apparatus in certain information regarding certain major road works.

Label: Street works - cost sharing for major road works and apparatus
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding cost sharing in certain circumstances.

Label: Roads - prospectively maintainable highway
Description: A local authority must take certain steps with regard to a prospectively maintainable highway.

Label: Roads - bridge works
Description: A local authority must take certain steps with regard to bridge works.

Label: Street works - undertaken by street authority or district council
Description: A street authority or district council may enter into an agreement with an undertaker for the execution by the authority or council on behalf of the undertaker of any street works.

Label: Planning -  hazardous substances consents
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding hazardous substance applications and consents and their determination.

Label: Planning -  conditions for hazardous substances consents
Description: A local authority may impose conditions when granting a hazardous substance consent.

Label: Planning - hazardous substances established presence
Description: A local authority must take certain steps when established presence is claimed in relation to a hazardous substance consent.

Label: Planning -  hazardous substances new consent
Description: A local authority must take certain steps with regard to a new request for consent without the conditions attached to a previous consent.

Label: Planning -  revocation or modification of hazardous substances consents
Description: A local authority may by order (which must be confirmed) revoke or modify hazardous substance consents in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  compensation for revocation or modification of hazardous substances consent
Description: A local authority must pay compensation in certain circumstances where an Order is made under section 14.

Label: Planning -  continuation of hazardous substances consents
Description: A local authority must consider and determine application for the continuation of a hazardous substance consent and must pay compensation in certain circumstances..

Label: Planning -  referral of applications for hazardous substances consents
Description: A local authority must comply with directions requiring the referral of certain applications to the Secretary of State.

Label: Planning -  appeals and hearings regarding hazardous substances consents
Description: A local authority must comply with the appeals procedure and the determination of the Secretary of State.

Label: Planning -  hazardous substances contravention notice
Description: A local authority may issue, serve, vary or withdraw (in the prescribed manner) a hazardous substances contravention notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  hazardous substances consent application fees
Description: A local authority must charge prescribed fees for certain applications.

Label: Planning -  hazardous substances injunctions
Description: A local authority may apply to the high court or the primary court for any actual or apprehended contravention of hazardous substances control to be restrained by injunction

Label: Planning -  hazardous substances temporary exemptions directions
Description: A local authority must comply with a temporary exemption direction.

Label: Planning -  register of hazardous substances applications and consents
Description: A local authority must compile, maintain and make available a register with the prescribed content relating to hazardous substances.

Label: Planning - hazardous substances on Crown land
Description: A local authority must comply with provisions relating to hazardous substances on Crown Land.

Label: Planning -  right of entry on land with hazardous substances
Description: A person authorised in writing by a local authority may with or without a warrant enter land in certain circumstances for the purpose of surveying in connection with any application for hazardous substances consent or any proposal to issue a hazardous substances contravention notice.

Label: Planning -  right of entry to Crown land for hazardous substances surveying
Description: A person authorised in writing by a local authority may enter Crown land in certain circumstances for the purpose of surveying the same, but only after having first obtained the appropriate authority.

Label: Planning -  list of buildings of special architectural or historical interest
Description: A local authority must have regard to the list of buildings of special architectural or historical interest approved by the Secretary of State when carrying out its functions and must where applicable make such lists available for inspection.

Label: Planning -  buildings preservation notice
Description: A local authority may serve in the prescribed form a building preservation notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  issue of certificate that building not intended to be listed
Description: A local authority may not serve a building preservation notice for the period during which a certificate from the Secretary of State that the building is not intended to be listed is in force.

Label: Planning -  listed buildings consent
Description: A local authority may award listed buildings consent for the alteration, extension or demolition of a listed building in the manner prescribed and subject to conditions.

Label: Planning -  variation or discharge of conditions attached to listed buildings consent
Description: A local authority may vary or discharge conditions attached to a listed Buildings Consent to the extent permitted.

Label: Planning -  appeals against listed buildings consent decision
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure regarding appeals on listed building consent decisions and the decision of the appeal.

Label: Planning -  revocation and modification of listed buildings consent
Description: A local authority may revoke or modify listed buildings consent.

Label: Planning - heritage partnership agreements
Description: A local authority may enter into a heritage partnership agreement with prescribed legal individuals, which may contain prescribed conditions and/or measures.

Label: Planning - local listed building consent orders
Description: A local authority may grant listed building consent for works by means of a local listed building consent order.

Label: Planning -  direction on local listed building consent orders
Description: A local authority must comply with directions of the Secretary of State in relation to local listed building consent orders.

Label: Planning -  variation or revocation of local listed building consent orders
Description: A local authority may vary or revoke a local listed building consent order.

Label: Planning - certificate of lawfulness of proposed works to listed building
Description: A local authority must issue a certificate of lawfulness of proposed works in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  appeals regarding certificate of lawfulness for listed building
Description: A local authority must comply with the appeals procedure with regard to certificates of lawfulness.

Label: Planning -  compensation for decisions on listed buildings
Description: A local authority must pay compensation in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  listed buildings purchase notices
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure relating to listed building purchase notices.

Label: Planning -  listed buildings enforcement notice
Description: A local authority may issue, serve, amend, vary or withdraw a listed building enforcement notice in the prescribed manner in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  appeals against listed buildings enforcement notice
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure regarding appeals relating to listed building enforcement notices and the outcome of that appeal.

Label: Planning -  execution of works required by listed building enforcement notice
Description: A local authority may in certain circumstances where an enforcement notice has not been complied with, enter premises, carry out works and recover the expenses involved in doing so.

Label: Planning -  injunctions for enforcement of listed buildings consent
Description: A local authority may apply to the high or county courts for injunctive relief in certain circumstances connected to enforcement.

Label: Planning -  compulsory acquisition of listed buildings
Description: A local authority may acquire a listed building which is not being properly preserved where the Secretary of State authorises it do so.

Label: Planning -  acquisition of buildings of special interest by agreement
Description: A local authority may acquire, by agreement, certain buildings and land to protect it from deterioration and damage.

Label: Planning -  management and disposal of acquired listed buildings
Description: A local authority may manage and disposal of any buildings acquired under sections 47 or 52 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Label: Planning -  emergency works to preserve listed buildings
Description: A local authority may carry out emergency works necessary for the preservation of a listed building and may recover the expenses involved in so doing.

Label: Planning -  contribution to preservation of listed buildings
Description: A local authority may by grant or loan and subject to conditions, contribute towards the preservation of a listed building.

Label: Planning -  planning permission for listed buildings
Description: A local authority considering whether to grant planning permission for development which affects a listed building or its setting, shall have special regard to the desirability of preserving the building or its setting or any features of special architectural or historic interest which it possesses.

Label: Planning -  publicity for applications affecting listed buildings
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding publicity for applications for planning permissions which may affect listed buildings.

Label: Planning -  listed buildings in Greater London
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding directions from the Historic Buildings and Monuments Commission for any application for planning permission for any development in Greater London which would, in the opinion of the local planning authority to which the application is made, involve the demolition, in whole or in part, or a material alteration, of a listed building.

Label: Planning -  designation of conservation areas
Description: A local authority must determine which parts of their area are areas of special architectural or historic interest the character or appearance of which it is desirable to preserve or enhance, shall designate those areas as conservation areas, shall review that determination and shall comply with any directions from the Secretary of State.

Label: Planning -  proposals for preservation and enhancement of conservation areas
Description: A local authority must formulate and publicise proposals for the preservation and enhancement of conservation areas.

Label: Planning -  exercise of planning functions in conservation areas
Description: A local authority must In the exercise, with respect to any buildings or other land in a conservation area pay special attention to the desirability of preserving or enhancing the character or appearance of that area

Label: Planning -  publicity for applications affecting conservation areas
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the Secretary of State with regard to publicity to be given to planning applications affecting conservation areas.

Label: Planning -  control of demolition in conservation areas
Description: A local authority may consent to certain demolitions in a conservation area.

Label: Planning -  town scheme agreements
Description: A local authority may enter into a town scheme agreement in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - determination of relevant application
Description: A local authority may decline to determine certain applications in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - Crown land
Description: A local authority must comply with provisions relating to Crown land.

Label: Planning -  powers of entry for listed buildings and conservation areas
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may for certain purposes under the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 enter land for those purposes.

Label: Planning -  determination of procedure for listed buildings
Description: A local authority must comply with procedures determined by the Secretary of State.

Label: Housing or council tax benefit - sharing of information
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations relating to the sharing of information relating to housing or council tax benefit.

Label: Social security information - use for a relevant purpose
Description: A local authority may use social security information for any relevant purpose.

Label: Housing and council tax benefits - collecting information and power of entry
Description: A person authorised by a local authority in connection with housing related benefits may exercise certain powers in respect of requiring information and entry.

Label: Housing and council tax benefits - electronic access to information
Description: A person authorised by a local authority in connection with housing related benefits may require electronic access to information in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing or council tax benefits - legal proceedings
Description: A local authority may bring legal proceedings for housing related benefit fraud in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing and council tax benefits - supply of information
Description: A local authority may supply or receive information in relation to housing benefit issues in certain circumstances.

Label: Housing benefits - funding and administration
Description: A local authority must fund and administer housing benefit.

Label: Housing and council tax benefits - nature of benefits
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding housing related benefits.

Label: Council tax benefit -  funding and administration
Description: A local authority must fund and administer council tax benefit.

Label: Planning -  development orders for granting of planning permission
Description: A local authority may grant planning permission pursuant to a development order, which may be subject to conditions or limitations.

Label: Planning - neighbourhood development orders
Description: A local authority must comply with provisions relating to neighbourhood development orders, business areas and community right to build orders.

Label: Planning -  form of applications for planning permission
Description: A local authority may require that a planning application should be made in a particular form and manner, must contains certain particulars and should be accompanied by specified documents or other materials.

Label: Planning - applications to Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with the decision of the Secretary of State in relation to planning applications made to him and with any directions given.

Label: Planning -  notice of applications for planning permission
Description: A local authority must not entertain an application for planning permission unless notice requirements have been complied with.

Label: Planning - register of applications etc.
Description: A local authority must keep, maintain and make available a register of planning related matters.

Label: Planning -  general conditions for determination of applications
Description: A local authority must take into account general considerations and consult when determining planning matters.

Label: Planning -  power to decline to determine applications
Description: A local authority may decline to determine applications in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  assessment of environmental effects in determination of applications
Description: A local authority must have regard to prescribed environmental considerations when determining an application.

Label: Planning -  conditional grant of planning permission
Description: A local authority may attach conditions to a grant of planning permission.

Label: Planning -  determination without compliance with attached conditions
Description: A local authority must determine an application for planning permission without conditions previously attached.

Label: Planning -  permission for development already carried out
Description: A local authority may grant planning permission for development already carried out.

Label: Planning -  directions.etc. as to method of dealing with applications
Description: A local authority must comply with directions when dealing with planning applications.

Label: Planning -  major infrastructure projects
Description: A local authority must comply with the decision of the Secretary of State with regard to certain major infrastructure projects.

Label: Planning -  referral of applications to the Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the referral of planning applications to the Secretary of State.

Label: Planning -  appeals against planning decisions
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure for planning appeals.

Label: Planning -  simplified planning zones
Description: A local authority may make or alter a simplified planning zone scheme.

Label: Planning -  review of simplified planning zone schemes
