Description: A local authority must keep the question of simplified planning zone schemes for their area under review.

Label: Planning -  development in enterprise zones
Description: A local authority must comply with the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 in so far as it relates to enterprise zone schemes.

Label: Planning -  duration of planning permission
Description: A local authority must incorporate time limits for the commencement of authorised works or for approval of reserved matters into planning permissions and outline planning permissions.

Label: Planning -  completion notices for development
Description: A local authority may serve a completion notice  stating that the planning permission will cease to have effect at the expiration of a further period specified in the notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  non-material changes to planning permission
Description: A local authority may make non-material changes to planning permissions.

Label: Planning -  revocation or modification of planning permission
Description: A local authority may revoke or modify planning permissions.

Label: Planning -  orders for discontinuance, alterations or removals etc.
Description: A local authority may (subject to confirmation by the Secretary of State) make orders, with regard to planning permissions, requiring continuance, discontinuance, alterations or removals etc. and recover expenses in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  planning obligations
Description: A local authority may enter into, modify or discharge planning obligations in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  compensation for revocation or modification of planning permission
Description: A local authority must pay compensation in certain circumstances relating to the modification or discharge of planning permission and in certain circumstances recover those payments.

Label: Planning -  compensation for refusal or conditional grant of planning permission
Description: A local authority must pay compensation in certain circumstances relating to the refusal or conditional grant of planning permission and in certain circumstances recover those payments.

Label: Planning - purchase notices
Description: A local authority must comply with a purchase notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - purchase of blighted land notice
Description: A local authority must comply with a purchase of blighted land notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - planning enforcement order
Description: A local authority may apply to the Magistrates' Court for a planning enforcement order in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - planning contravention notice
Description: A local authority may issue a planning contravention notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  temporary stop notice
Description: A local authority may issue a temporary stop notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  issue of enforcement notice
Description: A local authority may issue and serve an enforcement notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  assurance regarding prosecution where enforcement notice served
Description: A local authority may issue and serve an assurance regarding prosecution in circumstances where it has served an enforcement notice.

Label: Planning -  variation or withdrawal of enforcement notice
Description: A local authority may vary or withdraw an enforcement notice.

Label: Planning -  appeal against enforcement notice
Description: A local authority must comply with the procedure for appeals with regard to enforcement notices.

Label: Planning -  execution and cost of works required by enforcement notice
Description: A local authority may enter land and carry out works required by an enforcement notice in certain circumstances and recover reasonable expenses for doing so.

Label: Planning -  stop notice
Description: A local authority may issue and serve a stop notice prohibiting the carrying out a relevant activity on the land to which the enforcement notice relates, or any part of that land specified in the stop notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  compensation for loss due to stop notice
Description: A local authority must pay compensation where a stop notice has been served in certain circumstances

Label: Planning -  breach of conditions notice
Description: A local authority may issue and serve a breach of conditions notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  injunctions restraining breaches of planning control
Description: A local authority may seek an injunction in the county or high courts to enforce planning control.

Label: Planning -  register of enforcement and stop notices
Description: A local authority shall, in the manner prescribed keep a register of enforcement and stop notices and other enforcement action.

Label: Planning -  certificate of lawful use or development
Description: A local authority shall provide a certificate of lawful use or development in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  established use certificates
Description: A local authority shall comply with procedures relating to established use certificates.

Label: Planning -  appeals to the Secretary of State
Description: A local authority shall comply with procedures relating to appeals to the Secretary of State against refusal or failure to give decision on a planning application.

Label: Planning -  entry without warrant
Description: A person duly authorised by a local authority may, at any reasonable hour, enter land without a warrant for purposes connected to the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Label: Planning -  entry under warrant
Description: A person duly authorised by a local authority may, at any reasonable hour, enter land with a warrant issued by magistrates for purposes connected to the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Label: Planning -  provision for preservation and planting of trees
Description: A local authority shall ensure that in granting planning permission for any development, adequate provision is made, by the imposition of conditions, for the preservation or planting of trees

Label: Planning -  tree preservation orders
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances, make tree preservation orders and provisional orders in the case of Welsh authorities.

Label: Planning -  compensation for tree preservation orders
Description: A local authority may, by regulations be placed under a duty to keep registers and pay compensation.

Label: Planning -  enforcement of replacement of trees
Description: A local authority may take action to enforce the replacement of trees in certain circumstances, including entering land, carrying out works and recovering expenses.

Label: Planning -  register of notices of contraventions of tree preservation orders
Description: It shall be the duty of a local planning authority to compile and keep available for public inspection free of charge at all reasonable hours and at a convenient place a register containing such particulars as the Secretary of State may determine of notices under section 211 affecting trees in their area.

Label: Planning -  injunctions for breach of tree preservation orders
Description: A local authority may apply for an injunction to prevent a breach of this part of the Act.

Label: Planning -  entry to land without warrant in relation to tree preservation orders
Description: A person authorised by a local authority may enter land without a warrant for certain purposes.

Label: Planning -  entry to land under warrant in relation to tree preservation orders
Description: A person authorised by a local authority may enter land under a warrant issued by the magistrates' court for certain purposes.

Label: Planning -  notice requiring proper maintenance of land
Description: A local authority may serve a notice requiring a person to properly maintain land and must comply with the appeals procedure.

Label: Planning -  execution and cost of works for proper maintenance of land
Description: A local authority may enter land, carry out works and recover expenses in respect of a notice requiring proper maintenance of land in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  control of advertisements
Description: A local authority must comply with and enforce regulations providing for the control of advertisements and pay compensation for their removal in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  removal of placards and posters
Description: A local authority may remove or obliterate placards and posters and remove structures used for unauthorised display (England only) in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - action notice for control of advertisements
Description: A local authority may serve an action notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - defacement of premises
Description: A local authority may serve notice and remedy the defacement or premises bus shelters or street furniture in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  compulsory acquisition of land
Description: A local authority may acquire land for development and other planning purposes in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  appropriation of common land
Description: A local authority may with the consent of the Secretary of State appropriate part of the common land.

Label: Planning -  acquisition of land for exchange
Description: A local authority may acquire land for exchange purposes in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  determination by the Secretary of State to acquire land
Description: A local authority must comply with a determination by the Secretary of State to require acquisition or development of land.

Label: Planning -  use of appropriated or acquired land
Description: A local authority may use land appropriated or acquired for planning purposes for certain other purposes.

Label: Planning -  disposal of appropriated or acquired land
Description: A local authority may dispose of land appropriated or acquired for planning purposes by following certain procedures.

Label: Planning -  development of land
Description: A local authority may develop land that has been acquired or appropriated by a local authority for planning purposes, and is for the time being held by the authority for the purposes for which it was so acquired or appropriated.

Label: Planning -  discretionary stopping up or diversion of highway
Description: A local authority may authorise the stopping up or diversion of a highway for certain planning purposes.

Label: Planning -  directed stopping up or diversion of highway
Description: A local authority must comply with an order made by the Secretary of State re the stopping up or diversion of highways

Label: Planning -  extinguishment of rights of way over highway
Description: A local authority may extinguish rights of way over a highway in certain circumstances having followed a particular procedure.

Label: Planning -  compulsory acquisition in connection with highways
Description: A local authority may compulsory acquire land in connection with highway in certain circumstances and extinguish certain rights and rights of way.

Label: Planning -  temporary stopping up of highway for mineral workings
Description: A local authority may temporarily stop up a highway for mineral working purposes.

Label: Planning -  fees for planning applications etc.
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations made regarding the fees it should charge for exercising certain planning functions and other costs and contributions.

Label: Planning -  advance of money in relation to blight notices
Description: A local authority may advance money to any person in certain circumstances connected with blight notices.

Label: Planning -  recovery of compensation
Description: A local authority must pay amounts equivalent to compensation paid to the Secretary of State in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  expenses of county councils
Description: The council of a county may direct that any expenses incurred by them under the provisions specified in Parts I and II of Schedule 16 shall be treated as special expenses of a county council chargeable upon such part of the county as may be specified in the directions.

Label: Planning -  procedure for certain proceedings and local inquiries
Description: A local authority must comply with certain procedures and inquiries relating to the planning process.  A determination must provide for the proceedings to be considered in whichever of the following ways appears to the Secretary of State to be most appropriate at a local inquiry,  at a hearing or on the basis of representations in writing.

Label: Planning -  rights of entry to land
Description: A person authorised in writing by a local authority may enter land for certain purposes connected with the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Label: Planning -  information regarding interests in land
Description: A local authority may by notice in writing require the occupier of any premises and any person who, either directly or indirectly, receives rent in respect of any premises to give in writing such information as the authority requests.

Label: Planning -  information as to interests in Crown land
Description: A local authority must provide the Secretary of State with information regarding interests in Crown land for certain purposes connected with the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Label: Welsh language - preparation of scheme
Description: A local authority in Wales must prepare a scheme regarding its usage of the Welsh language and comply with any direction or guidance from the Board.

Label: Welsh language - submission of scheme
Description: A local authority in Wales must submit its scheme to the Board in the prescribed manner.

Label: Welsh language - consultation on preparation of scheme
Description: A local authority in Wales must consult regarding its proposed Welsh language scheme and comply with any directions from the Board.

Label: Welsh language - intervention in schemes
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with any intervention from the Secretary of State regarding Welsh language schemes.

Label: Welsh language - periodic revision of scheme
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with a notice received from the Board requiring it to revise its Welsh language scheme.

Label: Welsh language - amendment of scheme
Description: A local authority in Wales may amend its Welsh language scheme in certain circumstances.

Label: Welsh Language - directed amendment of scheme
Description: A local authority in Wales must amend its Welsh language scheme in certain circumstances.

Label: Welsh language - directions on scheme from Secretary of State
Description: A local authority in Wales must comply with any directions made by the Secretary of State with regard to its Welsh language scheme following an investigation.

Label: Dangerous wild animals - licensing
Description: A local authority shall not grant a licence for the keeping of a dangerous wild animal unless certain conditions are met.

Label: Dangerous wild animals - inspection of premises
Description: A competent person authorised by a local authority may inspect premises for the purposes of the Act and the local authority may recover certain costs connected with the inspection.

Label: Dangerous wild animals - seizure and disposal of animals without compensation
Description: A local authority may seize and dispose of dangerous wild animals without compensation and recover costs in certain circumstances.

Label: Highways - control of road-side sales
Description: A local authority may issue or revoke a control order prohibiting road-side sales.

Label: Heat and electricity production and supply
Description: A local authority may generate, buy or sell heat, electricity or both and acquire and or invest in land and equipment to enable them to do so and pass byelaws in respect of the same.

Label: Compulsory acquisition of rights over land
Description: A local authority may be authorised by the Crown to compulsorily purchase rights over land by means of a compulsory purchase order.

Label: Compulsory purchase - injurious affection
Description: A local authority must take certain steps after passing a resolution relating to land to which this section applies.

Label: Compulsory purchase - survey of land
Description: A person authorised in writing in that behalf by a local authority may at any reasonable time survey any land in connection with a proposal by the authority to acquire compulsorily an interest in the land or a right over the land which is not such an interest; and for the purpose of surveying any land in pursuance of the preceding paragraph, enter on the land and other land.

Label: Compulsory purchase - particulars of person with an interest in land
Description: A local authority may obtain the particulars of a person with an interest in land in connection with compulsory purchase.

Label: Bathing and boating - byelaws
Description: Where any part of the area of a local authority having power to make byelaws about public bathing and pleasure boats is bounded by or is to seaward of the low water mark, the authority may exercise that power as respects any area of the sea which is outside the area of the authority and within 1,000 metres to seaward of any place where that mark is within or on the boundary of the area of the authority.

Label: Provision of recreational facilities
Description: A local authority may provide, grant loans or charge for recreational facilities.

Label: Provision of sanitary appliances at places of entertainment
Description: A local authority may by notice require the owner or occupier of a place of entertainment to provide sanitary appliances.

Label: Dangerous trees
Description: A local authority may deal with dangerous trees.

Label: Dangerous excavations
Description: A local authority may deal with dangerous excavations.

Label: Compulsory purchase - repayment of unclaimed compensation
Description: A local authority may recover unclaimed compensation paid into court in respect of land clauses and compulsory purchase in certain circumstances.

Label: Advances of remuneration to deceased employees
Description: A local authority may forego the recovery of advances of remuneration paid to deceased employees in certain circumstances.

Label: Officers appointed as receivers or administrators  - indemnities
Description: A local authority may indemnify its officers in their role as receivers or administrators in certain circumstances.

Label: Execution of works outside of area
Description: A local authority may carry out works outside of its area unless the contrary intention appears in the authorising statute.

Label: Payments for restoration or continuation of supply of water, gas or electricity
Description: A local authority may come to arrangements to enable the continuity or restoration of utility supplies to any premises in its area.

Label: Removal of obstructions from private sewers
Description: A local authority may by notice require the removal of an obstruction from a private sewer and in certain circumstances may clear the obstruction itself and charge for the removal.

Label: Markets - appointment of times and charges
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances appoint times and charges for markets.

Label: Use of spare capacity of computers of local authorities
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances, enter into an agreement to allow others to share computer facilities and charge for the same.

Label: Hackney carriages - application of Part II
Description: A local authority may resolve that Part II of the Act in relation to hackney carriages and private hire vehicles shall apply to its area.

Label: Hackney carriages - licensing
Description: A local authority may attach conditions to the grant of a hackney carriage licence.

Label: Private hire vehicles - licensing
Description: Subject to the provisions of this legislation, a council may on the receipt of an application from the proprietor of any vehicle for the grant in respect of such vehicle of a licence to use the vehicle as a private hire vehicle, grant in respect thereof a vehicle licence and may attach conditions to the grant of any such licence.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - information, inspections and testing
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances, require information regarding and the inspection and testing of hackney carriages and private hire vehicles.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - licensing of drivers
Description: A local authority must only licence (subject to conditions or otherwise) the drivers of hackney carriages and private hire vehicles in certain circumstances.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - register of drivers
Description: A local authority must maintain a register of drivers of hackney carriages and private hire vehicles.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - licensing of operators
Description: A local authority must only licence (subject to conditions or otherwise) the operators of hackney carriages and private hire vehicles provided they are satisfied that the applicant is a fit and proper person to hold an operator's licence.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - information from licence applicants
Description: A local authority may require information from applicants for licences.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - return of plate or disc
Description: A local authority may require the return of an identification plate or disc upon expiry or revocation of a licence.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - suspension or revocation of vehicle licences
Description: A local authority may suspend or revoke a hackney carriage or private hire vehicle licence in certain circumstances.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - suspension or revocation of driver's licence
Description: A local authority may suspend or revoke a hackney carriage or private hire vehicle driver's licence in certain circumstances.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - suspension or revocation of operator's licence
Description: A local authority may suspend or revoke a hackney carriage or private hire vehicle operator's licence in certain circumstances.

Label: Hackney carriages - stands upon the highway
Description: A local authority may place stands for hackney carriages upon the highway.

Label: Hackney carriages - fixing of fares
Description: A local authority may fix the rates or fares of hackney carriages.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - inspection and testing
Description: An officer authorised by a  local authority may inspect and test hackney carriage or private hire vehicles.

Label: Hackney carriages and private hire vehicles - fees for vehicle or operator's licence
Description: A local authority may charge fees for the issue of a vehicle or operator's licence.

Label: Local land charges - register and index
Description: A local authority must keep a local land charges register and a local land charges register, and an index whereby all entries made in that register can readily be traced,

Label: Local land charges - registration
Description: A local authority must as respects a local land charge apply to the Chief Land Registrar for its registration in the local land charges register.

Label: Local land charges - general charge
Description: A local authority may register a general charge with the Chief Land Registrar against land in certain circumstances.

Label: Local land charges - personal search of register
Description: A local authority must allow a personal search of the register following payment of the prescribed fee.

Label: Local land charges - official search of register
Description: A local authority must allow an official search of the register following payment of the prescribed fee.

Label: Local land charges - compensation
Description: A local authority must pay compensation in certain cases of non-registration or defective official search

Label: Local land charges - specification of fees
Description: A local authority must specify and publish its fees relating to land charges and have regard to guidance when so doing.

Label: Local land charges - rules
Description: A local authority must comply with rules prescribed by the Lord Chancellor when carrying out its functions under the Act.

Label: Abandoned vehicles - fixed penalty notice
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may issue a fixed penalty notice to a person suspected of committing a vehicle abandonment offence.

Label: Abandoned vehicles - use of receipts from fixed penalty notices
Description: A local authority may utilise receipts from fixed penalty notices in accordance with regulations.

Label: Abandoned vehicles - removal
Description: Where it appears to a local authority that a motor vehicle in their area is abandoned without lawful authority on any land in the open air or on any other land forming part of a highway road, it shall be the duty of the authority, subject to provisions of this legislation, to remove the vehicle.

Label: Abandoned vehicles - disposal
Description: A local authority may dispose of an abandoned vehicle in its custody in accordance with the required procedure.

Label: Abandoned vehicles - recovery of expenses
Description: A local authority may recover certain expenses incurred in connection with the removal and disposal abandoned vehicles.

Label: Abandoned waste - removal
Description: A local authority may remove abandoned waste (other than a motor vehicle) in certain circumstances.

Label: Refuse disposal -  acquisition of land
Description: A local authority may acquire land for the purposes of refuse disposal in accordance with legislation.

Label: Refuse disposal -  powers of entry
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may enter land for certain purposes under the Act.

Label: Sports grounds - safety certificates
Description: A local authority must consider applications for safety certificates for qualifying sports grounds and comply with the prescribed procedure for so doing.

Label: Sports grounds - amendment or replacement of safety certificates
Description: A local authority may amend or replace a safety certificate in accordance with the prescribed procedure.

Label: Sports grounds - appeals against determinations on safety certificates
Description: A local authority must comply with the appeals procedure concerning safety certificates.

Label: Sports grounds - issue, amendment, transfer and cancellation of safety certificates
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the issue, amendment, transfer and cancellation of safety certificates.

Label: Sports grounds - prohibition notices
Description: A local authority may issue or withdraw a prohibition notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Sports grounds - inspection and enforcement
Description: A local authority must arrange for the periodical inspection of sports grounds.

Label: Sports grounds - entry and inspection
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may enter a sports ground for the purpose of inspection and take a copy of certain records.

Label: Animal boarding establishments - licensing
Description: A local authority may on application being made to them for that purpose and for payment of a fee licence an animal boarding establishment where the applicant meets prescribed requirements.  A licence may be issued with conditions.

Label: Animal boarding establishments - inspections
Description: An officers of an authority or any veterinary surgeon or veterinary practitioner duly authorised by a local authority may inspect an animal boarding establishment.

Label: Animal boarding establishments - prosecutions
Description: A local authority may prosecute proceedings for any breach of the Act committed in the area of the authority.

Label: Caravan sites - licensing
Description: A local authority may issue a licence for a caravan site in certain circumstances and in accordance with the prescribed procedure.

Label: Caravan sites - annual fee for licences
Description: A local authority may charge an annual fee for certain caravan sites.

Label: Caravan sites - alteration of conditions
Description: A local authority may alter conditions attaching to caravan site licences in certain circumstances and in accordance with the prescribed procedure.

Label: Caravan sites - revocation  of licence for breach of conditions
Description: A local authority may apply to the court for a caravan site licence to be revoked where the holder is convicted of breaching its conditions.

Label: Caravan sites - compliance notice for breach of licence conditions
Description: A local authority may issue, revoke or vary a compliance notice in relation to the breach of conditions of certain caravan site licences or apply to a court for revocation upon conviction for breach.

Label: Caravan sites - recovery of expenses for compliance notice
Description: A local authority may recover certain expenses associated with the issue of a compliance notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Caravan sites - carrying out of works
Description: A local authority may take steps to carry out works required by a compliance notice in certain circumstances following conviction of the occupier.

Label: Caravan sites - emergency action
Description: A local authority may take emergency action in respect of a licenced caravan site in certain circumstances.

Label: Caravan sites - expenses for works or emergency action
Description: A local authority may demand expenses in respect of action taken under sections 9D and 9E in respect of a licenced caravan site in certain circumstances.

Label: Caravan sites - transfer of licences
Description: A local authority may transfer a caravan site licence in certain circumstances.

Label: Caravan sites - fee policy for licences
Description: A local authority proposing to charge fees under the Act must prepare and publish a fee policy.

Label: Caravans - prohibition on rural common land
Description: The council of a district may make, with respect to any land in their area to which this section applies, an order prohibiting, either absolutely or except in such circumstances as may be specified in the order, the stationing of caravans on the land for the purposes of human habitation.

Label: Caravan sites - provision
Description: A local authority may acquire land and provide sites for caravans together with facilities and arrange for the same to be managed.

Label: Caravan sites - register of site licences
Description: A local authority must compile, keep and make available a register of caravan site licences for their area.

Label: Caravan sites - powers of entry
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may enter a caravan site for certain purposes in certain circumstances.

Label: Public performance licence - person under 16
Description: A local authority may issue a public performance licence to a person aged under 16 in certain circumstances.

Label: Public performance licence person under 14
Description: A local authority may issue a public performance licence to a person aged under 14 in certain circumstances.

Label: Public performance licence - variation or revocation for person under 16
Description: A local authority may vary or revoke a performance licence issued to a person aged under 16 in certain circumstances.

Label: Public performance training licence for person 12 to 16 - issue, variation or revocation
Description: A local authority may issue, vary or revoke a performance training licence for performances of a dangerous nature for persons aged 12 to 16 in certain circumstances.

Label: Children and young persons performing abroad - licensing
Description: A local authority may grant a licence to enable children to perform abroad in certain circumstances.

Label: Children and young people - investigate and report of criminal proceedings
Description: A local authority must when bringing or notified of criminal proceedings brought against a young person, in certain circumstances, investigate and provide the court with certain information.

Label: Children and young people - bail report
Description: A local authority must when ordered to do so by a court provide a report in relation to certain young persons remanded on bail.

Label: Children and young people - transfer of care under youth rehabilitation order
Description: A local authority must comply with an authorisation to receive transferred children into care.

Label: Children and young people - community homes for young offenders
Description: A local authority must comply with a direction relating to the detention of a young offender in a community home or detain such young people in certain circumstances.

Label: Commons registration - town and village greens
Description: A local authority shall maintain a register of town and village greens and the ownership of rights over them.

Label: Country parks - provision
Description: A local authority may provide, maintain and manage a country park, acquire land to enable it to do so and issue byelaws regarding its use.

Label: Common land -  public access
Description: A local authority may act in the interests of those wishing to access common land for open air recreation including the erection of buildings and the acquisition of land.

Label: Countryside - camping and picnic sites
Description: A local authority may provide camping and picnic sites and may acquire land in order to do so.

Label: Countryside -natural beauty and amenity
Description: A local authority must have regard to the desirability of conserving the natural beauty and amenity of the countryside when exercising its functions as to land.

Label: Countryside - national parks facilities
Description: A local authority may provide various facilities for national parks in its area.

Label: Countryside - control of boats in national parks
Description: A local authority may make byelaws to control the use of boats on lakes in a national park in its area.

Label: Countryside - access to open country, rivers, canals and woodlands
Description: A local authority may exercise powers under Part V of the National Parks and Countryside Act 1949 in relation to certain strips of land bordering rivers, canals and woodlands.

Label: Countryside - access agreement terms
Description: A local authority may impose terms into access agreements to prevent land becoming excepted land.

Label: Countryside - display of maps and notices
Description: A local planning authority shall have power, as respects any land in their area which is subject to an access agreement or order, to defray or contribute towards, or to undertake to defray or contribute towards, expenditure incurred or to be incurred in relation to the land by any person interested therein in displaying, at places where the public obtain access to any such land any reproduction of the relevant map prepared by the local planning authority under section 78 of the Act of 1949, or any notice specifying restrictions on access to the land or any part thereof.

Label: Rights of way - signposting of footpaths and bridleways
Description: A local authority may erect a signpost on a footpath, bridleway or restricted byway in certain circumstances

Label: Countryside - economic and social interests
Description: A local authority must have regard to agriculture, forestry and the economic and social interests of the countryside when exercising functions under various pieces of legislation.

Label: Countryside and country parks - byelaws
Description: A local authority may make byelaws in relation to country parks and other land as specified in regulations.

Label: Countryside - national park wardens
Description: A local planning authority whose area consists of or includes the whole or any part of a National Park may appoint such number of persons as may appear to the authority to be necessary or expedient to act as wardens as respects any land within the National Park subject to certain conditions.

Label: Countryside - provision of and charging for facilities
Description: A local authority may provide facilities in connection with the exercise of its powers under the Act and may charge for so doing.

Label: Countryside - non-discrimination for use of facilities
Description: A local authority must not discriminate against people from outside its area in relation to the exercise of its powers under the Act.

Label: Welfare of old people - promotion
Description: A local authority may to the extent approved by the Secretary of State and as directed make provision for the promotion of the welfare of old people.

Label: Health and care workers - training
Description: A local authority must ensure that certain health and care workers comply with training prescribed by the Secretary of State.

Label: Health and care - financial assistance to voluntary organisations
Description: A local authority may give financial assistance to certain voluntary organisations in respect of certain health and care activities.

Label: Development of land
Description: A local authority may for the benefit of its area develop land including powers to construct, repair and maintain.

Label: Advances for development of land
Description: A local authority may for the benefit of its area advance money to any person for the acquisition of land or the erection of a building

Label: Advances for building agreements
Description: A local authority may for the benefit of its area advance money in pursuance of a building agreement.

Label: Provision of garage accommodation
Description: A local authority may provide, maintain and repair garage facilities.

Label: Local government -  payment of officer expenses
Description: A local authority may pay its officers' expenses.

Label: Local government -  promotion of adequate use of records
Description: A local authority may take steps to make adequate use of its records by promoting the same in various ways.

Label: Local government -  acquisition and deposit of records
Description: A local authority may acquire and deposit records.

Label: Disused tips - information
Description: A local authority may require information necessary to assess the stability of a disused tip and whether it presents a danger to public safety.

Label: Disused tips - right to enter land etc.
Description: A person duly authorised by a local authority may enter land to perform inspections and investigations and to carry out exploratory tests.

Label: Disused tips - direction for remedial operations
Description: A local authority may by notice in the prescribed form require the owner of a disused tip to carry out remedial operations or cancel such a notice.

Label: Disused tips - remedial operations and works of reinstatement
Description: A local authority may carry out remedial operations and works of reinstatement in certain circumstances and may sell materials in certain circumstances.

Label: Disused tips - right of entry for remedial operations and reinstatement
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances, enter land to carry out remedial operations and works of reinstatement.

Label: Disused tips - contribution notice for remedial operations
Description: A local authority may, in certain circumstances, apply to the court for a contribution order in respect of the expense involved in remedial operations and works of reinstatement.

Label: Disused tips - compensation for damage and disturbance during remedial operations
Description: A local authority must pay compensation for damage and disturbance arising from remedial operations and works of reinstatement in certain circumstances.

Label: Disused tips - recovery of expenses for remedial works
Description: A local authority may recover its expenses connected to remedial works in certain circumstances.

Label: Disused tips - grants towards expenditure for remedial works
Description: A local authority must comply with the conditions of any grants made by the Secretary of State

Label: Disused tips - criminal proceedings in relation to remedial works
Description: A local authority may bring criminal proceedings for offences under Part II of the Act.

Label: Plant health - removal or destruction of crop, seed or plant
Description: A local authority must comply with certain directions and pay compensation in certain circumstances in respect of any crop, or any seed, plant or part thereof, which is removed or destroyed in pursuance of any order.

Label: Plant health - publication of orders
Description: A local authority must publish certain orders when required to do so.

Label: Public health - repair of drains, private sewers and waste pipes
Description: A local authority may repair or cleanse drains, private sewers and waste pipes in certain circumstances and may recover certain expenses.

Label: Public health - removal of accumulations of rubbish
Description: A local authority may, in accordance with the prescribed procedure remove accumulations of rubbish.

Label: Public health - vacation of building for fumigation
Description: A local authority may, in accordance with the prescribed procedure, require the vacation of a building for the purposes of fumigation and may recover certain expenses.

Label: Public health - prohibition of sale of verminous articles
Description: A local authority may, in accordance with the prescribed procedure, require the removal of and destroy verminous household articles prepared or offered for sale and may recover certain expenses

Label: Street lighting -  affixing to buildings
Description: A local authority may, with the agreement of a building's owner, affix street lighting to buildings.

Label: Parks and pleasure grounds - management
Description: A local authority may, exercise certain powers regarding the management of parks and pleasure grounds.

Label: Parks and pleasure grounds - closing
Description: A local authority may close parks and pleasure grounds at certain times.

Label: Parks and pleasure grounds - boating pools and lakes
Description: A local authority may exercise certain powers relating to the provision and management of boating pools and lakes.

Label: Public health - inspection of derelict petrol tanks
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may inspect derelict petrol tanks to ensure their compliance with the Act.

Label: Public health - reduction of pigeons and other birds
Description: A local authority may take any steps for the purpose of abating or mitigating any nuisance, annoyance or damage caused by the congregation in any built-up area of house doves or pigeons or of starlings or sparrows.

Label: Public health - byelaws concerning pleasure fairs and roller skating
Description: A local authority may pass bye laws to regulate pleasure fairs and roller skating to ensure public safety.

Label: Public health - regulation of seaside pleasure boats
Description: For the prevention of danger, obstruction or annoyance to persons bathing in the sea or using the seashore, a local authority may make byelaws regulating the speed of pleasure boats, regulating the use of pleasure boats so as to prevent their navigation in a dangerous manner or without due care and attention or without reasonable consideration for other persons and requiring the use of effectual silencers on pleasure boats propelled by internal combustion engines.

Label: Public health - regulation of hairdressers and barbers
Description: A local authority may make byelaws for the purpose of securing the cleanliness of premises on which a hairdresser's or barber's business is carried on and of the instruments, towels, materials and equipment used therein, and the cleanliness of the hairdressers or barbers working in such premises in regard to both themselves and their clothing.

Label: Public health - enforcement of byelaws for hairdressers and barbers
Description: A local authority must enforce byelaws made under section 77 to regulate hairdressers and barbers.

Label: Street furniture - civil debt for recovery of damage
Description: A local authority may recover damage caused by negligence to certain items of street furniture as a civil debt.

Label: Public lavatories - abolition of turnstiles
Description: A local authority must ensure that there are no turnstiles at public lavatories controlled or managed by a local authority.

Label: Libraries - co-operation with the Secretary of State
Description: A local authority shall furnish such information, and provide such facilities for the inspection of library premises, stocks and records, as the Secretary of State may require for carrying out his duty.

Label: Libraries - formation of joint boards
Description: Two or more local authorities may form joint boards with the consent of the Secretary of State.

Label: Libraries - library service
Description: A local authority must provide a comprehensive and efficient library service for all persons desiring to make use thereof.

Label: Libraries - restriction on charges for library facilities
Description: A local authority may not charge for library services save as allowed for by section 8 or by regulations.

Label: Libraries - contributions towards expenses
Description: A local authority may make contributions towards the expenses of another library authority.

Label: Libraries - default powers of Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must comply with the directions of the Secretary of State when he is exercising his default powers where a library authority has failed to carry out duties relating to the public library service.

Label: Libraries - transfer of staff, assets and liabilities
Description: A local authority must take certain steps where staff, assets and liabilities transfer under the Act.

Label: Museums and galleries - provision and maintenance
Description: A local authority may provide and maintain museums and galleries in its area.

Label: Museums and galleries - admission charges
Description: A local authority may charge for entry to museums and galleries in certain circumstances.

Label: Museums and galleries - contribution towards expenses
Description: A local authority may make contributions towards the expenses of running museums or galleries or provide advisory or other services there.

Label: Museums and galleries - fund for purchase of exhibits
Description: A local authority may establish a fund for the purchase of exhibits for its museums and galleries.

Label: Riding establishments - licensing
Description: A local authority may in certain circumstances and for payment of a fee licence a riding establishment.

Label: Riding establishments - inspections
Description: A local authority may, subject to the provisions of this section, authorise in writing any such person as the following, namely, an officer of theirs, an officer of any other local authority, a veterinary surgeon and a veterinary practitioner, to inspect a riding establishment.

Label: Riding establishments - prosecutions
Description: A local authority may prosecute proceedings for breach of the Riding Establishments Act 1964.

Label: Slaughter of poultry -  licensing
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations regarding the licensing of poultry facilities.

Label: Slaughter of poultry - power of entry
Description: An officer authorised by the local authority may enter premises to ensure compliance with the Act.

Label: Slaughter of poultry - execution and enforcement
Description: A local authority shall enforce the Act and regulations made under the Act.

Label: Trading standards - enforcing authorities
Description: A local authority must enforce the Act and orders made thereunder utilising powers in Schedule 5 to the Consumer Rights Act 2015 and deliver reports to the Board of Trade.

Label: Trading standards - test purchases
Description: A local authority may make test purchases for the purposes of the enforcement of the Act.

Label: Trading standards - entry to premises and seizure of goods and documents
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority may enter premises and seize goods and documents for certain purposes connected with the enforcement of the Act.

Label: Trading standards - notification of test results
Description: An officer authorised by a local authority must notify the owner of goods of the results of certain tests.

Label: Trading standards - compensation for goods seized
Description: A local authority must pay compensation for certain goods seized in certain circumstances.

Label: Public transport facilities - capital expenditure
Description: A local authority may make payments towards capital expenditure for public transport facilities in certain circumstances

Label: Waterways - assistance for maintenance for amenity purposes
Description: A local authority may assist any other person (whether financially, by the provision of services or facilities, or otherwise) in maintaining or improving waterways for amenity or recreational purposes, including fishing.

Label: Bridges over railways and inland waterways
Description: A local authority has responsibility for certain bridges over waterways and railways.

Label: Barriers at level crossings - financial contributions
Description: A local authority may contribute to the expenses incurred for providing lifting or other barriers, lights, signs, or other devices or appliances for the protection or convenience of the public at or near any level crossing where a road is crossed by a railway.

Label: Travel concessions - financial contributions
Description: A local authority may contribute to the cost of travel concessions incurred by a another authority.

Label: Animal feed -  collection of kitchen waste
Description: A local authority may collect kitchen waste or similar waste for use as animal feed and may make byelaws in respect of the same.

Label: Allotments - rent
Description: A local authority may charge rent for land let as allotments pursuant to the 1908 Allotments Act.

Label: Restaurants - establishment
Description: A local authority may establish and carry on restaurants and otherwise provide for the supply to the public of meals and refreshments, and may carry on such activities as are reasonably incidental or ancillary to the activities aforesaid.

Label: Coastal protection -  erosion work
Description: A local authority may carry out coastal protection erosion work in certain circumstances and having taken certain prescribed steps.

Label: Coastal protection -  preparation of schemes of works
Description: A local authority must prepare schemes of work to carry out certain works providing for coast protection in certain circumstances which must be approved by the appropriate authority.   The authority must take account of legislation when completing the scheme of works.

Label: Coastal protection -  implementation of schemes of works
Description: Where a works scheme prepared by an authority is confirmed by the Minister the authority shall have power to take all necessary steps for carrying out the work provided for by the scheme subject to any provisions in regulations.

Label: Coastal protection -  charges
Description: A local authority may levy and recover charges for coastal protection work in certain circumstances.

Label: Coastal protection -  compulsory acquisition of land
Description: A local authority may compulsorily acquire land if authorised by the appropriate national authority to do so.

Label: Coastal protection -  unauthorised works
Description: A local authority may by notice demand the removal or re-instatement of unauthorised  coast protectionworks, carry out that work themselves in certain circumstances and prosecute an offence.

Label: Coastal protection -  prohibition of excavation on or under the seashore
Description: A local authority may make an order (which they must enforce) prohibiting the excavation of materials on or under the seashore in certain areas and may issue licences allowing such works in such areas.

Label: Coastal protection -  compensation for depreciation in value of land
Description: A local authority must pay compensation in certain circumstances where the value of a person's interest in land has depreciated or that any person has suffered damage by being disturbed in his enjoyment of land, in consequence of the carrying out of coast protection work by the authority.

Label: Coastal protection -  incidental purposes land
Description: A local authority may treat land acquired for the purposes of coastal protection.as incidental purposes land under the Local Government Act 1972

Label: Coastal protection -  sale of severed materials
Description: A local authority may sell unclaimed materials which they have severed from the land as part of coastal protection work.

Label: Coastal protection -  powers of entry and inspection
Description: A person duly authorised by a local authority may enter land for certain purposes connected with coastal protection.

Label: Coastal protection -  information on ownership of land
Description: A local authority may require information regarding ownership of land for purposes connected with coastal protection.

Label: Coastal protection -  right of passage
Description: A local authority may require the right of passage over land by agreement or by compulsion for the purposes of coastal protection work.

Label: Coastal protection -  application to Minister for authority to do work
Description: A local authority may apply to the Minister to facilitate coastal protection work.

Label: Coastal protection -  default powers of Minister
Description: A local authority must comply with an order form the Minister utilising his default powers where they have failed to take sufficient measures for the protection of any land in their area.

Label: Disabled persons - sheltered employment
Description: A local authority may provide employment and training opportunities designed to meet the needs of registered disabled person.

Label: Allotments - lettings
Description: A local authority may continue to let certain land as allotments.

Label: Hypnotism - licensing
Description: A local authority may issue a licence, with conditions, for the exhibition, demonstration or performance of hypnotism.

Label: Hypnotism - licence fee
Description: A local authority may charge a fee for a licence for demonstrations of hypnotism.

Label: Transport -  provision and maintenance of bus shelters
Description: A local authority may provide and maintain bus shelters in their area subject to them obtaining required consents.

Label: Transport -  compensation for temporary removal of bus shelter
Description: A local authority must when requested to do so by a street works undertaker temporarily remove a bus shelter maintained by them or pay compensation.

Label: Transport -  maintenance of existing bus shelters and queue barriers
Description: A local authority may maintain existing bus shelters or queue barriers.

Label: Waste collection -  charges for provision of dustbins
Description: A local authority may make an annual charge for the provision, maintenance, repair or renewal of dustbins in certain circumstances.

Label: Local government -  financial assistance to district and parish councils
Description: A county council may provide financial assistance towards expenditure to a district or parish council in its area.

Label: Welfare - provision of accommodation
Description: A local authority must provide accommodation with the approval of the Secretary of State and to the extent directed by him and must take into account the welfare of persons for whom the accommodation is provided.

Label: Welfare - charges for provision of accommodation
Description: A local authority must recover charges for accommodation provided in certain circumstances

Label: Welfare - management of premises in which accommodation provided
Description: A local authority may make rules as to the conduct of premises under their management in which accommodation is provided and as to the preservation of order in the premises.

Label: Welfare - provision of accommodation for person with no settled residence
Description: A local authority may provide accommodation to a person of no settled residence as if he were ordinarily resident in their area.

Label: Welfare - arrangements for persons with a disability
Description: A local authority may with the approval of the Secretary of State and to the extent directed by him make welfare arrangements for persons with a disability.

Label: Welfare - research
Description: A local authority may carry out or promote and assist research into local authority powers and duties related to welfare services under the Act.

Label: Welfare - recovery of expenditure from another authority
Description: A local authority may recover expenditure under the Act from another local authority in certain circumstances.

Label: Welfare - recovery in cases of misrepresentation or non-disclosure
Description: A local authority may recover sums spent under the Act in cases of misrepresentation or non-disclosure.

Label: Welfare - removal of persons needing care and attention
Description: A local authority in Wales may remove persons in need of care and attention to certain premises in certain circumstances.

Label: Persons in hospital -  temporary protection of property
Description: A local authority must provide for the temporary protection of property of certain persons admitted to hospital in certain circumstances.

Label: Welfare - expenses of officer applying to Court of Protection as a deputy
Description: A local authority may defray the expenses of any of its officer's applying to the Court of Protection as a Deputy, under the Act, that are not recoverable elsewhere.

Label: Welfare - recovery of money through criminal proceedings or civil debt actions
Description: A local authority may institute certain criminal proceedings or civil debt actions to recover money.

Label: National Parks - regard to purposes when exercising functions
Description: A local authority must In exercising or performing any functions in relation to land in a National Park, have regard to the purposes specified in subsection 5(1) the Act and, if it appears that there is a conflict between those purposes, shall attach greater weight to the purpose of conserving and enhancing the natural beauty, wildlife and cultural heritage of the area comprised in the National Park

Label: National Parks - provision of facilities
Description: A local authority whose area consists of or includes the whole or any part of a National Park may make arrangements for securing the provision of accommodation, meals and refreshments, camping sites and of parking places.

Label: National Parks - improvements to waterways
Description: A local authority whose area consists of or includes the whole or any part of a National Park may make improvements to waterways for the purposes of recreation.

Label: Nature reserves - establishment
Description: A local authority may establish nature reserves and enter into certain agreements relating to the same.

Label: Long-distance routes - ferry services
Description: A local authority may establish a ferry service to connect a long distance route where it crosses water.

Label: Long distance routes - provision of facilities
Description: A local authority whose area includes a long distance route may provide facilities for accommodation, meals and refreshments.

Label: Countryside - access agreements
Description: A local authority may enter into an access agreement to allow public access to the open countryside.

Label: Countryside - access orders
Description: A local authority may make access orders in certain circumstances in accordance with the prescribed procedure.

Label: Countryside - enforcement of access
Description: A local authority may enforce access to the countryside in certain circumstances.

Label: Countryside - suspension of access due to fire risk
Description: A local authority may suspend access to the countryside where they are satisfied that, by reason of any exceptional conditions of weather for the time being prevailing, access by the public to the land or any part of it is likely to result in fires occurring on it.

Label: Countryside - compensation for access orders
Description: A local authority must pay compensation where it makes an access order in certain circumstances.

Label: Countryside - acquisition of land for public access
Description: A local authority may acquire land for public access.

Label: Countryside - maps of land subject to public access
Description: A local authority must compile and maintain maps of land subject to public access.

Label: Derelict land -  Planting of trees and treatment
Description: A local authority may carry out works to improve land including derelict land including the planting of trees and may compulsorily acquire derelict land for that purpose.

Label: Countryside - byelaws for National Parks, AONB or access land
Description: A local authority may make byelaws in relation to national parks, areas of outstanding natural beauty or land or a waterway to which the public are given access by an agreement or order in their area.

Label: Countryside - wardens in National Parks, AONB or access land
Description: A local authority may appoint wardens in respect of any land for which byelaws have been made or could be made under section 90.

Label: Countryside - contribution to towards expenses of other local authorities
Description: A local authority may make contributions towards expenditure incurred by any other local authority under the National Parks and Access to the Countryside Act 1949.

Label: Pet shops - licensing
Description: A local authority may licence a pet shop, subject to conditions on payment of a fee.

Label: Pet shops - inspection
Description: An officer or any veterinary surgeon or veterinary practitioner duly authorised by a local authority may enter a pet shop for the purposes of inspection.

Label: Pet shops - prosecutions
Description: A local authority may prosecute proceedings for any offence under the Act committed in the area of the authority.

Label: Pest control -  rats and mice
Description: A local authority must carry out inspections and take action to ensure that its area is kept free (as far as practicable) of rats and mice and to take action to ensure owners of other land comply with the Act.

Label: Pest control -  notice requiring destruction of rats and mice
Description: A local authority may serve notice upon the occupier of land requiring the destruction of rats and mice on the land or otherwise for keeping the land free from rats and mice.

Label: Pest control -  power to carry out works to remove rats and mice
Description: A local authority where a notice has been served under section 4 and not complied with, may carry out those works itself and recover certain expenses.

Label: Pest control -  works on multiple premises to control rats and mice
Description: A local authority may where there is an infestation of rats and mice in an area made up of several premises, enter land, carry out the work and recover certain expenses from the owners.

Label: Pest control -  compliance with Ministerial order
Description: A local authority must comply with an order made by the appropriate Minister utilising his default powers where he is satisfied that functions are not being satisfactorily performed by the authority.

Label: Pest control -  powers of entry for inspection related to functions dealing with rats and mice
Description: A person duly authorised by a local authority may enter land for the purpose of the authority's functions under the Act.

Label: Pest control -  legal proceedings for offences regarding rats and mice
Description: A local authority may institute legal proceedings or give consent for them being instituted.

Label: Registrars - appointment of officers
Description: A local authority must employ (interim) superintendent registrars and registrars of births and deaths.

Label: Registrars - appointment of deputy
Description: A local authority may employ a deputy superintendent registrars or deputy registrar of births and deaths.

Label: Registration service - district register offices
Description: A local authority shall provide and maintain for the superintendent registrar of each district a register office according to a plan approved by the Registrar General, and shall provide a suitable fireproof repository for the safe custody of the records.

Label: Registration service - local schemes of organisation
Description: A local authority shall prepare, submit and have approved a local scheme of organisation, complying with prescribed requirements, for the registration service.

Label: Planning -  acquisition of land by agreement
Description: A local authority may acquire land by agreement in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  appropriation of land
Description: A local authority may appropriate land in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning -  disposal of land
Description: A local authority must take certain steps before disposing of land.

Label: Town development -  conditions of payment of Exchequer contributions
Description: A local authority must comply with conditions attached to any exchequer contributions towards the cost of town development.

Label: Town development -  contributions to receiving district
Description: A local authority which will benefit from town development in another district may make financial contributions to that district.

Label: Town development -  extension of powers of receiving district
Description: A local authority which will benefit from town development may take certain actions that relate to another district.

Label: Town development -  Ministerial approval for acquisition of land
Description: A local authority may, with ministerial approval, acquire land compulsorily for the purposes of the Act.

Label: Town development -  participation by agreement
Description: A local authority may enter into a participation agreement for the purposes of the Act.

Label: Town development -  re-transfers of land
Description: A local authority must comply with any order made by the Minister regarding re-transfers of land or other adjustments.

Label: Town development -  contributions to expenses of land drainage works
Description: The council of a receiving district or an authority eligible to participate may contribute towards expenses incurred by the National Rivers Authority or by an internal drainage board in the execution of works rendered necessary by the carrying out of development which, in the opinion of the authority making the contribution, is town development within the meaning of this Act.

Label: Town development -  appropriation of land for planning purposes
Description: A local authority may appropriate land, if authorised to do so by the Minister for the purposes of town development.

Label: Injurious weeds - exercise of Minister's powers
Description: A local authority must exercise the Minister's powers under the Act if authorised to do so.

Label: Agricultural products - enforcement of grading and marketing regulations
Description: A local authority must enforce the provisions of the Act.

Label: Allotments - determination of tenancy
Description: A local authority must follow a prescribed procedure in order to terminate an allotment tenancy

Label: Allotments - compensation for termination of tenancy
Description: A local authority must pay compensation, in certain circumstances, to the tenant when terminating an allotment tenancy.

Label: Allotments - entry on to unoccupied land
Description: A local authority may enter on to unoccupied land in certain circumstances to utilise the same for allotments.

Label: Allotments - letting of land
Description: A county council may let land acquired or appropriated by the council for small holdings for cultivation as an allotment, or to a local authority or association

Label: Allotments - purchase of land
Description: A local authority may purchase land for use in future allotments with the approval of the Minister of Health.

Label: Allotments - sale of Land
Description: A local authority wishing to sell land bought or appropriated for use as allotments may not do so without obtaining the consent of the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries to the sale.

Label: Employment of children -  byelaws
Description: A local authority may make byelaws to regulate the employment of children.

Label: Employment of children in sreet trading -  byelaws
Description: A local authority may make byelaws to regulate the employment of children in street trading.

Label: Child performances of a dangerous nature - licensing
Description: A local authority may issue a licence to enable a child to take part in a performance of a dangerous nature.

Label: Child employment - Secretary of State's expenses for enquiries
Description: A local authority must pay the Secretary of State's expenses in relation to any enquiry held concerning byelaws.

Label: Child employment -  powers of entry
Description: A duly authorised officer of a local authority may enter premises in relation to the involvement of children in certain employments or performances.

Label: Burial and cremation -  provision of crematoria
Description: A local authority may provide and maintain burial grounds or cemeteries, or anything essential, ancillary or incidental thereto and may provide and maintain crematoria.

Label: Burial and cremation -  donations of land, money or property for crematoria
Description: A local authority may accept donations of land, money or property to enable them to provide and maintain crematoria.

Label: Burial and cremation -  crematoria regulations
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations concerning crematoria and burning.

Label: Burial and cremation -  crematoria fees
Description: A local authority may charge fees for cremations.

Label: Local government - payments to dependants under superannuation schemes
Description: A local authority may make payments from its superannuation fund to the dependants of employees killed in or as a result of military service.

Label: Open spaces - transfer to local authority
Description: A local authority may accept that certain open spaces may be transferred into its possession.

Label: Disused burial grounds - transfer to local authority
Description: A local authority may accept that certain disused burial grounds be transferred into its possession.

Label: Open spaces - appropriation for enjoyment of the public
Description: A local authority may use its land for the purposes of open spaces.

Label: Open spaces and burial grounds - acquisition of land
Description: A local authority may acquire, manage and maintain land for the purposes of open spaces or burial grounds.

Label: Open spaces and burial grounds - compensation
Description: A local authority must pay compensation in certain circumstances in relation to open spaces and burial grounds

Label: Open spaces - public walks and pleasure grounds
Description: A local authority may acquire, lay out and maintain land to be used as public walks and pleasure grounds.

Label: Open spaces and burial grounds - byelaws
Description: A local authority may make byelaws to govern the use of the open spaces and burial grounds that it has acquired.

Label: Open spaces and burial grounds - authorities acting jointly
Description: Two or more local authorities may act jointly in exercising their powers under the Act and may defray each other expenses.

Label: Open spaces and burial grounds - borrowing.
Description: A local authority may borrow for the purposes of the Act.

Label: Performing animals - register
Description: A local authority must keep a register (which must be available for inspection) for the purpose of this Act containing the details of any person who exhibits or trains animals who applies for registration in the prescribed form and on payment of such fee as appears to the local authority to be appropriate and give to the applicant a certificate of registration.

Label: Performing animals - powers of entry
Description: An officer duly authorised by a local authority may enter premises to inspect the animals kept there and to inspect the occupant's certificate

Label: Performing animals - enforcement
Description: A local authority may prosecute proceedings where any person commits an offence under the Act.

Label: Street collections - regulations
Description: A local authority may make regulations, subject to the approval of the relevant Minister, governing street collections of money for charitable or other purposes.

Label: Public health - byelaws
Description: A local authority may pass byelaws under the Act.

Label: Street names - alteration
Description: A local authority may with the consent of two thirds of the relevant council tax payers change a street name and mark the same.

Label: Public health - fencing of land adjoining streets
Description: A local authority may in certain circumstances issue a notice requiring an owner of land adjoining streets to fence off that land and if that work is not done, carry it out itself and recover the cost as a civil debt.

Label: Parks and gardens - additional facilities
Description: A local authority may provide ice skating, infant play, sports, and recreational facilities and cafes in parks and gardens.

Label: Parks and gardens - wardens
Description: A local authority may appoint officers to serve as wardens for parks and gardens.

Label: Leading and driving of animals - streets and routes
Description: A local authority may prescribe routes over which the leading and driving of animals is permitted in certain circumstances.

Label: Seashore and promenades - byelaws
Description: A local authority for the prevention of danger, obstruction, or annoyance to persons using the sea-shore may make byelaws covering various aspects of usage and recreation at the seashore and promenades.

Label: Pleasure boats - licensing
Description: A local authority may grant, amend or revoke licences for pleasure boats.

Label: Public health - seats, drinking fountains and cattle troughs
Description: A local authority may erect or allow others to erect, subject to conditions, seats, drinking fountains or cattle troughs

Label: Street names - objection
Description: A local authority may object to a proposed street name in accordance with the prescribed procedure.

Label: Street names - naming or alteration
Description: A local authority may name or alter the name of a street in accordance with the prescribed procedure.

Label: Street names - placement of street nameplates
Description: A local authority must mark or place the name of a street on the street.

Label: Communications/TV equipment -  byelaws
Description: A local authority may make byelaws about communications or TV equipment  for the prevention of danger or obstruction to persons using any street or public place.

Label: Parks and recreation grounds - charges for sports
Description: Where part of a park or recreation ground is set aside for sport a local authority may charge for use of the same.

Label: Public transport -  byelaws and street furniture for waiting
Description: A local authority may pass byelaws to regulate waiting for public vehicles and erect street furniture in support of those byelaws.

Label: Public health -  joint boards
Description: Certain local authorities may set up joint boards in certain circumstances.

Label: Public health -  defective lavatories in buildings
Description: A local authority may issue a notice requiring the repair of a defective closet (lavatory).

Label: Public health -  examination and testing of drains
Description: A local authority may examine and test any sanitary convenience, drain, private sewer or cesspool believed to be defective.

Label: Public health -  overflowing and leaking cesspools
Description: A local authority may by notice require the repair of or other works to an overflowing or leaking cesspool.

Label: Public health -  cleaning of common courts and passages
Description: A local authority may sweep, clean and remove rubbish from common courts and passages and recover the expense of doing the same.

Label: Public health -  removal of noxious matter
Description: A local authority may serve a notice to require an occupier to remove certain noxious matter in certain circumstances, remove the noxious substance itself and recover expenses.

Label: Public health -  removal of manure from a stables or mews
Description: A local authority may serve a notice to requiring the removal of manure from stables or mews in an urban district in certain circumstances.

Label: Public health -  cleansing of premises
Description: A local authority may issue a notice requiring the cleansing of filthy or verminous premises and if that notice is not complied with it may carry out the work itself and recover the expenses involved in doing so.

Label: Public health -  byelaws for the prevention of nuisances
Description: A local authority may make byelaws  to prevent the occurrence of nuisances from snow, filth, dust, ashes and rubbish,  the keeping of animals so as to be prejudicial to health and the movement through streets of offensive matter or liquids.

Label: Public health -  filthy or verminous articles
Description: A local authority may remove filthy or verminous articles from premises and cleanse or destroy them in certain circumstances.

Label: Public health -  verminous persons
Description: A local authority may on request or with consent cleanse a verminous individual or his or her clothing.

Label: Public health -  cleansing stations
Description: A local authority may provide cleansing stations to enable it to discharge its functions under the Act.

Label: Public health -  public conveniences
Description: A local authority may provide public conveniences in certain circumstances, may make byelaws charges for the same or let them out for rent

Label: Public health -  nuisances
Description: A local authority may take action against certain nuisances arising outside its district.

Label: Public health -  public pumps, wells, cisterns, reservoirs, conduits
Description: A local authority may utilise or close public pumps, wells, cisterns, reservoirs and conduits used for the free supply of water.

Label: Public health -  polluted water supplies
Description: A local authority may close or restrict use from certain polluted water supplies.

Label: Public health -  discretionary mortuaries and post-mortem rooms.
Description: A local authority may provide mortuaries and post-mortem rooms, may make byelaws and charge for the use of the same

Label: Public health -  directed mortuaries and post-mortem rooms
Description: A local authority must provide mortuaries and post-mortem rooms if required to do so by the Minister and may make byelaws and charge for the use of the same.

Label: Public health -  public baths and wash-houses
Description: A local authority may provide public baths and wash houses, may issue byelaws in respect of the same and make charges for use.

Label: Public health -  temporary closure of public baths
Description: A local authority may temporarily close a public bath to allow its use for swimming competitions and may make charges for that use.

Label: Public health -  closure of public baths during winter months
