Description: Local authority inspectors may weigh and measure goods, require the production of documents and weigh vehicles in certain circumstances.

Label: Weights and measures - annual report
Description: A local authority acting as a local weights and measures authority must provide an annual report to the Secretary of State for every financial year.

Label: Weights and measures - appointment of chief inspectors and inspectors
Description: A local authority must appoint a Chief Inspector and Inspectors.

Label: Weights and measures - fees for work resulting from EU obligation
Description:
A local weights and measures authority may charge such reasonable fees as they may determine—
for services or facilities provided by them, or by the inspectors appointed for their area, in pursuance of a EU obligation, and 
for authorisations, certificates or other documents issued by the authority or any such inspector in pursuance of a EU 1 obligation.

Label: Weights and measures - investigatory powers
Description: The investigatory powers available to a local weights and measures authority for the purposes of the enforcement of this Act, are set out in Schedule 5 to the Consumer Rights Act 2015.

Label: Weights and measures - prosecutions
Description: A local weights and measures authority may prosecute offences under the Act.

Label: Airports - direction to form a company
Description:
The Secretary of State may give to any principal council who control (whether alone or jointly with one or more other principal councils) an airport to which this section applies in accordance with section 14, a direction requiring the council to form a company for the purpose of carrying on—

(a) the business of operating the airport as a commercial undertaking; and
(b) any activities which appear to the council to be incidental to or connected with carrying on that business.

Label: Disabled persons - taking into account ability of carer
Description:
Where a disabled person is living at home and receiving a substantial amount of care on a regular basis from another person (who is not a person employed to provide such care by any body in the exercise of its functions under any enactment), and
 it falls to a local authority in Wales or Scotland to decide whether the disabled person's needs call for the provision by them of any services for him under any of the welfare enactments, 

the local authority shall, in deciding that question, have regard to the ability of that other person to continue to provide such care on a regular basis.

Label: Disabled persons - consultation before co-opting representative to committee
Description: Where any enactment provides for the appointment or co-option to any council, committee or body of one or more persons with special knowledge of the needs of disabled persons, such appointment or co-option shall only be made after consultation with such organisation or organisations of disabled people as may be appropriate in each case.

Label: Local authority - prohibition of political publicity
Description: A local authority shall not publish or arrange for the publication of any material which, in whole or in part, appears to be designed to affect public support for a political party.

Label: Local authority - code of practice for publicity
Description: A local authority must take account of Codes of Practice regarding publicity published by the Secretary of State and comply with any compliance orders made

Label: Local authority - mortgagors consent to dispose of interest as mortgagee
Description: A local authority shall not dispose of their interest as mortgagee of land without the prior written consent of the mortgagor (or, if there is more than one mortgagor, of all of them) specifying the name of the person to whom the interest is to be transferred.

Label: Consumer protection - search, seizure and detention
Consumer protection - compensation for seizure and detention
Description: A local authority must pay compensation where it has exercised its powers of seizure and detention in certain circumstances.

Label: Disabled persons - transition for children to adult care and support
Description: A local authority must carry out a needs assessment under the care act for children reaching the age of 18 to whom this act applies and for whom they are responsible under the this Act.

Label: Children and families - direct payments
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations regarding direct payments for provision of services for children and their families.

Label: Social care - parent carers assessment
Description:
A local authority in England must, if the conditions below are met, assess whether a parent carer within their area has needs for support and, if so, what those needs are.

“Parent carer” means a person aged 18 or over who provides or intends to provide care for a disabled child for whom the person has parental responsibility.

The first condition is that—
(a) it appears to the authority that the parent carer may have needs for support, or
(b) the authority receive a request from the parent carer to assess the parent carer's needs for support.

The second condition is that the local authority are satisfied that the disabled child cared for and the disabled child's family are persons for whom they may provide or arrange for the provision of services under section 17.

Label: Special educational needs - continued provision where EHC plan maintained
Description:
This section applies where, immediately before a child in need reaches the age of 18—

a local authority in England is providing services for the child in the exercise of functions conferred by section 17, and
an EHC plan is maintained for the child.

The local authority may continue to provide services for the child in the exercise of those functions after the child reaches the age of 18, but may not continue to do so after the EHC plan has ceased to be maintained.

In this section “EHC plan” means a plan within section 37(2) of the Children and Families Act 2014.

Label: Fostering - staying put arrangements
Description:
A “staying put arrangement” is an arrangement under which—

a person who is a former relevant child by virtue of section 23C(1)(b), and
a person (a “former foster parent”) who was the former relevant child's local authority foster parent immediately before the former relevant child ceased to be looked after by the local authority,
continue to live together after the former relevant child has ceased to be looked after.

It is the duty of the local authority (in discharging the duties in section 23C(3) and by other means)—
to monitor the staying put arrangement, and
to provide advice, assistance and support to the former relevant child and the former foster parent with a view to maintaining the staying put arrangement.
Support provided to the former foster parent under subsection (3)(b) must include financial support.

Label: Child protection - child assessment order
Description: A local authority may apply for a child assessment order

Label: Local authority meetings - religious/belief observance
Description: A local authority meeting may make time for religion or belief observance and may support or facilitate a religion or belief event

Label: Statutory nuisances - proceedings
Description: A local authority must commence proceedings for statutory nuisance in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - decision notices
Description: A local authority must have regard to prescribed decision notices

Label: Planning - consultation on development order
Description: A local authority must have regard to the duty to consult in certain cases.

Label: Public health - prevention, care and aftercare
Description: A local authority may to the extent directed by the Secretary of State and with his approval make arrangements for provide prevention, care and aftercare in relation to its health function.

Label: Animal health - borrowing by Local Authority
Description: A local authority may borrow for the purposes of the Act

Label: Animal health - provision of wharves etc.
Description: A local authority may provide, erect and fit up wharves, stations, lairs, sheds and other places for the landing, reception, keeping, sale, slaughter or disposal of imported or other animals, carcases, fodder, litter, dung and other things.

Label: Animal health - acquisition of land
Description: A local authority may acquire land for certain purposes in connection with the Act.

Label: Animal health - public facilities for sheep dipping
Description: A local authority may provide public facilities for sheep dipping.

Label: Animal health - burial of carcasses washed ashore
Description: A local authority must pay the cost of the burial of carcasses washed ashore and may recover the cost from the ship owner.

Label: Animal health - payment of Secretary of State's expenses
Description: A local authority must pay the Secretary of State’s expenses where he acts in default of the Authority

Label: Licences - granting of zoo licence
Description: A local authority may grant a licence for a zoo, after consider inspectors' reports. Such a licence may be granted subject to conditions, may be transferred, renewed or altered.

Label: Licensing - inspection of zoos
Description: A local authority must inspect zoos and closed zoos in its area in certain circumstances.

Label: Lcensing - zoo licence - local authority zoos
Description: A local authority must send certain information to the Secretary of State regarding the licencing of local authority zoos and must comply with the Secretary of State’s directions.

Label: Licensing - zoo licence - exemptions
Description: A local authority may apply to the Secretary of State for a dispensation that certain zoos are to be exempt from the provisions of the Act.

Label: Licensing - zoo licencing - fees
Description: A local authority may charge reasonable fees in relation to dealing with licences and inspections

Label: Licensing - zoo licensing - enforcement and closure
Description: A local authority may give directions to enforce licencing conditions or the requirement to be licenced after following the prescribed procedure and may direct the closure of a zoo in certain circumstances.

Label: Licensing - zoo licensing - welfare of animals
Description: A local authority may give directions or make arrangements for the welfare or disposal of animals in certain circumstances.

Label: Licensing - zoo licensing - powers of entry
Description: A person duly authorised by a local authority may enter a zoo in certain circumstances.

Label: Local Government - Enforcement of covenant relating to land
Description: A local Authority may enforce certain covenants relating to land in certain circumstances.

Label: Regulation - temporary markets
Description: A local Authority may resolve to control temporary markets in certain circumstances.

Label: Personal property - Lost and uncollected property
Description: A local Authority may take possession of lost and uncollected property in certain circumstances.

Label: Employment and training - arrangements
Description: A local Authority may enter into arrangements with the Secretary of State pursuant to the Employment  and Training Act 1973

Label: Mental health - arrangement of interview
Description: A local social services authority must arrange for a person to be interviewed by a mental health professional in certain circumstances

Label: Elections - register of electors - compilation and maintenance
Description: A Registration Officer shall compile, canvass for and maintain a register of electors for both national and local elections.

Label: Elections - register of electors - publication
Description: A Registration Officer shall publish a revised version of the Register of Electors in certain circumstances and make certain alterations.

Label: Elections - assistance to returning officer
Description: A local authority may appoint officers to assist the returning officer.

Label: Elections - polling districts and stations
Description:
For elections of county councillors in England, the county council may divide an electoral division into polling districts, and may alter any polling district, and for elections of London borough or district councillors the London borough or district council may divide the London borough or district or any ward thereof into polling districts, and may alter any polling district.

For elections of county or county borough councillors in Wales, the county or county borough council may divide an electoral division into polling districts and may alter any polling district.

Label: Elections - appointment of returning officer
Description:
In England every non-metropolitan county council shall appoint an officer of the council to be the returning officer for elections of councillors of the county and every district council shall appoint an officer of the council to be the returning officer for the elections of councillors of the district and an officer of the council to be the returning officer for elections of councillors of parishes within the district. 

In Wales the council of every county or county borough shall appoint—

an officer of the council to be the returning officer for elections of councillors of the county or county borough; and
an officer of the council to be the returning officer for elections of councillors of communities within the county or county borough.

Label: Detained persons - assessment of education, health and care needs
Description: A local authority must, in certain circumstances, determine whether it may be necessary for special educational provision to be made for the detained person in accordance with an EHC plan on release from detention.

Label: Detained persons - securing EHC plan
Description: A local authority must, in certain circumstances, secure an EHC plan for a detained person.

Label: Detained persons - supply of goods and services
Description: A local authority may supply goods and services to any authority or other person making special educational provision for a detained person, but only for the purpose of assisting the local authority in the performance of a duty.

Label: Local auditor – Inspection of Statement of Accounts and other information.
Description: A local authority must allow its Statement of Accounts and certain other information to be inspected by a local government elector and must supply copies where necessary.

Label: Local auditor – costs for dealing with objections to accounts
Description: A local authority must pay the auditor’s reasonable costs in dealing with objections to accounts.

Label: Local auditor – costs for court application for unlawful item of expenditure
Description: A local authority must pay the auditor’s reasonable costs in connection with an application to court that an item of expenditure was unlawful.

Label: Local auditor – costs for judicial review
Description: A local authority must pay the auditor’s reasonable costs in relation to the Auditor applying for judicial review.

Label: Accounts and audit - regulations
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations relating to accounts and audit.

Label: Accounts and audit - compliance with Code of Practice
Description: A local authority must comply with a Code of Practice issued by the Secretary of State on the auditing process.

Label: Accounts and audit - accounting records
Description: A local authority must keep adequate accounting records.

Label: Accounts and audit - audit of accounts
Description: The accounts for each financial year must be audited

Label: Accounts and audit - appointment of local auditor
Description: A local authority must appoint a local auditor to audit its accounts for a financial year not later than 31 December in the preceding financial year.

Label: Accounts and audit - appointment of auditor panel
Description: A local authority must have an auditor panel to exercise the functions conferred on auditor panels by or under this Act.

Label: Accounts and audit - failure to appoint local auditor
Description: A local authority must Inform the Secretary of State and follow directions if it fails to appoint a local auditor.

Label: Accounts and audit - limitation of liability agreement
Description: A local authority must take certain steps before entering into a limitation of liability agreement with a local auditor.

Label: Accounts and audit - resignation, removal and appointment of auditor
Description: A local authority must comply with regulations made by the Secretary of State with regard to the resignation and removal of an auditor or of the auditor’s appointment by a specified person.

Label: Accounts and audit - local auditor requests for documents and information
Description: A local authority must comply with the requests of its local Auditor for documents and information.

Label: Animals - detention of horses
Description: A local authority may detain horses in certain circumstances and recover certain expenses from the owner.

Label: Animals - sale of detained horses
Description: A local authority may sell detained horses in certain circumstances.

Label: Consumer rights - complaints regarding unfair contract terms and notices
Description:
A local authority may consider a complaint about a term or notice to which the Schedule applies (a “relevant complaint”).
If a regulator other than the Competition and Markets Authority intends to consider a relevant complaint, it must notify the CMA that it intends to do so, and must then consider the complaint.
If a regulator considers a relevant complaint, but decides not to make an application relation to the complaint, it must give reasons for its decision to the person who made the complaint.

Label: Consumer rights - injunction for unfair contract terms
Description:
A local authority may apply for an injunction against a person if the regulator thinks that—
(a) the person is using, or proposing or recommending the use of, a term or notice to which this Schedule applies, and
(b) the term or notice purports to exclude or restrict liability of the kind mentioned in sections 31, 47, 57 or 65(1) or is unfair or does not meet the transparency test.
The CMA must be notified of any such application and its outcome.

Label: consumer rights - undertaking regarding unfair contract terms
Description:
A local authority may accept an undertaking from a person against whom it has applied, or thinks it is entitled to apply, for an injunction.
The undertaking may provide that the person will comply with the conditions that are agreed between the person and the regulator about the use of terms or notices, or terms or notices of a kind, specified in the undertaking.
The CMA must be notified—
(a) the conditions on which the undertaking is accepted, and
(b) the person who gave it.

Label: Consumer rights - investigatory powers and duties
Consumer rights - exercising of enforcement powers
Description: A local authority may only exercise a power under this Schedule for the purposes listed in the Schedule, subject to the restrictions in the Schedule.

Label: Consumer rights enforcement - notice to provide information
Description: A local authority or an authorised officer may give notice to a person requiring the person to provide the authority with the information specified in the notice. A local authority may take court action if the notice is not complied with.

Label: Consumer rights enforcement - purchase, entry and inspection
Description:
A local authority or an authorised officer may 

make a purchase of a product, or
 enter into an agreement to secure the provision of a product.

And for these purposes an officer may —

at any reasonable time, enter premises to which the public has access (whether or not the public has access at that time), and
 inspect any product on the premises which the public may inspect.
The power of entry may be exercised without first giving notice or obtaining a warrant.

Label: Consumer rights enforcement - entry and observation
Description:
A local authority or an authorised officer may 

may enter premises to which the public has access in order to observe the carrying on of a business on those premises.
The power may be exercised at any reasonable time (whether or not the public has access at that time).
The power of entry may be exercised without first giving notice or obtaining a warrant.

Label: Consumer rights enforcement - entry without warranr
Consumer rights enforcement - application for warrant
Description: A local authority may apply for a warrant to enter premises, enter those premises in accordance with the conditions set out in the Schedule and require assistance from those present upon the premises.

Label: Consumer rights enforcement - access to goods and compensation
Description: A local authority must allow access to seized goods in certain circumstances and pay compensation for damaged goods in certain circumstances

Label: Consumer rights enforcement - notice of testing results
Description: A local authority must inform the relevant person of the result of testing in certain circumstance.

Label: Consumer rights enforcement - civil and criminal proceedings
Description: A local authority may bring civil and/or criminal proceedings in certain circumstances

Label: Consumer rights - letting agents fees
Description: A local authority must enforce the duty upon letting agents to publicise their fees.

Label: Consumer rights - secondary ticketing
Description: A local authority may enforce the law relating to secondary ticketing,  where a person re-sells a ticket for a recreational, sporting or cultural event in the United Kingdom through a secondary ticketing facility.

Label: Counter terrorism - prevention of people from falling into terrorism
Description: A local authority must, in the exercise of its functions, have due regard to the need to prevent people from being drawn into terrorism.

Label: Counter terrorism - regard to guidance from Secretary of State
Description: A local authority must, in the exercise of its duty under the Act, have regard to Guidance from the Secretary of State.

Label: Counter terrorism - compliance with guidance
Description: A local authority must comply with directions from the Secretary of State or from Welsh Ministers.

Label: Counter terrorism - assessment and support panel
Description: A local authority must ensure that there is an assessment and support panel for its area.

Label: Counter terrorism - membership of assessment and support panel
Description: A local authority must be a member of the assessment and support panel for its area, appoint a representative and co-operate with the other members in carrying out its functions.

Label: Meetings - religious observance
Description:
The business at a meeting of an English local authority or committee or subcommittee of that Authority may include time for—

(a) prayers or other religious observance, or
(b) observance connected with a religious or philosophical belief.

Label: Religious events - support and attendance
Description:
A local authority in England may support or facilitate, or make arrangements to be represented at, any of the following—
(a) a religious event,
(b) an event with a religious element,
(c) an event connected with a religious or philosophical belief, or
(d) an event with an element connected with such a belief.

Label: Events - health and safety notifications
Description:
If in relation to a required permission to hold an event. for a reason related to the health or safety of any person, or for reasons that include such a reason, the decision has effect to—

(i) stop the holding of the event,
(ii) impose restrictions on the holding of the event,
(iii) impose conditions to be met in connection with the holding of the event, or
(iv) do all, or any two, of those things.

The local authority must take prescribed steps to notify relevant people of that decision and to review that decision if required.

Label: Slavery or trafficking - notification
Description: A local authority must notify the Secretary of State or another person or body identified by regulations if its suspects slavery or trafficking.

Label: Housing - register of self-build and custom build interest
Description:
A local authority must keep a register of—
individuals, and associations of individuals who are seeking to acquire serviced plots of land in the authority's area for their own self-build and custom housebuilding.

Label: Housing - regard to self build register
Housing - permission for self build and custom house building
Description: A local authority must give suitable development permission in respect of enough serviced plots of land to meet the demand for self-build and custom house building in the authority's area arising in each base period and must also comply with Regulations.

Label: Housing - guidance regarding self build and custom house building
Description: A local authority must have regard to guidance issued by the Secretary of State when carrying out its duties under the Act.

Label: Childcare - publication of information on free childcare
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations made by the Secretary of State regarding the publication of information relating to the availability of free childcare.

Label: Childcare - availability of free childcare
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations made by The Secretary of State regarding the availability of free childcare.

Label: Combined authorities - Mayor
Description: A combined local authority must comply with an Order of the Secretary of State regarding combined authorities having a mayor for the combined area.

Label: Transport - creation of sub national transport body
Description: A local authority must comply with an Order of the Secretary of State regarding the creation of sub national transport bodies.

Label: Local authorities - governance arrangements
Description: A local authority must comply with the governance arrangements laid down in an Order of the Secretary of State.

Label: Local authority - transfer of functions
Description: A local authority must carry out the functions transferred to it by an Order of the Secretary of State.

Label: Combined authorities - deputy Mayor
Description: The Mayor of a combined local authority must appoint a deputy mayor

Label: Combined authorities - functions of a Mayor
Description: The Mayor of a combined local authority must carry out the functions set out in the Secretary of States Order.

Label: Combined authorities - functions
Description: A combined local authority must comply with an order of the Secretary of State regarding the local authority functions that it must carry out.

Label: Housing - grants to private registered providers
Description: The Greater London Authority may make grants to private registered providers in respect of right to buy discounts for dwellings in London on such terms as it considers to be appropriate.

Label: Housing - vacant higher value housing
Description: A Local Authority must make payments to the Secretary of State in respect of vacant higher value housing.

Label: Housing - sale of higher value housing
Description: A Local Authority must consider selling higher value housing

Label: Housing - rent for high income tenants
Description: A Local Authority must comply with regulations making provision about the levels of rent that it must charge a high income tenant of social housing.

Label: Planning - alternative planning permission providers
Description: A Local Authority must comply with regulations regarding the provision of information to alternate planning providers.

Label: Planning - compulsory purchase - entry of land
Description: A Local Authority may enter and survey land which it is acquiring by compulsory purchase providing certain conditions are met.

Label: Planning - compulsory purchase - damage compensation
Description: Where a Local Authority entering and surveying land which it is acquiring by compulsory purchase causes damage it must pay compensation in certain circumstances.

Label: Migrant children - transfer of responsibilities
Description: A local authority may make arrangements with another authority for the transfer of certain responsibilities relating to migrant children.

Label: Migrant children - provision of information
Description: A local authority must when directed to do so by the Secretary of State provide information to the Secretary of State relevant to the exercise of sections 69 or 72 of the Act.

Label: Migrant children - directed transfer of responsibility
Description: A local authority must, when directed to do so by the Secretary of State, enter into arrangements under section 69 of the Act.

Label: Migrant children - compliance with transfer scheme
Description: A local authority must, comply with a Scheme for the transfer of responsibility for relevant children prepared by the Secretary of State.

Label: Local authority - spoken English in customer facing roles (England)
Description: A local authority must ensure that each person who works for the public authority in a customer-facing role speaks fluent English and must have regard to the code of practice under section 80 applicable to that Authority when so doing.

Label: Local authority - complaints procedure regarding language (England)
Description: A local authority must have a complaints procedure for dealing with complaints regarding an alleged breach of the Section 77 duty and must have regard to the code of practice under section 80 applicable to that Authority when so doing.

Label: Local authority - spoken English/Welsh in customer facing roles (Wales)
Description: A local authority must ensure that each person who works for the public authority in a customer-facing role speaks fluent English or Welsh and must have regard to the code of practice under section 80 applicable to that Authority when so doing.

Label: Local authority - complaints procedure regarding language (Wales)
Description: A local authority must have a complaints procedure for dealing with complaints regarding an alleged breach of the Section 77 duty and must have regard to the code of practice under section 80 applicable to that Authority when so doing.

Label: Psychoactive substances - prohibition notices
Description: A local authority may issues a prohibition notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Psychoactive substances - premises notice
Description: A local authority may issues a premises notice in certain circumstances.

Label: Psychoactive substances - prohibition or premises order
Description: A local authority may apply for a Prohibition or Premises Order in certain circumstances

Label: Psychoactive substances - enforcement of access provisions
Description:
A person authorised  by a local authority may—

enter premises in respect of which an access prohibition is in effect (see section 22(6)); and
do anything necessary to secure the premises against entry.

Label: Psychoactive substances - recovery of costs
Description: A local authority may apply to a court to recover its costs expended in enforcing access provisions.

Label: Psychoactive substances - variation or discharge of prohibition or premises orders
Description: A local authority may apply for the variation or discharge of a Prohibition or Premises Order in certain circumstances

Label: Psychoactive substances - entry or search of premises
Description: A local authority may apply to a Magistrate’s court for a warrant to enter and search premises in certain circumstances

Label: Psychoactive substances - examination, testing and taking samples
Description: A local authority officer to whom a warrant under section 39 has been issued may examine, test and take samples of substances found on the premises

Label: Psychoactive substances - production of documents
Description: A local authority officer to whom a warrant under section 39 has been issued may require the production of documents

Label: Psychoactive substances - seizure of items or documents
Description: A local authority officer to whom a warrant under section 39 has been issued may seize and/or detain items and take copies of documents or records.

Label: Psychoactive substances - seizure and detention of items, notices and records
Description: A local authority officer who has seized items using powers under the Act must comply with the requirements under the Act relating to the giving of notices and keeping records

Label: Psychoactive substances - entry, search and seizure – reasonable force
Description: A local authority officer may use reasonable force in exercising the powers of entry, search and seizure under the Act

Label: Psychoactive substances - forfeiture of seized items
Description: A local authority may apply to a court for the forfeiture of seized items.

Label: Psychoactive substances - return or disposal of seized items
Description: A local authority must comply with its duty to return or dispose of items seized under the Act

Label: Housing - reduction in social housing rents
Description: A local authority who is a registered providers of social housing must (subject to exemptions) secure that the amount of rent payable in respect of that relevant year by a tenant of their social housing in England is at least 1% less than the amount of rent that was payable by the tenant in respect of the preceding 12 months.

Label: Education - conversion to academy
Description: A local authority and the school’s governing body must where an Academy order under section 4(A1) or (1)(b) take all reasonable steps to facilitate the conversion of the school into an Academy.

Label: Education - guidance on academy conversion
Description: A local authority and the school’s governing body must comply with the Directions of the Secretary of State regarding a proposed conversion.

Label: Apprenticeships - regulations regarding targets
Description: A local authority with Apprenticeship Targets must have regard to the target and must comply with Regulations

Label: Apprenticeships - publication of information
Description: A local authority with Apprenticeship Targets must publish and send to the Secretary of State prescribed information.

Label: Local authority - contracting out of functions
Description: A local authority may contract out its functions to the extent allowed for by ministerial order.

Label: Maintained school - intervention where school causing concern
Description: The Governing Body of a maintained school must enter into arrangements if directed to do so by the Secretary of State.

Label: Health - consistent identifiers
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations relating to consistent identifiers.

Label: Health - sharing of information
Description: A local authority must disclose information in certain circumstances.

Label: Planning - register of land
Description: A local authority must comply with Regulations requiring it to prepare and maintain a register of land

Label: Local authority - employee pension scheme
Description: A local authority must comply with terms of the appropriate public sector pension scheme regulations for its employees.

Label: Local authority - management of pension scheme
Description: If and where relevant under the terms of the various local authority employee related schemes a local authority must manage the scheme and set up a Pensions Board.

Label: Education - free early years budget provision
Description: A local authority proposing  to allocate an amount of relevant financial assistance to a relevant childcare provider for a funding period out of the authority's individual schools budget for the period, must comply with regulations issued by the Secretary of State.

Label: Regulated activities - guidance and enforcement
Regulated activities - primary authority
Description: A local authority must comply with the Secretary of State’s nomination to be a Primary Authority in relation to a regulated Person under the Act.

Label: Regulated activities - co-ordinator of a regulated group
Description: A local authority must comply with the Secretary of State’s nomination to be the co-ordinator of a regulated group under the Act and undertake the associated responsibilities

Label: Regulated activities - advice and guidance
Description: A local authority must if it is a primary authority or the co-ordinator of a regulated group provide advice and guidance.

Label: Regulated activities - enforcement action
Description: A local authority when taking enforcement action as a primary authority must take certain steps.

Label: Regulated activities - enforcement action other than as primary authority
Description: A local authority when taking enforcement action other than as a primary authority must take certain steps.

Label: Regulated activities - making of inspection plan
Description: A local authority’s partnership function consists of or includes a function of inspection, the primary authority may make an inspection plan.

Label: Regulated activities - regard to inspection plan
Description: A local authority must have regard to its approved Inspection Plan when carrying out its functions.

Label: Regulated activities - revocation or revision of inspection plan
Description: A local authority may revoke or revise an Inspection Plan by taking the required steps.

Label: Regulated activities - charging
Description: A local authority may charge the Regulated Person in order to recover its reasonably incurred costs arising from its carrying out its functions under the Act.

Label: Regulated activities - supporting primary authority
Description: A local authority who is a supporting regulator may support a primary authority in carrying out certain of its functions and must take certain steps when doing so.

Label: Regulated activities - complementary regulator
Description: A local authority who is a complementary regulator must act consistently with primary authority advice and guidance in the exercise of the designated function.

Label: Regulated activities - notification to complementary regulator
Description: A local authority who is a qualifying regulator or enforcing authority must inform the co-ordinating primary authority of the proposed enforcement action.

Label: Regulated activities - compliance with directions
Description: A local authority when exercising its functions under the Act must have regard to guidance and comply with directions issued by the Secretary of State.

Label: Building regulations - forms and notices
Description: It is the duty of local authorities to issues forms and notices, authenticate and serve the same and to comply with any statutory instruments.

Label: Building regulations - entry of premises
Description: An authorised officer of a local authority may, in certain circumstances enter premises to ensure compliance with building regulations.

Label: Building regulations - execution of works
Description: A local authority may, with the agreement of the owner or occupier of the premises execute works at the expense of the owner or occupier.

Label: Building regulations - enforcement notice
Description: A local authority may, issue an enforcement notice and in certain circumstances carry out the required works and charge the owner or occupier for the same.

Label: Building regulations - sale of materials
Description: A local authority may sell materials removed from premises in certain circumstances.

Label: Building regulations - breaking open of streets
Description: A local authority may break open the streets in certain circumstances

Label: Building regulations - compensation for damage
Description: A local authority must pay compensation for damage sin certain circumstances.

Label: Building regulations - recovery of expenses
Description: A local authority may recover its expenses and interest for work done in connection with the Act in certain circumstances.

Label: Building regulations - power to prosecute
Description: A local authority may commence the prosecution of offences under this Act.

Label: Building regulations - indemnity of officers
Description: A local authority must indemnify its Members and officers in certain circumstances

Label: Building regulations - compliance with directions
Description: A local authority must comply with the directions of the Secretary of State and pay his expenses when exercising his default powers.

Label: Markets - market days, hours and charging
Description: A local authority may determine market days, hours; charge for certain items/services and recover unpaid charges.

Label: Markets - weighing machines and scales
Description: A local authority must provide weighing machines and scales in certain circumstances

Label: Markets - cold stores
Description: A local authority may provide cold stores at markets

Label: Markets - information from drivers of livestock vehicles
Description: A local authority officer may obtain certain information from drivers of certain livestock vehicles.

Label: Planning - brownfield land register
Description:
Each local planning authority must prepare, maintain and publish a register of previously developed land which is within their area and which meets the criteria defined in these regulations.

The register is to be known as that local planning authority’s “Brownfield Land Register”

The register must be published by 31st December 2017

Label: Safety of stands at sports grounds - application for safety certificate
Description: The local authority may, by notice, require an applicant for a safety certificate for a stand at a sports ground to furnish them, within such reasonable time as they may specify in the notice, with such information and such plans of the ground as they consider necessary for the purpose of discharging their functions in respect of the issue of safety certificates for the regulated stands at the ground.

Label: Licences - child performances-  requirements and conditions
Description: Local authorities must follow the prescribed procedure and requirements in respect of licences granted under section 25 of the Children and Young Persons Act 1933 for children performing or taking part in activities abroad for profit.  LAs must impose any conditions which they consider necessary in order to ensure that the child is fit to take part in the performance or activity; proper provision is made to secure the child's health and wellbeing; and proper provision is made to ensure that the child's education will not suffer.

Label: Litter bins - cleaning and emptying
Description: It shall be the duty of a litter authority in England and Wales to make arrangements for the regular emptying and cleansing of any litter bins provided.

Label: Non domestic rating - levy payment
Description: A local authority must make a levy payment to the Secretary of State in prescribed circumstances.

Label: Children and familes - home area taking over provision of accommodation
Description: Where a local authority provide accommodation for a child who is ordinarily resident in the area of another local authority, that other local authority may take over the provision of accommodation for the child within three months of being notified in writing.

Label: Children and families - provision of accommodation over 16
Description: A local authority may provide accommodation for any person who has reached the age of sixteen but is under twenty-one in any community home which takes children who have reached the age of sixteen if they consider that to do so would safeguard or promote his welfare.

Label: Business rates - provision of information on BRS
Description: The billing authority has a duty to comply with any request for information from the billing authority in respect of the business rate supplement.

Label: Transport - securing of public transport provision by county
Description: In each non-metropolitan county of England and Wales it shall be the duty of the county council to secure the provision of such public passenger transport services as the council consider it appropriate to secure to meet requirements within the county that would not be provided by any other means.

Label: Transport - promoting availability and convenience of use of public transport
Description: A non-metropolitan county council and Wales shall have power to take any measures that appear to be appropriate for the purpose of or in connection with promoting the availability of public passenger transport services or the convenience of the public (including persons who are elderly or disabled) in using all available public passenger transport services

Label: Children and families - day care for children aged five and under
Description: A local authority in Wales may provide day care for children within their area who are aged five or under; and not yet attending school even though they are not in need.

Label: Children and families - facilities for day care providers
Description: A local authority may provide facilities (including training, advice, guidance and counselling) for those caring for children in day care

Label: Children and families - care for children in need outside school hours
Description: Every local authority shall provide for children in need within their area who are attending any school such care or supervised activities as is appropriate outside school hours; or during school holidays.

Label: Children and families - care and activities outside school hours
Description: A local authority in Wales may provide such care or supervised activities for children within their area who are attending any school outside school hours or during school holidays even though those children are not in need.

Label: Looked after children - payments
Description: Where a child is being looked after by a local authority the authority may make payments to a parent of the child; any person who is not a parent of his but who has parental responsibility for him; or any relative, friend or other person connected with him, in respect of travelling, subsistence or other expenses incurred by that person in visiting the child.

Label: Looked after children - independent visitors (Wales)
Description: In Wales where it appears to a local authority in relation to any child that they are looking after that communication between the child and a parent of his, or any person who is not a parent of his but who has parental responsibility for him, has been infrequent; or he has not visited or been visited by (or lived with) any such person during the preceding twelve months,and that it would be in the child's best interests for an independent person to be appointed to be his visitor for the purposes of this paragraph, they shall appoint such a visitor.

Label: Looked after children - living outside England and Wales
Description: A local authority may, with the approval of every person who has parental responsibility for the child arrange for, or assist in arranging for, any other child looked after by them to live outside England and Wales.

Label: Looked after children - welfare after leaving care
Description: It is the duty of the local authority looking after a child to advise, assist and befriend him with a view to promoting his welfare when they have ceased to look after him.

Label: Looked after children - personal adviser
Description: A local authority shall arrange for each child whom they are looking after who is a eligible to have a personal adviser.

Label: Looked after children - notification of death
Description: If a child who is being looked after by a local authority dies, the authority shall notify the appropriate national authority and shall, so far as is reasonably practicable, notify the child's parents and every person who is not a parent of his but who has parental responsibility for him.

Label: Schools - exit or dissolution of federation
Description: The responsible LA must establish a temporary governing body and issue and review an instrument of government in respect of a school which wishes to exit a federation or where a federation is to dissolve.

Label: Business improvement districts - recovery of ballot costs
Description: A billing authority may recover the costs of a BRS-BID ballot or a renewal ballot from the BRS-BID proposer or BRSBID body in the prescribed circumstances.

Label: Business improvement districts - BRS-BID levy prescribed rules
Description: A billing authority must have regard to prescribed rules regarding the imposition, administration, collection, recovery and application of the BRS-BID levy.

Label: Business improvement districts - veto of BRS-BID proposals
Description: A billing authority may veto BRS-BID proposals in the prescribed period and circumstances, but is subject to the appeals provision.

Label: Public transport - prohibition on forming bus company
Description: A relevant authority may not, in exercise of any of its powers, form a company for the purpose of providing a local service.

Label: Social care -Care Act - compliance with guidance
Description: A local authority must comply with guidance issued by the Secretary of State when carrying out its functions under the Care Act.

Label: Cycle tracks - conversion of footpaths into cycle tracks
Description:
A local highway authority may, to the extent allowed by the Act, in the case of any footpath for which they are the highway authority by order made by them and either-
(a)     submitted to and confirmed by the Secretary of State, or
(b)     confirmed by them as an unopposed order,
designate the footpath or any part of it as a cycle track, with the effect that, on such date as the order takes effect in accordance with the following provisions of this section, the footpath or part of the footpath to which the order relates shall become a highway which for the purposes of the 1980 Act is a highway maintainable at the public expense and over which the public have a right of way on pedal cycles (other than pedal cycles which are motor vehicles) and a right of way on foot.

Label: Environmental protection - smoke free premises
Description: Premises must be smoke free to the extent that they are open to the public or used as a place of work.

Label: Housing - rent repayment orders - application
Description: If a local housing authority becomes aware that a person has been convicted of an offence to which this Chapter applies in relation to housing in its area, the authority must consider applying for a rent repayment order.

Label: Housing - rent repayment orders - assisting tenants
Description: A local housing authority in England may help a tenant to apply for a rent repayment order.

Label: Housing - reduction of influence on housing providers
Description: A local housing authority must comply with Regulations designed to reduce its influence on private registered housing providers.

Label: Taxation - self employed persons contracted to local authority
Description: If a local authority contracts with a third party for a person to carry out work for it and that person would be considered to be an employee if engaged directly by the local authority then the local authority must treat that person as an employee for the purposes of tax and national insurance.

Label: Taxation - decision on taxable status
Description:
If a local authority enters into a contract to which Section 61M applies, If the contract is entered into on or after 6 April 2017, the duty under subsection (1) must be complied with-
(a)     on or before the time of entry into the contract, or
(b)     if the services begin to be performed at a later time, before that later time.
If the contract is entered into before 6 April 2017, the duty under subsection (1) must be complied with on or before the date of the first payment made under the contract on or after 6 April 2017

Label: Taxation - information to establish taxable status
Description: If a local authority enters into a contract to which Section 61M applies, the local authority may ask the person such questions as it requires to enable it to comply with its duty under Section 61T.

Label: Waste collection - fixed penalty notices regarding receptacles
Description: An officer duly authorised by a local authority may, in certain circumstances, issue a fixed penalty notice, in the manner prescribed, for offences under sections 46 and 47 of the Act.

Label: Bus services - enhanced partnership scheme notification
Description: If a local transport authority or two or more such authorities acting jointly make or modify an enhanced partnership scheme to provide bus services the authorities must provide the Traffic Commissioner with certain information.

Label: Bus services - advanced quality partnership schemes
Description: A local transport authority whose area is in England, or two or more such authorities acting jointly, may make an advanced quality partnership scheme if they are satisfied that the scheme will contribute to the implementation of their local transport policies.

Label: Burial and cremation - municipal funerals
Description: It shall be the duty of a local authority to cause to be buried or cremated the body of any person who has died or been found dead in their area, in any case where it appears to the authority that no suitable arrangements for the disposal of the body have been or are being made otherwise than by the authority.

Label: Public health - control of certain diseases
Description: A local authority shall, where stipulated, comply with regulations for the control of certain diseases.

Label: Public health - canal boats
Description: A local authority shall enforce any regulations regarding canal boats in respect of those boats present in it's area.

Label: Road traffic - school crossing patrols
Description: A local traffic authority may establish school crossing patrols

Label: Roads - provision of parking and schemes of traffic control
Description: A local authority may provide on and off road parking and traffic control schemes

Label: Roads - off-street parking
Description: A local authority may designate and control off-street parking

Label: Roads - pay parking on highways
Description: A local authority may designate and control pay parking on highways

Label: Roads - loading areas
Description: A local authority may provide loading areas

Label: Roads - stands and racks for cycles and motorcycles
Description: A local authority may provide stands and racks for cycles and motorcycles

Label: Roads - parking attendants
Description: A local authority may provide parking attendants

Label: Roads - bollards
Description: A local authority may place bollards in a road in certain circumstances to enforce a local traffic order

Label: Libraries - charging
Description: A local authority may not charge for library services save as allowed for by section 8 or by Regulations

Label: New towns - overseeing development
Description: Where the Secretary of State has by order appointed one or more local authorities to oversee the development of the area as a new town the local authority must comply with Regulations published by the Secretary of State.

Label: Fire and rescue - collaboration agreement
Description: A Fire and Rescue Body may enter into a collaboration agreement with an ambulance trust or with a police body in England. A collaboration agreement is an agreement in writing that sets out how the parties to the agreement will work together in discharging their functions.

Label: Fire and rescue - consideration of collaboration agreement
Description: A Fire and Rescue Body must keep under consideration whether entering into a collaboration agreement with one or more other relevant emergency services in England could be in the interests of the efficiency or effectiveness of that service and those other services. The Body must share any proposals and consider any such proposals received from others.

Label: Licensing - taxi and private hire vehicles
Description: A local authority responsible for the licencing of taxis and private hire vehicles must have regard to the Secretary of State's Guidance.

Label: Burial and cremation - person in care accommodation (England)
Description: Any council which is the local authority for the purposes of the Local Authority Social Services Act 1970 may cause to be buried or cremated the body of any deceased person who immediately before his death was being provided with accommodation under Part 1 of the Care Act 2014

Label: Burial and cremation - person in care accommodation (Wales)
Description: A local authority within the meaning of the Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014 may cause to be buried or cremated the body of any deceased person who immediately before his death was being provided with accommodation under Part 4 of that Act.

Label: Bus services - notice and consultation of advanced quality partnership schemes
Description: If an authority or authorities propose to make an advanced quality partnership scheme, they must give notice of the proposed scheme in such manner as they consider appropriate for drawing it to the attention of persons in the area to which it relates. The notices must contain the required particulars and be sent to the statutory consultees.

Label: Bus services - making an advanced quality partnership scheme
Description: If, after taking the steps described in section 113G, an authority or authorities decide that it is appropriate to make the advanced quality partnership scheme, they may make it as proposed or with modifications. The Scheme must contain certain proscribed particulars.

Label: Bus services - postponement of advanced quality contract scheme
Description: If it appears to the authority or authorities appropriate to do so, they may decide that any of the dates specified the scheme may be postponed, subject to restrictions.

Label: Bus services - provision of information
Description: If a local transport authority or two or more such authorities acting jointly, must comply with Regulations requiring the provision of information about bus services.

Label: Bus services - information when creating a new enhanced partnership plan or scheme
Description: If a local transport authority or two or more such authorities acting jointly, are preparing an enhanced partnership plan or scheme, the authority or any of the authorities may, in connection with preparing the plan or scheme, require an operator of a local service in their area or combined area to supply relevant information.

Label: Bus services - guidance for enhanced partnership plans or schemes
Description: A local authority or authorities must have regard to Guidance regarding enhanced partnership plans and schemes.

Label: Bus services - regulations for enhanced partnership plans or schemes
Description: A local authority or authorities must comply with Regulations regarding enhanced partnership plans and schemes.

Label: Bus services - revocation of enhanced partnership plan or scheme
Description: A local authority or authorities may revoke their own enhanced partnership plans and schemes, but must comply with notice and consultation requirements.

Label: Bus services - advanced quality partnership scheme postponement
Description:
The authority or authorities must, as detailed in the Section-
(a)     provide each of the specified facilities or take each of the specified measures not later than the date specified for it to be provided or taken under the scheme, and
(b)     continue to provide the facilities or keep the measures in effect throughout the remainder of the period for which the scheme is in operation.

Label: Bus services - advanced quality partnership schemes - regulations and guidance
Description: The Transport Authorities must comply with Regulations  and have regard to Guidance issued by the Secretary of State.

Label: Bus services - advanced quality partnership scheme - variation or revocation
Description: The authority or authorities responsible for a Scheme may vary or revoke Scheme.

Label: Bus services - franchising schemes
Description: Subject to Regulations, a franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, may make a franchising scheme covering the whole or any part of their area, or their combined area.

Label: Bus services - assessment and approval of franchising schemes
Description: Subject to Regulations, a franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, proposing to make a franchising scheme must carry out an assessment as required by Section 123B, publish the same and where necessary obtain the Secretary of State's approval.

Label: Bus services - audit of franchising schemes
Description: Subject to Regulations, a franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, proposing to make a franchising scheme must carry out an independent audit of the scheme, whilst having regard to the Secretary of State's guidance.

Label: Bus services - consultation on franchising schemes
Description: Subject to Regulations, a franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, proposing to make a franchising scheme must carry out a consultation exercise in relation to the scheme, in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services - publication of franchising scheme
Description: Subject to Regulations, a franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, proposing to make a franchising scheme must publish the scheme, in the required manner.

Label: Bus services - franchising schemes - postponement of local service contracts
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, may postpone Local Service Contracts in certain circumstances.

Label: Bus services - franchising schemes - restrictions on local service contracts
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, must comply with restrictions on Local Service Contracts where a franchising scheme is in force.

Label: Bus services - variation of franchising scheme
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, may vary a franchising scheme in accordance with the provision of the statute.

Label: Bus services - revocation of franchising scheme
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, may revoke a franchising scheme in accordance with the provision of the statute.

Label: Bus services - franchising schemes - interim service where operator failure
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, may provide an interim service in circumstances of operator failure.

Label: Bus services - franchising schemes - service permits
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, may grant, attach conditions to, revoke or suspend a service permit.

Label: Bus services - franchising schemes - regulations and guidance
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, must comply with Regulations and have regard to Guidance issued by the Secretary of State.

Label: Bus services - franchising schemes - obtaining information
Description: A franchising authority, or two or more franchising authorities acting jointly, may obtain information regarding local services in connection with Franchising Schemes.

Label: Bus services - advanced ticketing schemes
Description:
A local transport authority or two or more such authorities acting jointly, may make a ticketing scheme (an "advanced ticketing scheme") covering the whole or any part of their area, or combined area, if they consider that the proposed scheme-
(a)     would be in the interests of the public, and
(b)     would contribute to the implementation of their local transport policies.

Label: Bus services - notice and consultation of advanced ticketing schemes
Description: If a local transport authority or two or more such authorities, propose to make an advanced ticketing scheme, they must give notice of the proposed scheme and undertake consultation.

Label: Bus services - making an advanced ticketing scheme
Description: If a local transport authority or two or more such authorities, propose to make an advanced ticketing scheme may make a scheme but must comply with various requirements when so doing.

Label: Bus services - guidance on advanced ticketing schemes
Description: If a local transport authority or two or more such authorities, must have regard to Guidance from the Secretary of State when making an advanced ticketing scheme may make a scheme.

Label: Bus services - enhanced partnership plans and schemes
Description:
A local transport authority or two or more such authorities acting jointly, may make-
(a)     an enhanced partnership plan in relation to the whole or part of their area, or combined area, and
(b)     one or more enhanced partnership schemes relating to the whole or part of the area to which the plan relates.

Label: Bus services - enhanced partnership plans and schemes - frequency of service
Description: An enhanced partnership scheme may specify requirements about the frequency or timing of particular local services or local services of particular descriptions.

Label: Bus services - facilities and measures for enhanced partnership plans and schemes
Description: Any facilities and measures set out in an enhanced partnership scheme must comply with the requirements of the section.

Label: Bus services - revocation and variation of enhanced partnership plans and schemes
Description: An enhanced partnership scheme may be revoked or varied.

Label: Bus services - preparation, notice and consultation for enhanced partnership plans and schemes
Description: A proposed enhanced partnership scheme must be prepared, notice of the same given and be subject to consultation

Label: Bus services - notice and making content of enhanced partnership plans and schemes
Description: If made, enhanced partnership plans and schemes must comply with the prescribed notice requirements and contain the prescribed content.

Label: Bus services - postponement of enhance partnership plans or schemes
Description: If it appears to a local authority or authorities that have made an enhanced partnership scheme appropriate to do so, they may decide that certain dates relating to the Scheme are to be postponed by such period as they think fit, subject to limitations

Label: Bus services - compliance with enhanced partnership plans or schemes
Description: A local authority or authorities must comply with their own enhanced partnership plans and schemes.

Label: Bus services of enhanced partnership plans and schemes
Description: A local authority or authorities may vary their own enhanced partnership plans and schemes but must comply with notice and consultation requirements.

Label: Community assets - register of land
Description: The local authority must maintain a list of land in its area which has community value.

Label: Community assets - nominations for register of land
Description: The local authority must consider a nomination to list land in its list of assets with community value and to give reasons if the nomination is unsuccessful. The local authority must also give notice of inclusion or removal from the list and must review land included if requested.

Label: Community assets - unsuccessful nominations for register of land
Description: The local authority must maintain a list of land that has been unsuccessfully nominated for inclusion in its list.

Label: Community assets - list of assets
Description: The local authority must publish and allow inspections of lists of assets of community value also assets unsuccessfully nominated for inclusion on such lists.

Label: Community assets - sale or transfer
Description: The local authority must edit list of assets of community value to show notification of intended sale and publicise that intended sale and to notify owner of community interest group bidder and to pay compensation in certain circumstances.

Label: Public service delivery - disclosure to water and sewage undertakers
Description: A local authority may disclose information to water and sewage undertakers in certain circumstances and must have regard to any code of practice when so doing.

Label: Public service delivery - disclosure to improve provision
Description: A local authority may disclose information to improve public service delivery in certain circumstances and must have regard to any code of practice when so doing.

Label: Disclosure of information - for research purposes
Description: A local authority may disclose information for research purposes in certain circumstances and must have regard to any Code of Practice when so doing.

Label: Registration services - disclosure of information
Description: A civil registration official may disclose certain information to certain persons in certain circumstances.

Label: Homelessness - assistance
Description:
The authority may give to any person by whom the service is provided on behalf of the authority assistance by way of grant or loan and/or may also assist any such person-
by permitting the person to use premises belonging to the authority,
by making available furniture or other goods, whether by way of gift, loan or otherwise, and
by making available the services of staff employed by the authority.

Label: Homelessness - advisory service
Description:
A local housing authority must provide or secure the provision of a service, available free of charge to any person in the authority's district, providing information and advice on-
(a)     preventing homelessness,
(b)     securing accommodation when homeless,
(c)     the rights of persons who are homeless or threatened with homelessness, and the duties of the authority, under this Part,
(d)     any help that is available from the authority or anyone else, whether under this Part or otherwise, for persons in the authority's district who are homeless or may become homeless (whether or not they are threatened with homelessness), and
(e)     how to access that help.
(2)     The service must be designed to meet the needs of persons in the authority's district including, in particular, the needs of-
(a)     persons released from prison or youth detention accommodation,
(b)     care leavers,
(c)     former members of the regular armed forces,
(d)     victims of domestic abuse,
(e)     persons leaving hospital,
(f)     persons suffering from a mental illness or impairment, and
(g)     any other group that the authority identify as being at particular risk of homelessness in the authority's district.

Label: Homelessness - assessment and plans
Description:
If the local housing authority are satisfied that an applicant is-
(a)     homeless or threatened with homelessness, and
(b)     eligible for assistance,
the authority must make an assessment of the applicant's case.
(2)     The authority's assessment of the applicant's case must include an assessment of-
(a)     the circumstances that caused the applicant to become homeless or threatened with homelessness,
(b)     the housing needs of the applicant including, in particular, what accommodation would be suitable for the applicant and any persons with whom the applicant resides or might reasonably be expected to reside ("other relevant persons"), and
(c)     what support would be necessary for the applicant and any other relevant persons to be able to have and retain suitable accommodation.
The authority must notify the applicant, in writing, of the assessment that the authority makes and take other steps as to agreement or disagreement with the applicant, including making written records, as are required by the legislation.

Label: Homelessness - non-priority cases
Description: A local authority has certain duties towards someone who is not in priority need but who is not intentionally homeless.

Label: Homelessness - priority need cases
Description: A local authority has certain duties towards someone who is in priority need but who is not intentionally homeless or who is homeless and is eligible for assistance.

Label: Homelessness - codes of practice
Description: A local housing authority must have regard to any code of practice issued by the Secretary or State when exercising its functions under the Act.

Label: Weights and measures - weighing equipment certificate
Description: A local authority may issue a certificate for public weighing and measuring equipment and for individuals using such equipment.

Label: Dry cleaning - regulation
Description: A local authority must regulate dry cleaning activities in accordance with the requirements of the appropriate European Directives.

Label: Auction premises - registration
Description: A local authority must licence auction premises in accordance with the terms of the Act.

Label: Highways - Licence to provide recreation and refreshment facilities on certain highways
Description: The highway authority may issue a licence (subject to conditions) to permit the provision of recreation or refreshment facilities on certain highways in certain circumstances.

Label: Highways - Licence to place a builder's skip on the Highway
Description: The highway authority may issue a licence to permit a builder's skip to be placed on the highway, either with or without conditions.

Label: Highways - scaffolding licence
Description: The highway authority must issue a licence to permit  scaffolding to be placed on the highway, providing the requirements of the Act are met.

Label: Highways - building materials licence
Description: The highway authority may issue a licence to permit the deposit of building materials on the highway or to allow the excavation of streets, either with or without conditions.

Label: Highways - Permission to construct a cellar under the highway
Description: The highway authority may issue a permission to enable the construction of a cellar under the highway.

Label: Highways - pavement lights and ventilators
Description: The highway authority may issue a permission to allow the opening of cellars under streets, and the installation and use of pavement lights over and ventilators on to the highway.

Label: Door to door collections licence
Description: A local authority must issue a door to door collections licence, in accordance with the requirements of the Act, if the requirements of the Act are satisfied.

Label: Data protection - GDPR compliance
Description: All public bodies must comply with the requirements of the General Data Protection Regulations and of the Data Protection Act 2018.

Label: Data protection - appointment of data protection officer
Description: All public bodies must appoint a data protection officer.

Label: Fire and rescue - co-operation with creation of corporation sole
Description:
The Secretary of State may make proposals for an Order to create a corporation sole as the fire and rescue authority for the area specified in the order, and
for the person who is for the time being the police and crime commissioner for the relevant police area to be for the time being that fire and rescue authority. The relevant local authorities must cooperate with those proposals.

Label: Fire and rescue - authorisation for Chief Constable to carry out Fire and Rescue functions
Description: A Mayor of a combined authority may authorise the Chief Constable to carry out the functions of a fire and rescue authority where an Order has been made by the Secretary of State, to the extent permitted by the Order.

Label: Burial and cremation - charging for municipal funeral
Description: An authority may recover from the estate of the deceased person expenses incurred under subsection (1) or subsection (2) above.
